Fariza has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband’s agriculture business. With the loan investment, he will buy seeds and fertilizers for growing different crops and he will earn more profits from his business.

Fariza is an embroidery and sewing expert and works for her neighboring clients. She is very artistic in her work and receives a good number of orders every month.

She has given birth to six children. Three of them work in a factory while the remaining three are studying.

She is also a very good housewife and performs her household duties very well.

Her husband has been operating his business for the past many years and Fariza is hopeful that an investment will help him make his business more profitable.

Note:"In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Fariza."

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for an agriculture business.

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.ru: Илхомджон женат и любящий отец двоих детей. Его дети еще маленькие и жена присматривает за ними. Ради содержания своих детей Илхомджон начал заниматься скотоводством 5 лет назад. С начало у него был один скот в обороте, со временем он расширил свой бизнес, а сейчас имеет 4 поголовье крупного рогатого скота. Данный момент он хочет еще  добавить несколько голов в оборот, с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Ilhomjon is married and the loving father of two children.  His children are still small and his wife watches after them.   Five years ago Ilhomjon began raising cattle for the sake of supporting his children.  At the beginning, he only had one, but with time he expanded his business and now he has four head of cattle. Now, with the goal of expanding his business, he would like to add several head more.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Angel Jesus

texts.es:
Angel es un hombre muy trabajador, vive en la ciudad de Camaná, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo es una ciudad que se caracteriza por desarrollarse la agricultura en especial el cultivo de arroz, maíz, frejoles, entre otros. Día a día Angel trabaja como maestro constructor, el le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 2 clientes diariamente, ya que depende del tamaño de la obra que realice, Angel cree que le está saliendo adelante con su trabajo porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Angel está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar madera para poder realizar sus trabajos de construcción, ya que actualmente tiene que alquilar las maderas y así el podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Comprar un trompo mezclador”.
texts.en:
Angel is a very hardworking man. He lives in the city of Camaná, which is characterized as having a warm and pleasing climate. It is also a city described as having agriculture, especially growing corn, beans and more. Day to day Angel works as a master builder. He works around 10 hours a day and can attend to up to 2 customers a day, depending on the size of the job he does. Angel believes that he is getting ahead with his job because he is very friendly to the customers and above all because he really wants to get ahead.

Angel is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he will be able to do some construction work. RIght now he has to rent the lumber and this way he can improve his income and keep working to be able to make his biggest dream come true: buying a mixer.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Jean Batiste

texts.en:
Jean Batiste is 47 years old, married man with 5 children aged between 6 and 18 years. They all go to school. He has farmed for 8 years and will use the loan from kiva to buy fertilizers to use to pay who harvested maize and to sell the maize. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay who harvested maize and to sell the maize.

loans.name: Sarin's Group

texts.en: Sarin’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sarin makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Romana

texts.en: My name is Romana M. and I own a food stand that sells items such as fried bananas, bread with beans, tortillas, salads, hot dogs, and enchiladas.  I have had my business for three years, and my daughter helps me to prepare the food and wait on customers.  My clients are all very good people, and my stand is located near the bus terminal so there are always a lot of customers.  My goal is to increase my inventory so that I can save enough money to remodel my house, support my family, and pay for a good education for my daughter.

loans.use: To purchase bananas, beans, butter, cheese, tortillas, plates, cups, salt, sugar, meat, bread and coffee for my food stand.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Small community retail outlets are quite a vibrant activity  in Angie's community, Madina, in Ghana. Angie is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and has been trained in the TEACH lending model. Angie is now able to keep simple records of her business. She requires a loan of $800 from KIVA to support her retail outlet operations.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Choa

texts.en:
Mrs. Choa S. M., 28 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She operates a laundry business and typically makes around $3/day. Her husband (pictured here with her mother who lives with her) runs a hair salon and makes around $4/day, which helps in financing the entire family. Her children, meanwhile, attend school and assist her whenever they are free.

Choa S. M. is asking for $500 loan to facilitate her husband's business by purchasing some tools to supply in his shop and another part of the money is to repair their house. In the future, S. M. is thinking about being able to expand the hair salon as well as keep sponsoring her children to have a better quality of education.

loans.use: To purchase some tools for a hair salon and part of money is to repair house.

loans.name: Marisela

texts.es:
Marisela lives in Creel, Chihuahua located north of Mexico. She is married and her husband lives in the United States. Her husband sends her money whenever he can. Marisela started her own business selling used clothes to take care of her monthly bills whenever her husband is unable to send her money. She started selling a few items of clothing at first, but due to her friendly nature and her motivation, her business has grown. Now she has a bigger inventory and her sales have increased substantially.

Marisela would like for her business to continue to grow so that her husband can one day return home and they can be together. She needs a loan in the amount of $1,200 USD which she will use to purchase more inventory to offer a variety of products to her clients and increase sales. She commits to repay this amount within 6 months. Be part of this business by helping this family be reunited! They greatly appreciate it!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Al norte de México, en la localidad de Creel, Chihuahua vive Marisela, ella es casada y su esposo trabaja en Estados Unidos, en ocasiones le es muy difícil enviarle dinero a Marisela y para poder cubrir sus gastos ella inició su propio negocio vendiendo ropa usada, inició con muy poca mercancía pero sus ganas de salir adelante y su carácter que le facilita relacionarse con los demás le han ayudado a hacer crecer su negocio, ahora cuenta con un mejor surtido y sus ventas han crecido considerablemente.

Marisela quiere hacer crecer su negocio para que su esposo pueda regresar y estar juntos, ahora necesita de un préstamo de $ 1,200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes e incrementar sus ventas, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte del crecimiento de este negocio y ayuda a que esta familia pueda estar unida, ellos agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Amado

texts.en:
Amado is 54 years old, is married and has 5 children, 3 of whom live with him. All of his children are either studying or working in various jobs. The youngest is still in high school, another studying accounting in university, and the other three work as an accountant, a dressmaker, and in sales. 
He owns his own contracting business and has been working in construction his whole life, learning everything he knows from working with his father. He has been working hard his whole life to make sure that all of his children would have the opportunity to get an education and become professionals.
He is a very active member of the community as well, acting as the president of a cooperative, and a secretary on two parents school boards. He is very happy that through his business, and through the loans that he receives, he is able to employ people in the community who might not otherwise have work. He realizes that opportunities in his country is limited and is thankful that this foundation has helped give opportunities to many people in his community. He will use this loan as operative capital and purchase of cement, sand and bricks. 
His dream for the future is to leave his contracting business and open a dressmaking business with his daughter as it is currently a very lucrative industry in Paraguay.

loans.use: Purchase of cement, sand and bricks

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
HALIMA, a widow in her early forties, lives with her 4-year-old orphaned niece and supports her teenage son who is currently attending boarding school. A year ago, Halima opened a diner called “Mama Lishe Halima” (Swahili for Mama Halima’s Café), where she serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner from 7a.m. onward. Before this business, her income was dependent on selling clothes, but she found this business to be an unreliable source of income since her customers often did not pay her the full amount on the spot. As a result, she took out a loan and found the confidence in herself to start a new trade.

Halima’s diner now makes a profit of around $20 a day. The diner holds about 10 customers at a time, but people can eat outside as well. As business is currently going well, and she was able to pay back her first loan successfully, her hope is to take out another loan in order to begin serving French fry dishes. Halima currently hires a helper for half the day and has plans to hire another helper to be in charge of cooking the French fries. She also has plans of setting up umbrella booths in front of her diner where people can eat them.

Halima belongs to the group Dhahabu (Swahili for “gold”), which consists of 36 other members who keep each other accountable and insure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To hire an additional helper and to set up outdoor umbrella booths for customers

loans.name: Saturday

texts.en: Mr. Saturday Ulehor is 32 years old, married and has one child.  He hails from Benin City.  He operates a drug store and has been in this business since 1999.  He is requesting a the loan of $525 to enable him buy more drugs to stock his store.  He promises to pay back this loan within 8 months.

loans.use: To buy additional stock for his drug store

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mrs. Pov N. and her husband have been married since 1985. They have three children—two sons and one daughter. Pov and her family live in a fertile farming area along the Tonle Bassac (river), a tributary of the Mekong, several kilometers south of Phnom Penh. She has been in the business of selling bananas and guavas since 2003. She buys bananas and guavas from farms in her village for reselling at a market in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a construction worker. 

She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the second time in the amount of $300. She will use this loan to purchase bananas and guavas from farms in her village for reselling at a market in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: For buying flowers and guavas for reselling

loans.name: Narirurwe West C Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Aisha N.. She currently has a business selling clothing. She is requesting a loan to increase the inventory of clothes to sell. Aisha is 33 years old and is married. Her husband has a butcher shop. She has 4 children ranging from ages 6 to 18 and her children go to school.

Each week, Aisha makes approximately 350000 UGX (about $205) profit. With the extra profit gained from increasing the clothing sales, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children. Aisha has had a loan for 100000 UGX (about $60) from BRAC Uganda in the past in order to invest in her business, and the loan was paid back on time.

Aisha is joined in her small group by Habiba N., Zawija Biriabwa, Rose K., Lukia N., and Harriet N.. Habiba N. has a talioring business and wants to set up a shop selling clothes. Zawija Biriabwa has a butcher shop and sells the meat, and wants a loan to buy more animals for slaughtering. Rose K. has a retail shop and wants to increase the stock. Lukia N. currently has a tailoring business and is requesting a loan to buy more sewing machines. Harriet N. sells charcoal and intends to purchase more sacks of charcoal from villages.

loans.use: To increase clothing sales

loans.name: Israel

texts.en:
Israel, aged 38 years, has been a fisherman and fish seller to customers for seven years. He is looking for a loan to enable him to buy maize, rice and flour to expand his existing fishing trade by selling grain to shops.

He is hardworking and determined, as he has six of his own children to support, along with five orphans who live with him and his wife.

loans.use: Israel isseeking a loan to enable him to buy maize, rice and flour to expand his existing fishing trade by selling grain to shops.

loans.name: Griselda Guadalupe

texts.es:
Griselda works selling jewellery. She started this business five years ago with some money which she had saved because she had always liked sales and it was an activity in which she had done well: she also needed extra income to help her husband with the household expenses and those of their small two children. Currently the business is doing very well.

She is asking for a loan of $775 USD which she will repay in 6 months to make renovations to her business site. With your help, Griselda will continue moving forward.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Griselda se dedica a la venta de joyería inicio su negocio hace 5 años con algo de dinero que tenia ahorrado porque siempre le han gustado las ventas y era una actividad en la que le había ido bien, además que necesitaba un ingreso extra para apoyar a su marido con los gastos del hogar y de sus 2 pequeños hijos. Actualmente le va muy bien con este negocio.

Ella solicita un crédito por US $775 que pagara en 6 meses para hacer remodelaciones a su negocio. Con tu apoyo Griselda seguirá adelante.

loans.use: To make renovations

loans.name: Milly

texts.en: Milly is a young and promising entrepreneur who is working hard to earn a living and to fend for her newborn daughter.  Milly operates a small business, which she started just one and a half years ago, where she sells silver jewels. Milly’s big dream is to own a big establishment where she can sell a great deal of jewels and other women’s clothing.  Meanwhile, she’ll keep working hard to offer new products to her customers and to attract new customers. With this loan, Milly would like to buy more goods to add to her stock.

loans.use: To puchase additional silver jewels to retail in her community.

loans.name: Jose Fabian

texts.es:
Mr. Fabian R. is a 29-year-old hard-working young man, he sells soft drinks, stuffed tortillas, tacos and cheese in order to obtain the income to be able to support his partner and his 2 children, 4 and 2 years old respectively. He lives in the city of Juigalpa of the department of Chontales. Mr. R. works hard to improve the condition of his house and the loan money will be use to improve his home. He will be changing the roof in order to avoid the disadvantages of the winter arrival.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Fabian R. es un joven trabajador de 29 años de edad, el se dedica a la venta de refrescos, enchiladas, tacos y quesillos con el fin de obtener ingresos que le ayudan a alimentar a su compañera de vida y a sus 2 hijos, uno de 4 y 2 años respectivamente. Habita en la ciudad de Juigalpa del departamento de Chontales. El Sr. R. lucha por acondicionar su casa y el dinero que reciba lo utilizará para mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo de la misma y asi evitar inconvenientes con la llegada del invierno.

loans.use: Change the roof of her house.

loans.name: Chrek

texts.en: Chrek O. lives in the Kampong Cham province with her husband, Daoy Nat, her elderly mother, and her two younger sisters. She goes to the market each day and sells her handicrafts, making US$1.50 each day, while her husband works in construction. Her husband typically makes US$1.50 each day as well, but feels that he could increase his income and improve his business through the purchase of some new construction tools. Chrek O. has asked for a loan of US$700 to purchase these construction tools for her husband and to expand his business. She believes that this will be a good investment for her family, and it provides an opportunity for her to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase construction tools

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. L. Thi Nguyen is 30 years old. Currently she and her husband are running a refreshment beverage café out of their home. She has two children who are going to school. With a favorable storefront position and high quality customer service, the café is always able to attract a large number of customers. The family’s income is increasing day by day. Besides the main business at the café, the couple also raise pigs to supplement their income and invest in the children’s schooling. In this round of funding she is requesting 15,000,000 VND to buy more types of beers and beverages to sell. Their average monthly income is 3,000,000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Liên năm nay 30 tuổi, hiện nay hai vợ chồng chị đang kinh doanh cửa hàng giải khát tại gia đình.Gia đình chị hiện có hai con đang tuổi đi học. Với vị trí kinh doanh thuận lợi và thái độ phục vụ khách hàng chu đáo cửa hàng của gia đình chị luôn thu hút được số lượng khách hàng rất đông. Thu nhập của gia đình chị ngày càng được cải thiện. Ngoài thời gian làm việc tại cửa hàng vợ chồng chị còn kết hợp chăn nuôi thêm lợn để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình và đầu tư cho các con ăn học. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.0000.000 đ để đầu tư mua thêm các loại bia, nước uống giải khát để bán cho khách hàng. Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Buy more beers, beverages

loans.name: Oem

texts.en:
Mrs. Oem L. was born in 1949, and she lives in Preak Ta Ong Ti Pie Village in Kandal Province. She makes mats for a living. Meanwhile, her husband, Mr. Pich Pov (pictured on the left of the photograph), is a wedding chef. Notably, her husband earns less money between June and September than he does during the balance of the year because there are fewer wedding ceremonies during those particular months; then again, her husband can earn more income from January to May and from October to December.

In Mrs. Oem L.'s business, she does not have enough raw materials to make mats, so she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. As such, with the requested loan proceeds, she will address her shortage of raw materials by purchasing inputs to make mats. Mrs. Oem L. notes that she has two children who assist her with the business.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to make mats.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es: Pamela es una mujer muy trabajadora, dedicada a su tienda de abarrotes que con mucho esfuerzo logró adquirir junto a su esposo, gracias a la venta de artesanía, juntos elaborar collares y diversos adornos de decoración con semillas e hilos muy costosos y muy solicitados por los artesanos.Pamela desea contribuir con su pareja, quien desea viajar a la selva amazónica y traer estas singulares semillas, venderlas a los artesanos de su zona, además de los materiales que ellos necesitan para la producción de sus diversos adornos.Por ello, requieren de una suma de dinero que será invertida primeramente en adquirir algunos productos para su bodega y también para la actividad de artesano de su esposo, y así pueda viajar a la selva amazónica y traer gran cantidad de materia prima y artículos novedosos para ser ofrecidos a los turistas.
texts.en:
Pamela is a very hard-working woman dedicated to her grocery store, which she managed to acquire with great effort along with her husband, thanks to the sale of handicrafts. Together they embellish necklaces and various ornaments decorated with seeds and wires that are very expensive and highly sought after by artisans. Pamela wants to contribute with her partner, who wants to travel to the Amazon jungle and bring back these unique seeds, selling them to artisans in their area, in addition to the materials they need to produce the various adornments. For this they require a sum of money to be invested primarily in purchasing some products for their store and also for the handicraft activity of her husband, and thus they can travel to the Amazon jungle and bring back large quantities of raw materials and innovative items to be offered to tourists .

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the merchandise in their store in addition to paying for travel expenses of her husband to get materials to make his handicrafts

loans.name: Time's Group

texts.en:
Time J. has been selling maandazi in the Darajabovu neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. Maandazi is a small, square, fried food of semi-sweet dough, similar to a donut. She works for six hours every day and earns a profit of approximately $25 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more ingredients for maandazi, like flour, sugar, and oil. If this loan helps her to expand her business, she intends to use the increased profits to reinvest in her business so that it can continue to grow.

Time is 28 years old, married, and has two children, aged 2 and 11. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Aisha, Sauda, Mkasi, Mpoti, and Mwawuma. Each woman has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for her maandazi business.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en: Gulnora A. operates a small business selling baby clothes and supplies in Penjikent, Tajikistan. She has an attractively arranged store in the Penjikent market in Tajikistan where she carries all sorts of necessary items for new mothers including toys. Gulnora has been in business for about 4 years and has developed a stable, profitable enterprise based on products that are always in demand. Her business has become the main source of income for her and her husband. Since Gulnora’s business is growing, she is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni ($ 750 USD) to increase her working capital and help boost the further development of her business. With your help this will be possible.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes for sale.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
El g/s  SAN FRANCISCO están en su decimo ciclo son de la comunidad de san francisco de campusano, comunidad de Nindiri  son personas humildes pero emprendedoras, tienen la primaria aprobada y eso les permites ser bien expresivas y han logrado salir adelante porque ellas han perdido la timidez, y eso se lo deben a adim que las ha capacitado. Sus créditos los han invertidos en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de pan el cual después lo ofertan en pulperías por docenas
Con el crédito de adim han tenido la oportunidad de mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia, ya que con las ganancias además de invertir en sus negocios también han realizado mejoras en sus hogares. Doña Carolina es madre soltera ella vende cosméticos por encargo  y no cuenta con ningún tipo de apoyo del padre de sus hijos considera que gracias a ADIM ha podido enfrentar la vida y cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia y le ha permitido a sus hijos asistir a la escuela.
texts.en:
The group San Francisco is in its 10th cycle. The members are of the Saint Francisco of Campusano community in Nindiri. They are humble people but enterprising; they have the primary approval (for their loan) and that has let them be more expressive and more successful because they have lost their shyness. They owe this to Kiva partner ADIM, who has helped them. Their loans have been invested in the purchase of ingredients for baking bread, which is later sold by the dozen in stores. With the loans from ADIM, they have had the opportunity to improve the lives of their families. They have both invested their profits in their businesses as well as used them to fix up their homes. Carolina is a single mother. She sells cosmetics by order ** and has not had any sort of help from her children's father. Thanks to ADIM, she has been able to face life and take care of her family's basic necessities, and her children have been able to attend school. ** Translator's note: There was not a clear English translation for "vender cosmeticos por encargo," but it sounds like this is a Mary Kay-type of business, with customers ordering the makeup through a catalog that Carolina shows them.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying products for their businesses as well as other operating expenses

loans.name: Cheav

texts.en: Cheav T., 33, is married and lives with her husband in Bati district, Takeo province. She grows vegetables and weaves scarves to earn a living and is able to make $6 a day, while her husband, Heng Yut, is a construction worker building houses. On average, he makes $2 a day. This couple together has two children. Most of the people who live in Bati district usually grow crops and weave to raise their families. Mrs. Cheav T. is requesting a loan from Kiva via Credit to purchase more silk to weave more scarves.

loans.use: To purchase more silk.

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en: Rovshan was born in 1972. He lives in Baku city. He has been in the business of building houses for three years. Now he needs a loan of 950 AZN to buy the necessary supplies for building houses.

loans.use: To buy supplies for building houses

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola L. is from the village of Sitio Anguapan located in Barangay Sto Nińo Tumauini, Isabela - a small village where farming is the main source of income for most people.  

She is 48 years of age and married to Wilfredo, who is 46 years old and works as a simple farmer in the village.  They are blessed with three children named Jerome -16 years old and in his fourth year of high school, Jolibeth -14 years old and in her third year of high school, and the youngest is Carol - only 3 years old.  Viola is trying her best to send her children to school until college with the simple business she maintains.   

Viola has been raising goats in their village for almost four years already.  She is fond of doing the business since it doesn’t require lots of capital to maintain.  She just brings them to grasslands near their house and cuddles her youngest daughter while they are pasturing. 

She wishes to avail a loan amounting to PHP4, 000 to help her husband provide for the needs of their family by means of engaging in another business.  She said that it will be of great assistance to her family if her loan is approved, especially for her children who are currently studying.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Adeniye

texts.en:
Adeniye lives in Iyana Orile in the Lagos state of Nigeria. She sells dry gin in her shop. Adeniye has been in this business for the past six years. Adeniye is 55 years old and married with four children.

Adeniye has been borrowing from Kiva's partner LAPO Microfinance for the past three years and the loans have boosted her productivity and profitability. Adeniye is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more dry gin to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more dry gin to sell

loans.name: Subira Huvuta Kheri Group

texts.en:
For the last year, Maryam has made a living selling fish and chicken in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar. She  earns an average monthly profit of $90, and works at her business for 12 hours a day.  

Maryam is applying for her first loan from BRAC Tanzania and plans to use it to buy more fish and chicken to sell to her customers. She is hoping that this loan will help her increase her income and grow her business.  

Maryam is 25 years old, married, and has three children ages 8, 5 and 3. She will be sharing this loan with the two other members of her loan group, Mkasi and Ukuli. Each woman also has her own small business in Zanzibar

loans.use: To buy more fish and chicken to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es: Aydee tiene 26 años, vive con su hijo de 7 años. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a vender productos de primera necesidad, en un inicio arrendaba un pequeño local, pero en la actualidad lo hace en su propia casa, donde atiende todo el día y a la vez puede estar pendiente de su hijo. Aydee tiene mucho cuidado de la cantidad y tipo de producto que va vendiendo para, según la demanda, comprar mercadería al por mayor. Para más adelante desea tener su tienda de comestibles en una zona más céntrica y comercial de su localidad para que pueda crecer en sus ventas. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy agradecida con su banco comunal que le ha enseñado la solidaridad que ahora promueve entre las personas que conoce. El dinero que viene solicitando es para la compra de víveres al por mayor como arroz, azúcar, dulces y gaseosas.
texts.en:
Aydee is 26 years old and lives with her son who is 7 years of age. For the last two years she has worked selling essential products. In the beginning she rented a small storefront, but currently she works out of her own home where she serves customers all day and at the same time cares for her son. Aydee is very careful about the amount and type of products she sells and, based on the demand, she buys merchandise wholesale. In the future her wish is to have a grocery store in an area that is more central and commercial than her current location to be able to increase her sales. It is her second loan with MFP and she is very thankful that her communal bank has taught her the solidarity that she now promotes among the people she meets. The money that she is requesting is for the purchase of products wholesale such as rice, sugar, sweets and soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace G. is 49 years old. She is married and has seven children, four sons and three daughters. She says some are in the senior high while others are in the junior high school. The firstborn, however, is in the tertiary. Grace lives with her children and husband in a family house in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a teacher by profession. 

Grace is a baker. She bakes bread. She sells her bread on a table top in the market square. Grace also supplies the greater part of the bread to retailers in her community. She procures bags of flour and other ingredients from Dormaa. She has been in business for more than 25 years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn S., 33, is from the village of Locsoon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns ~2,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Jocelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her immediate family members. 


About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Vicente Boavida

texts.pt:
Vicente Boavida N. de 64 anos de idade, nasceu na província de Gazao (a 240km de Maputo), casado oficial e pai de quatro filhos maiores de idade e estão todos a trabalhar.
Parou de estudar na segunda classe porque os seus progenitores não tinham condições financeiras. Não sustenta mais ninguém senao a esposa.

Chegou a boane a 48 anos a procura de melhores condições de vida e vive na casa do do estado com sua esposa. É funcionário do Governo a 30 anos e trabalha como servente da administradora do distrito de boane tendo salário mensal de 3.000,00mt.

Teve informações sobre a existência da hluvukua traves de amigos e nunca teve empréstimos com outros bancos. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo no valor de 10.000,00MT que pretende comprar material de construção. O primeiro crédito foi de 8.000,00Mt para compra de bens de consumo. 

Propõe se a pagar em harmonia com o plano de prestações para terminar cedo a sua casa que esta cosntruindo em fases, para depois mobiliar.
texts.en:
Vicente Boavida N. is 64 years old. He was born in the province of Gazao, 240 km from Maputo. He is married and has four adult children who are all working. He had to stop going to school in the second grade because of his parents' lack of financial resources. He doesn't support anyone else, apart from his wife. He came to Boane when he was 48, seeking improved quality of life, and he lives with his wife in government housing. He's been a civil servant for 30 years and works for the district administrator of Boane. He earns a monthly salary of 3000 meticals. He heard about Hluvuku through friends and has never obtained loans from other banks. This is his second loan, in the amount of 10,000 meticals, which he plans to use to purchase construction materials. His first loan was for 8000 meticals, which he used to buy consumer goods. He intends to pay off this loan in accordance with the loan schedule so he can finish the house he's building soon and be able to furnish it.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build family house

loans.name: Rebecca Akoth

texts.en: Rebecca owns a retail shop and salon in Nyalenda, near Kisumu, Kenya. Her shop started as a hair salon. Rebecca employs two other people to wash, relax, and style hair. They also do manicures and pedicures. Many of her customers are her neighbors, but some people come from far away because they know of her work. One of the challenges of her business is that if customers don’t have any income, they stop coming to her salon. Therefore, she decided to diversify her offerings and she began to sell other basic grocery items like sugar and onge out of the same shop. Rebecca is a 30 years old, married, and the mother of three. Her children range from 3-10 years old. Her husband works casually and does not have a permanent job. Besides running this salon, Rebecca is a Community Healthcare Worker; a volunteer in her community. For two days each week she visits sick people in their homes, and counsels them and their caretakers. Rebecca will use this loan to stock her shop; she will buy more of the products that she is running out of. Rebecca hopes that someday she will be able to grow her business into a large salon with many employees and workstations. Her biggest dream is to open a hairdressing school. About K-MET: K-MET, the NGO giving the loan, is unique in that it is not a traditional microfinance institution. Rather, it is a development organization focused on raising health standards in Kenya. Many of the loan recipients from this organization are volunteer community healthcare workers like Rebecca. For more information about K-MET, click here: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=24.

loans.use: To restock popular items in her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock his shop

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 41 years old. She and her husband Ernesto Jr. live and work in the village of Cabaruan in Cauayan City. Tessie maintains a beauty salon business in the market, and Ernesto manages a repair shop. They have a teenaged child named Jael Gaye, who is a college student.

Tessie worked as a teacher for almost three years before she decided to engage in her beauty salon business. Her salon is located on Cancillier Avenue in Cauayan City, and she has four staff members who assist her in providing hairdressing, makeover, and spa services. She also sells beauty products in the salon.

She wants the business to be well-known and hopes to expand it to other areas someday. However, she needs more capital, and with this in mind she is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders in the amount of PHP 50,000. With this amount, she is positive that she can turn her plans into reality.

loans.use: To expand her business to other areas.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a 41-year-old father of one. An auditor and manufacturer, Godfrey owns a cosmetics manufacturing company in Nairobi. He has been in this business for the past fourteen years after early retirement from the civil service. Godfrey is requesting a loan of Kes 50,000 in order to add to his stock of raw materials. Godfrey hopes to raise a God-fearing family. He describes himself as ambitious, focused and genuine. About Faulu Kenya: Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add to his stock of raw materials

loans.name: Believe In God Group

texts.en:
This is Zainab F., Jariatu B., Isatu K. and Isatu M.. They called their group Believe In God II. This is the first loan they are receiving from SMT/Kiva. They’re requesting a loan of Le 500,000 for each to enable them expand  their businesses. This will helped them a lot. They will able to make a lot of profit from the loan, thus be able to solve many of their problems. 

Zainab B. (left) is the leader of this group. Zainab was born in a village called Rotufunk. She is twenty-six years of age, married to a businessman and they have three children. One of her children is in class five, the other is in class three and the last is still not of school going age. Zainab sells fire-woods and charcoals. She has been in this business for over ten years now. With this loan, she will be able to buy 200 – 300 bags of charcoals and forty – fifty piles of fire-woods.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Enrique vive en anticrético con su mamá y su hermano en la Av. Buenos Aires de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que el realiza es el servicio de amplificación, animando todo tipo de acontecimientos sociales. Con esta actividad él mantiene a su familia; el crédito que solicita es para compra de parlantes y juego de luces, de esta manera tener mas clientes y ofrecer un mejor servicio.

Es cliente de Impro y paga muy bien, también fue parte de Kiva por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Enrique lives in a leased home with his mother and sister on Buenos Aires Ave. in the City of La Paz. He is engaged in the business of providing amplification services, where he is able to liven up many types of social events. With this business he supports his family. The loan that he requests is to purchase loudspeakers and lighting so that he can have more customers and offer them better services. He is a client of IMPRO has also worked with Kiva previously. He makes his payments well so that he can access additional loans.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy loudspeakers and lighting for his amplification business which amplifies many social events

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianey

texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianey T. is 33 years old and is married with two children. He lives in Northern Province, Rwanda, three hours drive from the capital city of Kigali.

A true entrepreneur, Jean Marie Vianey has had his shop for the past five years and it is operating successfully. His business is open from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. every day.

Jean Marie Vianey is requesting his first loan from Vision Finance Company to use as general working capital and to expand his business by purchasing more variety of inventory for his shop. With that expansion, Jean Marie Vianey hopes to change the life of his family for the better.

loans.use: To use as working capital and to add variety to his inventory

loans.name: G.s. La Paz  Ii Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario compuesto por dos personas, tiene 12 créditos y es uno de los grupos que han sido responsables con su cuota. La señora Dominga vende ropa la cual ella elabora ya que es costurera. Desde hace 25 años que se dedica a este negocio, tiene 52 años de edad y junto a su esposo se han esforzado para sacar adelante a la familia ya que es una de sus prioridades es que su hija logre salir adelante, solicita un financiamiento para la compra de materia prima del negocio, ella vende su producto en Managua y la paz centro y cuenta con todos los servicio básicos.

La señora Virginia posee un negocio que es la sastrería,  vende su producto en el mercado oriental y en la paz centro desde hace 35 años,  es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando ya que con su esfuerzo a logrado sacarlos adelante, solicita un financiamiento para invertirlo en la compra de materia prima del negocio. el sueño de estas 2 mujeres es que sus familias cuenten con los ingresos necesarios.
texts.en:
This unified group is comprised of two people. They have 12 loans, and they are one of the groups that has been responsible with their payment. Dominga is a seamstress, and she sells clothes that she makes. She has been in this business for 25 years. She is 52. Together with her husband they have put forth great effort to get their family ahead. One of their priorities is to have their daughter be successful. She is asking for a loan to buy raw material for her business. She sells her products in Managua and La Paz. She has all of the basic services. Virginia has a tailoring business. For 35 years she has been selling her products in the Oriental Market and in the La Paz center. She is a single mother, and she has two children who go to school. Through her efforts she has gotten them ahead. She is asking for a loan to buy raw material for her business. The dream of these two women is that their families have the needed income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Resvic

texts.en:
Resvic J. is from the town of Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old, married, and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Resvic owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale.

In 2005, Resvic joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Resvic from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: buy feed for her pregnant pig

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es:
La socia YESSICA es una futura madre de familia que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”. 

La socia tiene 21 años de edad, es conviviente y esta embarazada. Ella vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la comunidad de Angostura que se encuentra ubicada al sur de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella tiene un pequeño restaurante donde vende desayuno almuerzo y cena. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para abrir otro restaurante por el distrito de San Jerónimo quiere comprar sillas, mesas, platos, cubiertos y ollas.  
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yessica is a member of the commune bank “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA” and a future mother. She is 21 years old, she lives in a partnership and she is pregnant. She lives in the San Jerónimo district in the Angostura community, which is located south of the city of Cusco. She has a small restaurant where she serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. She has run this business for several years and very successfully, thanks to her hard work. This member of our commune bank is a working mother and a business woman, who takes care of her family. She requests a loan to open another restaurant in the San Jerónimo district; she needs to buy chairs, tables, dishes, pots and table sets. Yessica is very grateful for this opportunity and she is commited to fully repay the loan according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy furnishing stuff for a new restaurant.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit M. was born in 1951 in Ijevan. She and her husband have 3 children who are already married and live separately from their parents. Anahit worked at Ijevan high school as a teacher till she retired on a pension. In 2001 she and her husband organized their own business in a rented space. This business consists of food and mixed product sales. During these years they have built up their own shop and have bought furniture for their house.

Anahit’s shop has a reputation in Ijevan of having the cheapest products for retail and wholesale purchasing. Anahit asks for a 900.000 AMD loan to buy food wholesale and New Year's tree decorations for her shop. With future income she intends to do some construction on her house.

loans.use: To buy wholesale food and New Year's tree decorations for her shop

loans.name: El Carnen Group

texts.es:
El grupo El Carmen está integrado por Jerónima Alejandrina R., Rosibel Angélica T. M. y Álvaro de Jesús C. tres personas trabajadoras, responsables y con mucha esperanza.

Jerónima Alejandrina R. de 38 años empezó vendiendo tortillas cuando ahorro lo suficiente puso un puesto en el mercado donde vende calculadoras desde hace 6 años. 

Su compañera de grupo Rosibel Angélica T. M. produce y vende frutas y verduras en el mercado. Mientras Álvaro de Jesús C. es agricultor desde que nació y comercializa lo que produce.
texts.en:
The El Carmen Group consists of Jerónima Alejandrina R., Rosibel Angélica T. M. and Álvaro de Jesús C., three hard-working and responsible people with high hopes. Jerónima is 38 years old and started out selling tortillas and saved enough to have her own post in the market where she has sold calculators for the past six years. Her partner in the group, Rosibel, grows fruits and vegetables and sells them at the markets. Meanwhile, Álvaro has been a farmer since he was born and sells what he grows.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calculators and other supplies

loans.name: Carolina Del Pilar

texts.es:
Carolina tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera, la mayor de cuatro hermanos y vive en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el caserío La Legua, del distrito de Catacaos, provincia de Piura en la región Piura, ubicada a 3 horas y 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Gracias a sus ahorros pudo instalar una pequeña bodega en casa de sus padres. Ella nos cuenta que la iniciativa de este negocio nació debido a que quería apoyar a sus padres en el sostenimiento de su hogar y en la educación de sus hermanos. En su establecimiento Carolina ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de abarrotes y bebidas.

Carolina desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos para ofrecérselos en venta a sus clientes, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro de su objetivo.

Carolina es una joven responsable, activa y muy emprendedora. Su más grande anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria hasta llegar a tener un minimarket en su domicilio
texts.en:
Carolina is 20 years old, single, and the oldest of four siblings. She lives at home with her parents in the village of La Legua in the District of Catacaos, Piura Province. This community is located three hours and twenty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Using her savings, Carolina opened a small grocery store in her parents’ house. She tells us she started this business because she wanted to help her parents with the household expenses and the education of her siblings. Her store offers her customers all types of groceries and beverages.

Carolina wants to expand her business by purchasing more products to offer to her customers, but she does not have sufficient capital to take further action. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 soles so that she can achieve her objective.

Carolina is a responsible, active, and enterprising young woman. Her greatest dream is to continue growing her business to the point when she can convert it into a mini-market.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Secondiano

texts.en:
Secondiano P. is from the village of Centro Napu, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is 81 years old. Secondiano is widowed and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Secondiano owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting coconuts for sale. Secondiano has been engaged in his business for over 25 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Secondiano joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Secondiano has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to pay for services to increase crop yield. Secondiano is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used for the re-acquisition of pawned parcel of land. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Secondiano from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: for the re-acquisition of  pawned parcel of land

loans.name: Guiller

texts.en:
Guiller Y. is from the village of Purok 4 Poblacion, Initao, Misamis Oriental. He is fifty-one years old. Guiller is married and has two grown children. To make a living, Guiller owns and operates a specialized retail store in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for his business comes primarily from selling vegetables, spices, and cooking ingredients in the local community. Guiller has been engaged in his business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Guiller joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Guiller is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP that he will use to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Abduvali

texts.ru: Рахмонов Абдували проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 49 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Абдували имеет средне- специальное образование. Он фармацевт. Имеет большой опыт в этой сфере. У него аптека, где он продает лекарства. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Abduvali R. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 49 years old, married and has 4 children. Abduvali has a secondary-specialized education. He is a pharmacist and has a lot of experience in this field. He has a pharmacy, where he sells medicines. He is requesting the loan in order to increase goods turnover. He wants to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Alba Marina

texts.es: Alba tiene 52 años, por lo que su actividad es la una librería y la venta de ropa. Por lo que tiene más de 32 años de dedicarse a este negocio, Alba siempre está buscando la manera de obtener ingresos para su familia. Esta no es la primera experiencia con financiamientos por lo que le han sido de ayuda necesaria para su negocio, además con ciertas ganancias logro comprar un poco de ropa para venderla a unos cuantos clientes. Sus 4 hijos trabajan de manera independiente y le ayudan en la atención con sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de cuadernos, lápices, borradores e invertir un poco en la compra de ropa. Su deseo es prosperar con sus 2 negocios.
texts.en:
Alba, 52, has a stationery store and also sells clothing. She has been in this line of work for over 32 years. Alba is always seeking ways to obtain income for her family. This isn't her first experience with financing; past loans have been of great help to her business. She used some of her profits to buy clothing to sell to a few customers. He four children work independently and help her with customer service. She will use the funds requested to buy notebooks, pencils and erasers as well as invest a bit in clothing. Her wish is to make progress with both of her businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy notebooks, pencils, erasers and clothing.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Muvule crescent,a business location in Jinja has quite an extraordinary pedigree when it comes to lucrative business franchises. There is a story connected with doing business in that neighborhood. It is a story of roaring trade deals.

Not to be left out of this opportunity is a certain 45-year-old hardworking retailer by the name of W. Dominic. This father of seven school-going children operates a thriving ten-year-old retail shop in Bufubuli, Muvule crescent. Since his business took root, he has steadily been making ends meet and earning profits. In a month, he reveals he makes 60,000 shillings. He also has another source of income he relies on that is selling sugarcane.

With this loan Dominic is highly optimistic that his business will make headway. He hopes to buy more merchandise for his shop.

Dominic W. appears at the left of the photo and in the Photo is also the Credit Officer responsible for him.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise for his retail shop

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina tiene 23 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo menor de edad, vive junto a su esposo en casa de sus suegros, ubicada en el anexo Monteverde del caserío Tranca Sasape, un sector rural del distrito de Mórrope, perteneciente a la provincia de Lambayeque, se encuentra ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella viene residiendo en la zona desde hace un año y desde entonces ha decidido apoyar a su esposo en el sostenimiento de su familia incursionando en la venta de cosméticos y productos de belleza vía catálogo. Ella se esfuerza por mantener su actividad, siempre buscando nuevos clientes a los cuales ofrecerles sus productos.

En los últimos meses su negocio está gozando de muy buena acogida por parte de sus clientes, por lo que está pensando en instalar un pequeño establecimiento en su domicilio en donde pueda ofrecer a sus clientes un stock permanente, de modo que no tengan que esperar siempre por su producto hasta fin de mes, que es cuando llega el pedido. Para lograr su objetivo ella se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Alejandrina es una madre bastante luchadora y que gusta mucho de sentirse activa. Su mayor anhelo es poder construir una casa para su familia en la zona donde actualmente residen. En el poco tiempo que lleva viviendo en el lugar, ella ha sabido ganarse a sus vecinos, los cuales la respetan y estiman mucho.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 23 years old. She is married and has a minor child. She lives with her husband in her parents-in-law's house, located in the Monteverde annex of the township of Tranca Sasape. It is a rural sector of the district of Mórrope, which belongs to the province of Lambayeque, located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. She has lived in the area for a year and since then has decided to help her husband support the family by getting into selling cosmetics and beauty products via catalog. She works hard to maintain her activity, always seeking new customers to whom to offer products. The the last few months, her business is enjoying popularity with her customers. Because of this, she is thinking of setting up a small establishment in her home where she can offer customers permanent stock. This way, they won't always have to wait until the end of the month for the products, when the orders come in. In order to attain her goal, she needs to ask Edpyme Alternativa, for the first time, for a loan of 500 nuevos soles. Alejandrina is a mother who is a fighter and she really likes to feel active. Her greatest wish is to be able to build a house for her family in the area where they live now. During the short time she has lived in the area, she has been able to win her neighbors over and they really respect and esteem her.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics to set up a sales establishment.

location.town: Anexo Monte Verde - Tranca Sasape - Morrope - Lamb

loans.name: Yarkamah Group

texts.en:
Lucy V. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Yarkamah #2. Lucy is 43 years old, married and has four children who range in ages from seven to 29 years old.  She was not able to attend school due to poverty.

For two years, she has been selling bowls, spoons, glasses, and cups at Golf Market in Garnersville, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She sells in a friendly manner which keeps customers returning. 

She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more stock to re-sell. Her goal is to grow her business and to continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Lucy is the borrower holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more bowls, cups, glasses and spoons to re-sell

loans.name: Cheikh Abdoul Aziz Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité CHEIKH ABDOUL AZIZ est l'un des huit groupes qui composent le Banc Villageois de DIAMAGUENE. Elle sont onze (11) femmes issues toutes du même quartier et ont formé le groupe par affinité depuis trois ans et demi. Elles sont d'âges différents variant de 30 à 45 ans, mariées et mères d'au moins 3 enfants. C'est groupe très soudé et dynamique et participe activement au différentes activités du Banc Villageois qui sont les réunions mensuelles, les réunions de remboursement, les rencontres de sensibilisation et autres.
leur activité principale est le petit commerce d'effets vestimentaires, d'encens, de produits cosmétiques etc...

Quant à la présidente du groupe Madame Ndack T., à l'extrême droit de la photo, en voile blanc sur la tête et sac à main accroché à son épaule est âgée de 52 ans, elle est veuve et vit avec ses deux enfants. Elle fait du petit commerce de montres, d'encens, de foulards, d'écharpes et de voiles. Elle s'approvisionne en Mauritanie, un pays frontalier du Sénégal, pour revendre son produit dans le quartier. Elle a une bonne expérience de son activité pour l'avoir mené depuis au moins trois ans. Et son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son approvisionnement en marchandises. Son objectif est de pouvoir faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et d'assurer les études universitaires d'un de ses enfants en année de licence.
texts.en:
The solidarity group CHEIKH ABDOUL AZIZ is one of the eight groups that make up the 'Banc Villageois' of DIAMAGUENE. The group is made up of 11 women who all come from the same neighborhood and who formed a group because of their common interests three and a half years ago. Their ages vary between 30 and 45 and they are married and the mothers of at least three children. This is a very close and dynamic group who participate actively in the various activities of the Banc Villageois, monthly meetings, meetings to repay loans, training sessions, etc. Their main business is selling clothing, incense, cosmetics, etc. As for the president of the group, Mrs. Ndack T., on the far right in the photo with a white head covering and handbag on her shoulder, she is 52, a widow, and lives with her two children. She sells watches, incense, head scarves, shawls, and veils. She buys her goods in Mauritania, a country which borders Senegal, and sells them in her neighborhood. She has a lot of experience in her business, having been in it for at least three years. Her new loan will allow her to expand her inventory. Her goal is to support her children and pay educational expenses for her child who is finishing university this year.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase the working capital of the solidarity group

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La Sra. Elsa P. tiene 59 años, es soltera cuenta tiene un hijo  a quien cuida ella sola.  
Ella se dedica a la venta de varioa productos como joyas, sabanas, lencería y otros por toda la ciudad recorriendo a pie, también ofrece sus mercaderías en los buces y en varios negocios, la mayoría de sus clientes son docentes quienes le pagan en cuotas.  
Su objetivo es alquilar un local para ofrecer sus mercaderías ya que es muy sacrificado recorrer las calles  para vender y además  daría una mejor atención a sus clientes.  
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de sabanas, colchas, lencerías, joyas, calzados, perfumes de varias marcas.
texts.en:
Sra. Elsa Pasmore, 59, is single and has one son for whom she is responsible. She operates a business selling various products: jewelry, bedding, tablecloths and other similar merchandise. She works as a street vendor, going all around the city on foot. She also sells on buses and at some businesses. Most of her customers are teachers who pay for what they buy a little at a time. Sra. Elsa wants to rent a shop where she can establish her business because working as a street vendor is too physically demanding for her. A shop would also allow her to provide a better service to her customers. Sra. Elsa is applying for a loan to buy various products--sheets, bedding, tableclothes, jewelry, footwear, perfumes--that she will resell.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana L. is from the village of Palao, Iligan City. She is 41 years old. Rosana is married and has two school-aged children. Rosana owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling eggs and also wholesailing and retailing of eggs in the local community. Rosana has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2009, Rosana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 8,000 PHP and was used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital.

Rosana is now requesting her third loan from HSPFI, for 10,000 PHP, which will be used to to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Palao, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Abdramane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdramane  T.  est âgé de 35 ans marié et père de quatre enfants. Il est domicilié à Banconi–Koulikoro, avec ses deux épouses et ses enfants, dans un des quartiers de la ville de  Sikasso.
Abdramane T. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initié à cette activité de stockage et commercialisation des céréales (maïs, mil, sorgho) depuis maintenant  plus de sept  ans. Il dispose de son magasin à Kaboïla I en face de la Clinique Guinso. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis l’année 2009. Il a bénéficié d’un premier  prêt qui fut correctement remboursé.
Il sollicite ce deuxième prêt pour acheter, 28 sacs de Maïs et 30 sacs de Mil en provenance des localités environnantes de Sikasso. 
Ces marchandises sont d’abord stockées dans son magasin avant d’être revendues en gros à une clientèle composée des détaillants et de chefs de famille.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 180 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdramane T. is 35 years old, married, and the father of four children. He is domiciled in Banconi–Koulikoro with his two wives and his children in a district of Sikasso City. After having run many businesses without success, he got started in the business of storing and marketing grains (corn, millet, and sorghum) seven years ago. He has a store in Kaboïla I, opposite the Guinso Clinic. Concerned about further satisfying his burgeoning customer base, he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in 2009. He has had an initial loan, which was properly repaid. He is requesting a second loan to buy 28 sacks of corn, and 30 sacks of millet from towns surrounding Sikasso. These goods are first stocked up in his store and are then resold in bulk to a customer base composed of retailers and heads-of-household. With this loan, he envisions making a monthly profit of 180,000 francs CFA. The profits will be used essentially for helping to cover family expenses and to pay the loan interest. The rest will be invested in his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying grains

loans.name: Rodelisa

texts.en: Rodelisa R. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 24 years old and is married with three infant children. Rodelisa owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling lumber and wood-related products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Rodelisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia tiene 37 años de edad, es separada y tiene dos hijos a su cargo. Reside en el caserío Tejedores, una zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, zona agrícola caracterizada por producir frutas de exportación. Pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicada en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros. Ella adquiere su mercadería en las ciudades de Piura y Chiclayo y la distribuye entre sus clientes en base a pedidos. Ella es bastante conocidano solo en su cacerio sino que también lo es en los caserío de alrededor, siempre está en contacto con sus clientes ya que les deja la mercadería personalmente y, como trabaja al crédito, les realiza visitas semanales o quincenales.

Esta actividad es la unica con la que sostiene la economía de su familia por lo que siempre da lo mejor de si para para mantenerse en el negocio. Celia desea adquirir mas mercadería para ampliar su negocio, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Celia es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, su mas grande anhelo es seguir creciendo hasta tener un negocio mas estable que le permita hacerse cargo del sostenimiento de su familia con mayor tranquilidad. En la zona donde vive ella es muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Celia is 37 years old, is separated and has 2 children under her care. She lives in the suburb of Tejedores, a rural zone in the Tambogrande district. Tejedores is an agricultural zone characterised by the production of fruit for export. It belongs to the Piura province, located in the region of the same name, more than 3 hours from Chiclayo city capital of the Lambayeque region in Peru. Celia sells men's and women's clothing. She acquires her merchandise in Piura and Chiclayo cities and distrbutes them to her clients through orders. Celia is quite well-known not only in her suburb but in the surrounding suburbs, and she is always in contact with her customers as she takes them their merchandise personally, and as she works on credit, she makes her visits weekly or fortnightly. This activity is the only activity that sustains her family economically, and so she always gives her best to maintain the business. Celia wants to acquire more merchandise to expand her business, and for this has decided for the first time to seek a loan of 700 nuevos soles form Edpyme Alternative to help her achieve her objective. Celia is a very hard-working woman who strives to succeed. Her biggest desire is to continue growing her business until it becomes more stable, allowing her to care for her family with greater peace. In the zone where she lives Celia is very well-known and respected by her neighbours.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to expand merchandise

loans.name: Batsaihan

texts.en: Batsaihan D. is 29 years old and lives with wife and two children in Huvsgul province of Mongolia. They live together in a ger (a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent). He has a gold and silver crafts business which he inherited from his ancestors. He has much skill as a craftsman and designs and produces a variety of jewelry and accessories. Batsaihan has been in his business for more than 15 years. During this time, he has worked hard to grow his crafts business. He has been saving his earnings to begin renting a stall at the local market in the near future. He is a very modest, kind and open-minded person. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to use for his craft business.

loans.use: To rent a stall at the local market

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Mrs. Vann R. who lives in Mea Neak village in Takeo province was born in 1961. She is a farmer who owns a five-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Dy Ses, is a fisherman and he owns an agric machine. She is facing a problem because it is time to grow rice, but she does not have rice seeds. So, to improve her production, Mrs. Vann R. is requesting a loan to buy rice seeds. The rest of the loan she is going to use to fix her husband’s agric machine. She is a mother of five children. Two of the children are seamstresses in a garment factory, two are farmers and the other is studying in school. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy rice seed

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah K. is 37 years old and lives in the town of Kinobi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children. All of her children are currently in school. Sarah has a business of a retail shop, which she has had for 1 year. She also has a produce business.

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more produce and items for the retail shop, like soap. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sarah hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, Sarah hopes to become a sufficient woman with a progressive business.

loans.use: To buy more produce and items for the retail shop, like soap.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina Y. is from the village of Matusalem. She is 58 years old and married with seven school-aged children. To make a living, Catalina owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income from the business comes primarily from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Catalina has been engaged in her business for over 37 years and she earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from her business activities.

Catalina joined Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc. (ASKI) in 2006 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Catalina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional products to sell. Catalina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items and expand the number of products her retail store offers. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Catalina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.  


About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.
