*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items and expand product offerings

loans.name: Jusima

texts.en:
Jusima P., a widow who lives in Sitio Bombon, Pinamungajan, Cebu, earns her living by operating two ventures: food vending and sari-sari (general) store businesses. She has five children between the ages of 30 and 39.

Jusima joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Jusima has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fifth cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 11000 to use as additional working capital for her food vending and sari-sari store businesses so that she can continue to save for her future security and to help her grandson finish school. Jusima P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Nashon  Okata

texts.en:
Nashon Okata O. has been in hand cart transport business for eight years in Ngara market where he assists customers in delivering goods to their destinations. Since Ngara is a very busy market, Nashon is able to find many customers. Out of this business, Nashon gets a monthly income of Kshs.5,000. He is 29 years old, single and very hardworking.

Nashon was introduced to KADET ltd. by a friend and has no history with any other MFI. He is therefore applying for his first loan of Kshs 15,000 which he will use to repair the hand cart by buying a new wheel.

In the future, he desires to grow his business and hopes to own a matatu (a local passenger van), which can be a reliable source of stable income.

loans.use: To repair the hand cart by buying a new wheel

loans.name: Maria Candelaria

texts.es:
Doña María es un señora de 53 años de edad, sus ingresos los recibe de una tienda que posee, ella vive en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos, también a la tienda y prepara tamales para vender, tiene seis años de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio.
Hoy ella necesita invertir y para hacerlo solicita un préstamo ya que tiene planes de comprar mercadería para la tienda, comprara más pollos para su granja y maíz para hacer los tamales, con esta inversión estará fortaleciendo sus negocios y preparándose para los días de mayor comercio.
Su propósito es tener bien establecidos los negocios, contar con suficiente inventario para ayudar a su familia con ingresos y cubrir así los gastos más importantes.
texts.en:
Maria is a 53-year-old woman who earns a living running a general store. She lives in El Transito, San Miguel, with her husband and son. Besides running the store, she also raises chickens and prepares and sells tamales. She has been in business for six years. 
She now needs to invest money into her business, so she is requesting a loan because she has plans to purchase goods for her store, broiler chickens for her farm, and corn to make tamales. This investment will strengthen her businesses and help her prepare for the busy season. 
Her goal is to have well-established businesses and have enough inventory to help her family with the income necessary to cover the biggest expenses.

loans.use: Purchase goods, broiler chickens, and corn to make tamales

loans.name: Dedicación

texts.es: Dedicación, de 44 años, enviudó hace un año de su esposo Maurilio. Ambos tuvieron 5 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellos: Nora, de 18 y Candí, de 16 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Ricrican. Está valerosa mujer se dedica a la siembra de tubérculos en la variedad de papa, olluco y oca, lo que más le gusta a ella, son los momentos en los que puede bajar de sus terrenos agrícolas a la ciudad, donde vende su cosecha, a muy buen precio. Según cuenta Dedicación, ella baja por lo menos una vez a la ciudad de Tarma, donde aparte de vender sus nutritivos tubérculos, también comercializa carne de cordero al por mayor, con la venta puede costear los alimentos de la semana. Ella agradece a Dios, por todo el apoyo que recibió y a pesar de lo pesado que es trabajar en la chacra, está feliz de poder tener algo propio y trabarlo para sus hijos. Este es el onceno crédito con MFP, y como socia antigua de su banco comunal, espera seguir trabajando por el desarrollo de los mismos. Con el monto que solicita comprará, varios sacos de abono orgánico y si el dinero le alcanza, invertirá en sustancias contra la plaga de insectos que azotan constantemente sus sembríos.
texts.en: Dedicación is 44 years old, and has been widowed this past year from her husband Maurilio. They had 5 children together, but only 2 of them still live with her: Nora, who is 18, and Candí, 16. They live as a family in their own house, located in the Ricrican area. This brave woman dedicates her time to growing potatoes, yams and other tubers. What she likes best about her work is when she comes down from her farmlands to the city, where she can sell her harvest for a good price. Dedicación goes on to say that when she goes to the city of Tarma, apart from selling her nutritious potatoes, she also sells mutton. With the proceeds from the sale she can buy food for the week. She thanks God for all the support she has recieved, and despite the hard work the farm represents, she is happy that she has something of her own and is able to hold onto it for her children. This is her 11th loan from [field partner] MFP, and as a long-standing member of her communal bank, she hopes to continue working and developing the same. With the sum she is looking to borrow, she will buy sacks of organic fertilizer, and - if she has sufficient funds - she will invest in chemicals to control the insect pests that constantly plague her crops.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer and chemicals to control insect infestations.

loans.name: María Silvia

texts.es:
La Señora. María P. es socia del banco comunal Nueva Amistad, vive en la comunidad Los Alamos que es perteneciente a la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia se caracteriza por sus campos llenos de cultivos ya que su gente se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, mucha de su gente encuentra en la ciudad un trabajo para ayudar a la economía de su hogar.

La Señora María se dedica a la venta de frutas, hortalizas, granos etc., en un mercado de la ciudad, esta actividad la realiza hace 12 años, cuenta con un puesto propio y labora de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde.
 
Doña María tiene 34 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 15, 13, 11 y 6 años de edad, los dos primeros  estudian en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer profesional, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por su cuñada,  el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más hortalizas y frutas para su negocio. Su meta es crecer mucho más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. María P. is a member of the Nueva Amistad (New Friendship) communal bank.  She lives in the Los Alamos community which is part of Cumbe parish.  This parish is notable due to its fields full of crops because its residents are farmers and raise cattle.  Many of its residents look for work in the city to help our their household economy.

María sells fruit, vegetables, grains, etc. in one of the city’s markets.  She has been in this line of work for 12 years.  She has her own stand and works from Monday through Saturday from 8am until 5pm.

María is 34 years old, married with four children who are 15, 13, 11 and 6 years of age.  The two oldest are in high school and the two youngest go to a city elementary school. Her husband is a professional driver.  Their efforts as a couple have led to their building their own house.

This is her second loan in the communal bank.  She was invited to join by her sister-in-law.  She will use the money from her loan to buy more vegetables and fruit for her business.  Her goal is to grow much more in her business.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruit.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
La señora Jenny G. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio de ropa y cosméticos. Ella inicio este negocio hace ocho años el cual inicio con la venta de una docena de ropa el cual por su ardua labor y los prestamos ha ido creciendo.

G. tiene cuatro hijos de 12, 10, 8 y 5 años los cuales son su razón para salir adelante. Ella invertirá el crédito en útiles escolares como cuadernos, mochilas, lápiz, lapiceros, colores etc.
texts.en: Jenny G. is a hard-working, industrious and enterprising woman who works selling clothing and cosmetics.  She began the business eight years ago with a sale of a dozen pieces of clothing.  With her hard work and the loans, the business has been growing. G. has four children: 12, 10, 8 and 5, and these are the reasons that she wants to get ahead.  She will use the loan to buy school supplies such as notebooks, backpacks, pencils, pens, markers, etc.

loans.use: school supplies

loans.name: Chinigul

texts.ru: Шапоатова Чинигул жительница района Вахдат. Ей 48 лет. Вдова, имеет одного ребенка. Она более 20 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. У нее имеется магазин, где она продает продукты питания. Кредит просит для покупки холодильника.
texts.en: Chinigul S. lives in the Vahdat region. She is 48 years old. She is a widow and has one child. She has been selling on the market for more than twenty years. She has a store where she sells food. She is asking for a loan to buy a refrigerator.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Clementina Bellanira

texts.es: Clementina tiene 46 años, su actividad económica es la vetan de ropa, hace mas de 20 años que se dedica a este humilde negocio. Ella es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y siempre le ha gustado sacar adelante a su familia son la parte más importantes en su vida. Inicio cuando decidió viajar a Managua a comprar mercadería y le dio muy buenos resultados pues le proporciono el alimento diario, es por eso que se ha interesado a mejorar sus ingresos con este negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos y cosméticos. Su deseo es incrementar su negocio para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Clementina is 46 years old and sells clothes for a living. She has managed her modest business for more than twenty years. Clementina is a woman who enjoys working and has always liked helping her family succeed since they are a very important part of her life. When she started her business, Clementina decided to travel to Managua in order to buy merchandise. She achieved good results which allowed her to provide for her daily needs. Since then she has been interested in improving her business income.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy trousers, shirts, skirts, dresses, and cosmetics. Her wish is to increase her business so that she can improve her living conditions.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy trousers, shirts, skirts, dresses, and cosmetics

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc T. P. is a 57-year-old widow with two children. Every day she goes to the market to sell chickens for meat. Her business started when she received her first loan in 2006, and it has developed quickly and created a stable income for her to use in managing her life. 

Regarding her attitude to the micro-credit program, she is never late in repayment. Therefore, she hopes to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy more chickens. Part of this amount will be used to improve her shop.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to sell and to improve her shop.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita T. is from the village of Camul, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Del Norte.  She is 43 years old.  Anita is married and has 4 school-aged children.  To make a living, Anita owns and operates a fishing business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling wild-caught fish in the local community.  Anita is just starting this business.

In 2011, Anita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Anita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell.  This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Anita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Lucienne's Group

texts.en:
The three entrepreneurs in this group all live in the same neighborhood of Cotonou, Benin's largest city. This is their fifth loan with ALIDE, following successful past repayments.

Lucienne (with her hand raised in the photo) was born in 1958 in Ganvier, north of Cotonou. She moved to her current location 12 years ago and now lives with her husband Gabriel and two of their six children.

For the past 13 years Lucienne has run a stall selling various foods and household goods in the Ladji district. This loan will enable her to purchase spices, soap, and corn from Tokpa, Benin's largest market. Her aim in the long term is to save enough to buy her own plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase bulk merchandise for resale, like spices, soap, and corn

loans.name: Jesukpego 13 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe JESUKPEGO 13 est composé de trois personnes qui vendent toutes dans le même marché de Djassin à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. 
La représentante du groupe, du nom de Aïchatou est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Aïchatou est née en 1960 à Zinvié à Porto-Novo et est marié à Saliou. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, mais qui ne sont plus à leur charge. Aïchatou et son mari assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Depuis huit ans, Aïchatou vit à Djassin avec son mari. Afin de se prendre en charge et d'améliorer son niveau de vie, Aïchatou  exerce depuis quinze ans, comme activité la vente de divers condiments de sauce et aussi de l'huile de palme, qu'elle achète au marché de Ouando à Porto-Novo. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Aïchatou sollicite à nouveau un crédit. Son ambition est d'acquérir un jour, une parcelle.
texts.en:
The JESUKPEGO 13 group is made up of three women who all sell in the same market in the Djassin neighborhood of Porto-Novo, Benin’s administrative capital.  This is the second time that the group is requesting financial aid from ALIDé, in order to increase their business activity.
The group representative, named Aïchatou, is the woman in the photo with her hand raised.  She was born in 1960 in Zinvié, Porto-Novo, and is married to Saliou.  The couple has four children, all of whom are in school but in the care of others.  She and her husband together share the family expenses.  For the last eight years, Aïchatou has lived in Djassin with her husband.  In order to improve their quality of life, she has been in business for 15 years selling different condiments, sauces, and palm oil, which she buys in the Ouando market in Porto-Novo.  To satisfy her customers and increase her income, Aïchatou is requesting a new loan.  Her goal is to one day buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy baskets of condiments (fresh tomatoes, onions, peppers, etc.)

loans.name: Mirian Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mirian de 29 años, es una mujer emprendedora en su actividad ya que por medio de unos amigos empezó en la venta de productos naturales ya que la gente si los consumen.

Ella labora desde muy temprano haciendo promoción de sus productos a amigos vecinos y parientes que si conozcan. Ella hace pedidos de sus productos de omnilife para sus clientes por cajas y los vende por unidad. Con el préstamo quiere comprar mas productos omnilife para aumentar sus ingresos. En un futuro quiere poner su negocio juntos con su esposo una vitrinas de sus productos ya que el tiene un cyber en el local.
texts.en:
Mirian is 29 years old.  She is an entrepreneurial woman.  Through some friends, she started selling natural products since people do use them.

She works from very early in the day promoting her products to her friends, neighbors and relatives.  She makes orders for her Omnilife products for her customers.  She buys them by the box and sells them as individual units.  She would like to use her loan to buy more Omnilife products to increase her income.  In the future, she would like to install a display case of her products in her husband's business since he owns an Internet café.

loans.use: to buy natural products (Omniplus and Bicacro)

loans.name: Nanjiddash

texts.en:
Mr. Nanjiddash is a 31 year-old truck driver. He lives with his wife and 2 children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His son attends a school and his daughter goes to kindergarten. His wife is unemployed at the moment, and she looks after the kids. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.

Nanjiddash owns a small truck and uses it for his delivery business, which is family’s only source of income. He has been running this business for 6 years and he works 6 days a week from 8:00 till 21:00. He used to transport coal from the train station to households, but now he has changed the profile and he delivers his clients' goods and products from warehouses to a market site. He says its more profitable than carrying coal. He needs to remodel his truck to accommodate it for delivery of goods. The loan will be used to buy spare parts such as new tires, engine parts, and a new loader and to properly service his truck.

loans.use: to buy spare parts such as new tires, engine parts, new loader, and to properly service his truck.

loans.name: 82 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Trúc is 57 years old. She is married and has six children. Trúc is the group leader of the 18.8.82 Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of six members. Trúc lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. This is Trúc's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Trúc operates a food stall/restaurant selling meat. Trúc has been involved in this business for five years.

The main hardship that Trúc faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business by purchasing pork to make pork pie. 

With her business profit, Trúc  hopes for her children to find a good job, to maintain a successful business, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: To purchase pork to make pork pie.

loans.name: Anatolia

texts.es:
Anatolia es socia del Banco Comunal Palmeras, tiene 53 años, es viuda y tiene 3 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de ropa para adultos, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para surtir su mercadería.
Anatolia perdió a su esposo en la época del terrorismo y tuvo que trabajar para sacara adelante a sus tres hijos, fueron tiempos muy difíciles. Antes vendía tuna y algunas frutas, junto su capital y comenzó a vender ropa en forma ambulatoria después adquirió un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril. Ingresó a FINCA Perú, por la invitación de una socia, le gusta por la facilidad en los préstamos, aprende de las capacitaciones que recibe de su promotora, se tocan temas muy interesantes de la familia, matrimonio, negocio y sobre todo se inculca la cultura del ahorro ya que muchas veces no se puede hacer en casa. Su sueño es poder comprase un terreno y poder abrir una galería.
texts.en:
Anatolia is a member of the Palmeras community bank.  She is 53 years old, widowed, and has three children.  Her business is selling clothes for adults.  She will invest the loan that she is requesting in buying clothes to stock her business.

Anatolia lost her husband during the period of terrorism and she had to work to get her three children ahead in life.  They were very difficult times.  She used to sell prickly pear and some other fruit.  She got her capital together and started selling clothes as an itinerant street vendor.  She then acquired a stall in the '12 de abril' market.

Anatolia joined FINCA Peru through an invitation from an existing member.  She likes it because of the ease of the loans.  She learns from the training sessions where they discuss very interesting topics to do with family, marriage and business.  Above all, they instill the importance of saving since this is often not possible at home.

Anatolia's dream is to buy a plot of land and open a store.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
Agripina  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen de Concepción”, ubicado en el C.P. Ayrumas Carumas del distrito de Acora, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 34 años de edad, es   soltera y no tiene hijos.  Estudió hasta 2do de secundaria. 
Desde hace un año trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su préstamo inicial de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles lo invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de ovinos, vacuno, alpaca, llamas etc, (compró una vaca).
Con éste nuevo préstamo de  S/. 1500.00 nuevo soles comprará dos vacas.  Nos cuenta que a veces los vende al instante, para ello, antes debe engordarlos por un mes.  En el negocio la ayuda su mamá.
Su sueño es seguir con la venta de animales y tener más capital para poner otro negocio.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones, el ahorro y las ganancias.
texts.en:
Agripina is a member of the "Virgen de Concepción" community bank, which is located in Ayrumas Carumas in the Acora district, in the province and department of Puno, Peru. She is 34 years old, single and has no children. She studied up till the second year of high school.

She has been working with Kiva Field Partner, Movimiento Manuela Ramos, for one year. She runs a business buying and selling sheep, cattle, alpaca, llamas etc., and she used her first loan of 500 PEN to buy a cow.

With this new loan of 1500 PEN she will buy two cows. She says that sometimes she sells them straight away, for which she must first fatten them up for a month. Her mother helps her with her business.

Her dream is to keep selling animals and have more capital to start another business.
What she likes about the community bank are the meetings, the savings and the profits.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Claudia De La Concepción

texts.es:
Claudia, de 47 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Masaya, actualemente vive en Palacaguina - Estelí,, donde se casó y tuvo tres hijos, de profesión Maestra, tiene un pequeño bar desde hace trece años el cual lo inicio con capital propio, generandole éste mas ingresos a su hogar. La señora Claudia solicitó su crédito para ampliar su negocio, incrementar inventario y la compra de exhibidor para licorería. 
Dentro de sus planes futuros se encuentra ampliar el negocio y que sus hijos vayan a la universidad para la culminación de sus estudios.
texts.en: Claudia, 47, is from the city of Masaya but currently lives in Palacaguina, Estelí, where she got married and had three children.  By profession, she’s a Teacher.  She’s owned a small bar for the last 13 years that she started with her own capital; it generates extra income for her home.  Claudia requested the loan to expand the business, increase inventory and to buy a liquor display case.  Within her future plans are expanding the business and that her children attend the university to finish their schooling.

loans.use: to buy a display case and increase stock inventory.

loans.name: Gulraftor

texts.en:
Gulraftor is 41 years old. She is a divorced woman and mother of one child. Gulraftor is a very hardworking and independent woman. She sells foods in her grocery store and has done this for 8 years.  Therefore, she has good business experience. 

With the purpose of expanding the business, Gulraftor is requesting a loan of 12,000TJS, with which she will purchase merchandise.  She will be able to offer a wider selection to her customers and increase her income. Gulraftor sincerely thanks you for your support. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy food

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married, and has two children. 

Alaa has owned a grocery store since 1999, selling soft drinks, juices, sweets, cheese, and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He is requesting $3000 to renovate his store, make an indoor ceiling, and purchase a generator. He aims to make more money to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate his store, make an indoor ceiling, and purchase a generator.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a forty-two-year old married mother of five children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family is vested in her as her husband does not work. She has been selling clothes for ten years. She started with 50,000 shillings and now has 3,000,000 shillings as her working capital. Her major hardship is the seasonal nature of the business. Her vision is to have a big boutique plus to educate her children. Jane needs the money to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Arshavir

texts.ru:
Аршавир родился в 1974 г. в городе Капан. После окончания Капанской средней школы он поступил в Ереванский Государственный Университет. 
Жена Аршавира не работает и сидит дома с детьми: сыну 2 года, дочери - 4. Родители Аршавира живут вместе с ним и помогают ему на ферме.  
С 2004 года  Аршавир занимается сельским хозяйством в селе Гегануш, Сьюниксйого региона. Он с помощью родителей разводит крупный рогатый скот и кур. Также у него есть огород, на котором он выращивает овощи на продажу. Также Аршавир продает говядину, молоко и яйца своим постоянным клиентам в Капане и, таким образом, содержит свою семью.  
Данный кредит является вторым, получаемым Аршавиром от Нор Оризона, и на этот раз ему необходим кредит на сумму 450,000 для приобретения сена и лекарства для домашнего скота.
texts.en: Arshavir was born in 1974 in the city of Kapan.  After graduating from the Kapan secondary school, he attended the Yerevan State University.  Arshavir's wife does not work and stays home with the children. Their son is two years old, and the daughter is four.  Arshavir's parents live together with them and help him with the farm.  Arshavir has been involved in agriculture in the Geganush village in the Syunik region since 2004.  With the help of his parents, he breeds cattle and chickens.  He also has a land plot, where he grows vegetables for sale.  Arshavir also sells beef, milk and eggs to his loyal customers in Kapan and, thus, supports his family.  This is his second loan from Nor Horizon, and this time he needs a loan in the sum of 450,000 in order to buy hay and medicine for his farm animals.

loans.use: To buy hay and medicine for his farm animals

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: El señor Roberto tiene una tienda donde vende ropa para tota edad; también vende su mercadería los días jueves y domingos en la feria de la 16 de julio en la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito lo requiere para la comprar al por mayor chamarras para dama, pues es un artículo que se vende mucho. Esta actividad es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir sus gastos. Vive en la casa de sus padres la misma queda  ubicada en la zona Pampahasi de la ciudad de La Paz; es casado y tiene un hijo. Roberto se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos que obtuvo anteriormente ya que pudo aumentar su capital y  así mejorar sus ingresos. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita el crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Roberto has a store where he sells clothes for all ages.  He also sells his merchandise on Thursdays and Sundays at the 16 de Julio market in the city of El Alto.  

He needs the loan to buy women’s jackets at wholesale because this is an item that sells quite a bit.  This activity is his source of income to cover his expenses.  

He lives in his parents’ house that is located in the city of La Paz’s Pampahasi zone.  He’s married and has a son.

Roberto is very satisfied with the loans he got previously because he was able to increase capital and improve income.  This is his second loan request through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy women's jackets.

loans.name: Haydee Lonera

texts.es:
La señora Haydee tiene 37 años de edad y vive con su hijo.

Ella es madre soltera, trabaja en la agricultura desde hace 4 años, por lo que conoce bien la profesión. Ella ha aprendido nuevas formas de trabajo para que sea productivo el cultivo. Esto lo aprendió de su papá, gracias a él hoy en día es una persona trabajadora.

Para realizar su trabajo ella necesita de insumos agrícolas, los cuales los adquiere en la ciudad porque los encuentra a mejores precios y le queda relativamente cerca de donde ella vive.

Ella solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo para comprar insumos agrícolas para el cultivo que se encuentra en crecimiento. Actualmente necesita abono, herbicidas y fungicidas para el control de la maleza y las plagas. Con estos insumos la señora Haydee podrá obtener una cosecha abundante. Esto le permitirá solventar sus problemas económicos y mejorar la condición de vida de su familia, que depende del trabajo que ella realiza como agricultora.

En un futuro ella espera poder ampliar la cantidad de tierra para la producción de sus cultivos,  ya que es la única fuente de ingresos que ella tiene. Con esfuerzo y trabajo ella quiere brindarle una educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Haydee, 37, lives with her son. She is a single mother and has been farming for 4 years so she knows the profession well. She has learned new ways to make her crop productive. She learned from her father, thanks to whom she is now a hardworking woman.

To do her job, she needs farming inputs that she gets in the city because they're cheaper and it's not too far from where she lives. 

She requests a loan from Fundacion Campo to buy agricultural inputs for the crops that are growing. Currently she needs compost, herbicides and fungicides to control the weeds and insects. With these inputs Haydee will be able to get an abundant harvest. This will allow her to take care of her financial problems and to improve her family's living conditions, which depend on her farming work. 

In the future she hopes to increase the amount of farmland that she has, since this is her only source of income. With effort and work she wants to give her son a good education.

loans.use: to buy compost, herbicides and fungicides.

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame, a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school, owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, Dzame has operated a grocery shop, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business but dreams of expanding it to supply a larger market in the future.

Having decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, onions and potatoes with a loan of Kshs 30,000.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, onions and potatoes.

loans.name: Norie

texts.en:
Norie is an owner of a general store which is located within the village of Pinto Alfonso Lista. She has been operating it for almost six years and she is able to earn about 5,000 PHP a month. She uses her generated income to meet their daily needs, for an allowance for the children and electric bill payment. 

Norie is 39 years of age, married and has four children. One of her children has finished the college level while the three left are still studying. Norie suffered from financial matters due to the expenses of her three children so, to increase her sales and profit, she is asking for additional capital amounting to 7,000 PHP to buy more groceries for her general store. In this way, she could increase her profit and provide her children with good educations. In addition, she could improve the living condition of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for her general store

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Savy (in the photo), 41, is a garment worker and her husband, Savy, 41, is a rice farmer and fisherman.  They have been married since 1989 and have four children, two sons and two daughters. One is a garment worker, two attend school, and another one assists his father in the business. The family lives in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Savy hopes to supplement her new tailoring business, so she is asking for her first loan in the amount of $500 to buy a sewing machine. She will also use another part of the loan to buy fishing nets for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and to buy fishing nets for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.es: Imelda es una señora trabajadora, comercializa su productos pues en su vivienda ciertos conocen que ella vende ropa. El motivo del crédito que solicita es para la compra de camisas, pantalones, faldas y trajes. Sus activos están representados básicamente en cuentas por cobrar e inventarios. Tiene un buen capital de trabajo, para invertir especialmente en prendas de vestir que tiene encargadas para la temporada de fin de año, época buenas ventas y esto se lo dice su experiencia comercial.
texts.en: Imelda is a hard-working woman, and she sells her products from her home since certain people know that she sells clothing.  The reason for the credit request is to purchase shirts, pants, skirts, and dresses. Her expenses are basically represented by indebted clients and inventory. She has a good balance of assets to liabilities, and plans to invest especially in clothing items that people have ordered for the end of the year seasonal sales. In her commercial experience that is a good time for sales.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, pants, skirts, and dresses

loans.name: Unidas De Saguazu Group

texts.es:
El comite lleva por nombre Unidas de Saguazu, debido a que el grupo es bastante unido. Ellas han asumido el compromiso de  mantener unido el grupo y trabajar con responsabilidad y respeto mutuo. Actualmente se encuentran en el  noveno ciclo, integrado por  17 mujeres quienes invierten sus prestamos en sus respectivas actividades.
Dominga es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, ella todos los días trabaja mucho. Se dedica a la costura, el cual ha sido el medio para mantener a su familia desde hace varios años. Ella comenta que siempre tiene muchos pedidos y trabajos por hacer por lo que a veces pareciera que el tiempo no le alcanza. Para poder cumplir con esos pedidos es que ella solicita el crédito, para la compra de telas, hilos, agujas y demás insumos , los cuales les está de mucha utilidad. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
The committee named “Unidas de Saguazu” is a very close group. They have made the commitment to maintain a unified group and to work with responsibility and mutual respect. The group is currently in its ninth loan cycle with 17 women who have invested their loans in their respective business activities.

Dominga is a hardworking and determined woman. She works a great deal every day. Dominga is a seamstress and has been supporting her family in this manner for several years. She says that she always has orders and work to complete. Sometimes she does not have enough hours in a day to do everything. In order to complete her orders, she is requesting a loan to buy fabrics, thread, needles, and other supplies that are useful. Dominga is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity she has received.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, needles, and other supplies.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is married and blessed with three children who are in school. For the last ten years, she has been running a beauty salon business to bring up her family. She also does farming to increase her income. Dorcas has employed two people to assist her to manage her business. She has been able to retain her business because of a good reputation with her customers.  In the next 5 years, she plans to establish a wholesale business. Dorcas has requested for a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy hair braids and hair chemicals.

loans.use: buy hair braids and hair chemicals

loans.name: Achol

texts.en:
Achol is 38 years old. She is married with three children, two of whom are in school. For the past three years, Achol has run a bookshop in South Sudan.

Achol is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase textbooks to sell. She will use the extra income from her loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase textbooks to sell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 44 years old, married to Ndirangu, and they are blessed with three children. She has been in the farming business for the past three years with a monthly income of Kes10,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET ltd of Kes 57,266 after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Catherine will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business for she will educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.en: My name is Clorinda M. and I own a jewelry store in Tegucigalpa, Honduras.  At my store I sell 14 and 18 karat gold chains, bangles, bracelets, earrings and other jewelry for women and men.  I have had my business for five years, and my clients are very loyal.  I sell high quality products, and am careful to always purchase quality items to stock my store.  My goal is to increase my sales so that I can support my family.  With an increased inventory I will by able to do this, and I will also be able to pay for repairs on my house, and education for my children.

loans.use: To buy chains, rings, earrings, bracelets, and 14K and 18K gold bangles for my jewelry store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Peninah Kurende Lepulei intends to buy beads and more tools to make this work a success

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: “My husband and I run a sewing business together in a rural area in Pakistan. We make embroidered clothes and sell them in the city of Lahore. We want to expand our business and purchase an additional machine and hire a worker in order to increase our income. We are looking for a loan, which we will repay in a year.” Samina B., Pakistan

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Lis Estefani

texts.es:
In spite of her young age, Lis is already working in the public sector as secretary for the local government. Since she is working part-time she can study “Computer Science” in an local institute in order to improve her competitiveness. Lis lives with her parents and brothers; she is the second of 4 children and they all are in school, for this reason, it’s difficult for her parents to cover the family’s expenses quite often. Before this situation, Lis decided to work and she obtained this work in a government office a month ago. Her monthly salary allows her to cover her personal and school expenses. Lis’ goal is to open an Internet café at home and generate a bigger income to be able to support her family and find the economic stability that they all long. In order to start this project, Lis is requesting for a loan of 160 dollars in order to start conditioning the designated area for this business. She promises to repay over a period of 6 months.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Lis a pesar de su corta edad ya está incursionando en el trabajo del sector público como secretaria de la gobernación, debido a que su desempeño lo realiza a medio tiempo puede estudiar a la par la carrera de computación en un instituto de su ciudad con el fin de mejorar su competitividad..Lis vive con sus padres y hermanos; es la segunda de 4 hermanos y todos estudian por lo que muchas veces se torna tarea dificultosa para sus padres afrontar los gastos económicos familiares. Ante ello Lis decide trabajar y es así que hace un mes consigue este trabajo en la jefatura de gobernación el ingreso que percibe mensualmente le permite solventar sus gastos personales y los de su estudio. Lis se ha trazado metas y entre ellas está el deseo de implementar una cabina de internet en las instalaciones de su hogar para generar ingresos más amplios a fin de que su familia pueda encontrar la estabilidad económica que tanto anhela y para emprender este proyecto solicita un préstamo de 160 dólares con el propósito de iniciar el acondicionamiento del espacio que ya tiene designado y se compromete a retornar tu noble apoyo en un período de 6 meses.

loans.use: Start a Internet cafe at home.

loans.name: Neneng

texts.en: Neneng is 37 years old and is married with one child aged 3. She sells clothes on credit and goes door to door to reach new customers. Her husband sells cakes at the market and makes a small income. She needs a IDR 900,000 loan to buy more clothes and the rest will be used for her husband's business. She usually earns $10 per day. Neneng hopes this loan will allow her to help her husband and supplement their incomes. She's a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Abdul Babah

texts.en: Abdul joined SMT for the purpose of expanding his business selling spare parts.  His wife runs a small tailoring shop with 3 sewing machines to supplement the family’s income.  With his previous loans, Abdul diversified his business and has built a good relationship with SMT.  He will complete his installments for his most recent loan at the end of December and would like a loan of $1200 to further increase his stock so that he would be able to sell spare parts wholesale to smaller retailers.

loans.use: To further expand his business and begin selling his spare parts wholesale to smaller retailers

loans.name: Sreypov

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreypov P. (age 30) is a widow with one daughter who is studying in primary school. Sreypov is living with her parents across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She is in the business of weaving silk at home. She learned to weave silk from her aunt and started her silk production in 1994. Her mother is also a silk weaver.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA three times already. Now she is requesting another loan in the amount of $400. She will use this money to purchase silk materials and sewing thread and to pay fees for preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials and sewing thread and to pay fees for preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Songambele Group

texts.en: Joyce, the leader of this loan group, is a married woman living with her husband and child. She plans to use her loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is 25 years old and is a single woman. Rukia is business woman who started her retail business in 2007. Everyday, she works hard at her store from 8am to 6pm.

She now hopes to receive a loan in order to buy additional items for her business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
Mrs. Rin A. is a widow with five children; two sons and three daughters. Some of her children are in school and others are employed full time. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Rin has been selling fish for over three years. She purchases them from a fish wholesaler at Ta Kmao market and resells them at the village market. She is requesting a loan of $700 to build a restroom for her family's use.

loans.use: to build a restroom for family's use

loans.name: Estelista

texts.es:
Estelista is a hardworking woman and dedicated to what she has been doing for over 10 years, selling baby and infant clothing. Her dedication helps her sales, which she conducts on Sunday in the markets on Huancavelica in her locality, and she has the newest designs. Estelista remembers the days when she first started her enterprise after a business transfer, and she had to endeavor greatly to capture customers. To continue her efforts, she seeks a loan to acquire a greater amount of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Estelista, es una mujer muy trabajadora y dedicada a lo que hace y lo demuestran sus 10 años de experiencia vendiendo ropas para bebés y niños pequeños, su dedicación favorece las ventas que realiza los días domingos en las ferias de la calle Huancavelica en su localidad, y está a los nuevos diseños. Estelista recuerda aquellos días en que ella inició su negocio después de un traspaso comercial y le costó mucho esfuerzo captar clientes. Para continuar ese gran esfuerzo solicita un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de prendas.

loans.use: Increase of capital to purchase more clothing.

loans.name: Khayri

texts.en:
H. Khayri is 53 years old. She is married with two children. Both of her children are married. Khayri has been running her business for more than five years. She started her business to be able to support her husband and family, as her husband’s income was not enough for the family needs. She rents a place at the market.

She sells shoes for kids. First, she purchased goods from suppliers but now her son is traveling to the neighboring country to purchase new goods. Khayri is trying to purchase goods of good quality and the prices acceptable for the clients with an average level of income.

Being a very nice and friendly woman by her nature, Khayri is working hard and trying to serve her clients so they have a positive experience and want to come back. Now Khayri is planning to purchase new summer shoes for kids in order to increase the variety of goods to sell. With this purpose, she requests 950 $ US Dollars for the term of 10 months. Having a positive credit history, Khayri promises to repay the current loan promptly. She has gratitude for everyone supporting her.

loans.use: To purchase shoes for kids in order to increase the variety of goods for selling.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena A. sells fish. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient for Abena and her three children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is asking for additional capital to expand her business and increase profits.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Aminétou

texts.fr:
Mrs. A. Aminétou M. was born on March 8, 1970 in Alédjo in northern Togo. She is married to a salesman and has four children. Since her husband has an irregular income, she helps him with family expenses with the revenue that she acquires selling charcoal. She began this activity in 2001 and sells to retailers in her neighborhood. To avoid a stock shortage caused by the rain, she is requesting this first loan to buy 20 bags of charcoal in order strengthen her stock supply and be able to meet the demand of her clients.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame M. A. Aminétou est née le 8 mars 1970 à Alédjo au nord du Togo. Elle s’est mariée à un revendeur et a quatre enfants. Son mari ayant un revenu irrégulier, elle l’aide dans les dépenses de la famille avec le revenu qu’elle tire de la vente du charbon de bois. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 2001 et vend aux détaillants de son quartier. Pour éviter une rupture de stock qui peut être liée à la pluie, elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 20 sacs de charbon de bois afin de reconstituer son stock et de pouvoir faire face à la demande de ses clients.

loans.use: Purchase of 20 bags of charcoal

loans.name: Sadia's Group

texts.en:
Sadia I. M. is the wife of I. M. and lives in the Walton area of Lahore City, Pakistan. She has been living in this area for the last seven years. She is the mother of a four-year-old daughter. Sadia baji's husband is a painter, and he paints offices, doors, windows, and walls. For the last four years he has also run a scrap business. Sadia baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She has successfully repaid four loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more scrap parts (iron, wastepaper, and bottles) for her husband to resell.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Niamatay M. Ashraf wants a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business. Rani S. M. wants a loan to buy a donkey cart. Bilquis N. P. M. wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motorized vehicle). Maryam W. M. wants a loan to buy electric supplies (tubes, switches and switch boards) for her electric shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy scrap items (iron, wastepaper, bottles)  to resell

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Greetings from Emmanuel in Byumba, Rwanda! Emmanuel is 26 years old, married with 2 children.

Emmanuel has worked very hard in his restaurant and has grown from a working capital of US$ 1150 to US$ 1400 over the last three years. Emmanuel sells various foodstuffs in his restaurant such as rice, potatoes, cassava flour bread, maize flour bread, fish, beef, etc.

He is looking for a loan worth 519,175 Frws to buy more foodstuffs for his restaurant and more equipment such as plates, spoons, etc. to expand his business. The loan repayment period is 8 months.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for his restaurant and more equipment

loans.name: Balakissa

texts.fr:
Madame Balakissa D. est âgée de 38 ans et vit dans une famille monogame avec son époux et ses deux enfants dans le quartier Faraba de la ville de  Bougouni (une des préfectures de la troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Dès son jeune âge, elle a commencé les activités économiques notamment la restauration qu’elle a apprise  auprès de sa soeur depuis maintenant 12 ans. Madame Balakissa s’est spécialisée dans les grillades(brochette de viande) et les fritures(de pomme de terre, de banane plantin) 
Elle travaille avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 2 ans et est à son deuxième prêt indivuduel, après avoir correctement remboursé le premier.
Elle compte constituer avec ce prêt un stock important de pomme de terre et de bananes plantins. En plus journalièrement elle achetera  3 kilogrammes de viande, 1 litre d’huile alimentaire , 10 miches de pains.
Elle s’approvisionne exclusivement au marché de Bougouni. Son lieu de vente se trouve dans le  même marché où il ya une grande affluence surtout les voyageurs et  les  routiers. La nuit elle vend devant sa porte où les noctambules et les voisins viennent se régaler.
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000FCFA qui servira à agrandir son entreprise et à aider son mari dans les dépenses de la famille (santé,éducation. nourriture, etc...)
texts.en:
Mrs. Balakissa D., 38, lives in a monogamous family with her husband and her two children in the Faraba neighborhood of the town of Bougouni (one of the prefectures of the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Since her youth, she began earning money, especially in the restaurant business which she learned from her sister and has worked at for 12 years now. Mrs. Balakissa has specialized in grilled meat (brochettes) and fries (potato and plantain, a kind of banana). She has been working with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso for 2 years now and is on her second individual loan, after having correctly reimbursed the first.

With this loan she intends to put together significant stocks of potatoes and plantains. Moreover, she will purchase 3 kg of meat, 1 liter of cooking oil, and 10 loaves of bread daily. She does all her shopping in the market of Bougouni. Her sales venue is located in the same market where there are lots of travelers and taxi and truck drivers. In the evenings she sells in front of her door where night owls and neighbors come to regale themselves.

She hopes to make a monthly profit of 30,000 F CFA which she will use to enlarge her business and to help her husband with family expenses (health, education, food, etc.)

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of ingredients for her restaurant dishes

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Sofia L., from Surallah Cotabato city, is a 50-year-old mother of five children. After she got married in 1987, she decided to start her own store, operating out of the front of her house. She manages her business and caters to her customers who are her neighbors, friends, and relatives.

She is requesting her first loan to purchase additional grocery stock for her business like charcoal, rice, and chorizo. She would eventually like to have a bigger grocery store so she can accommodate more customers.Sofia believes that with her loan, she can increase her sales to better support the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: Purchase assorted groceries stocks

loans.name: Rodolfo De Jesus

texts.es:
El Sr. Rodolfo tiene 46 años de edad, habita en un   barrio  que se llama Memorial Sandino, en la capital de Managua,  estado civil casado, su esposa es auxiliar de laboratorio, tiene dos hijas de 13 y 16 años de edad ambos estudian. Los planes para su familia es brindarle un patrimonio a sus hijas, seguridad y protección. Don  Rodolfo se desempeña como guardia de seguridad desde hace ocho años que brinda seguridad a otras personas. Sus planes en el ámbito laboral es cambiar de trabajo con mayores ingresos. Ya que gana un salario mínimo y aparte que es un trabajo desgastante, y así. Con esta solicitud va comprar materiales de construcción para terminar de construir su casa. A largo plazo es poder tener una casa digna para su familia.
Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograr compra materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro y bloque terminar de construir su casa y ofrecerle el patrimonio, la seguridad y protección a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Rodolfo is 46 years old and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in Managua. He is married, his wife is a laboratory assistant, and has two daughter who are 13 and 16 years of age. Both of his children are in school. His plan for his family is to provide legacy, security, and protection for his daughters. Rodolfo has been employed as a security guard for 8 years and provides security services for other people. He plans to switch jobs for higher income, since he earns a minimal salary and the work is not enjoyable. With this loan he is going to purchase construction materials to finish work on his home. Over the long term he will be able to have a dignified home for his family. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic he has been able to buy construction materials like: cement, iron and blocks, to finish construction on his home and offer the legacy, security, and protection to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase the necessary materials to finish construction on his home.

loans.name: Muheza Group

texts.en:
Tausi Msuya is 28 years old and single. She has a salon business. She started her business in 2005 and works daily from 7am until 11pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of about $228.

This will be Tausi’s 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her 1st loan to buy a dryer and has paid the loan back successfully. She hopes for a new loan to buy a foot-cleaning machine.

Tausi will share this loan with subgroup D of the Muheza group. The subgroup has 6 members, who run salons, sell food, fish and shoes. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Tausi is 1st on the left, standing.

loans.use: A foot-cleaning machine

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence K. is 40 years old. She is married with four children. She lives with her husband in her matrimonial home at Koforidua, a suburb of Offinso, in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Florence is an achiever and a resourceful woman. She loves selling goods, the business through which she makes a living.

Florence has been selling bananas at Koforidua market for six years now, to support her family. She treks to surrounding villages in the central part of Ghana to purchase bulk stocks of banana from farmers and retails to her customers. For lack of adequate working capital, she is not able to buy enough stock at any one time to make enough profit to support her family. Florence buys unripe banana in bulk and she covers them with plantain leaves in the bush. She leaves them there for a while and when they are ripe she goes for them and retails them to her customers.

With the loan, she wants to purchase a bulk supply of bananas to enable her to scale up her sales. She believes the loan would enable her to save more income to support her business growth. Florence belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyame Bekyere’; in a literal translation this means "God will show". She hopes to receive GHS 1000 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her save more to help her husband in taking care of the household.

loans.use: To purchase bunches of bananas for re-sale

loans.name: Cristo Redentor 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
These ladies from Group 1 of Cristo Redentor Bank of Hope from San Pedro de Macoris are on their third loan cycle with Esperanza International. Francisca L. is their group coordinator. She is the mother of 5 children: ages 14, 12, 6, 3, and a 5-month-old baby. She has a beauty salon where she provides hair care for women. She will use this loan to purchase different kinds of hair products, including some high-quality hair product lines that she can charge a higher rate per service. Because she does all the salon work herself, Francisca has very little time to spend with her children. Luckily, her salon is in her own house. She dreams of providing a safe home for her children to live in and making her hair salon a modern facility where she can provide all kinds of beauty services. 

Juana V. is the Group 2 coordinator. They are on their second loan cycle with Esperanza International. Juana has two different businesses: selling clothes and selling gasoline. She sells the clothes in her home, and she sells the gasoline on the road close to her house. The community roads are often small and it's hard to find gas stations, so it's easy for her to sell small quantities to the motorcycle drivers. She hopes to expand both businesses in order to provide a better quality of life for her family. 

On behalf of Esperanza International, thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: To buy hair products

loans.name: Mrs. Chanry Sun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eighteen people who all live in Peam Sala village in Kandal province make up the village bank loan and they will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Chanry Sun is a village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which to cultivate rice. Aside from owning this plantation, she is a fruit seller in the local market. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy different kinds of fruit to re-sell. Additionally, she would use the rest of the loan to buy fuel for her pump to water her field when it is infertile. Her husband, Mr. M. Kea, helps her in both business activities.

Mrs. Chanry Sun is 37 years old and the mother of six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while three others are attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is four years old.

Mrs. Koemly S. did not come to take a loan but her husband did, so he is shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of fruit to re-sell and fuel for her pump to water her field

loans.name: Fwaz

texts.en: Fwaz A. E. is a young man who lives with his mother and his four sisters. He owns a grocery store and wants his store to do well. Being the only income earner in his household, he wants to provide his family with the best life possible. He is requesting a loan with which he will increase his volume of merchandise so as to provide his customers with a wider diversity of products.

loans.use: Increase merchandise to provide a diversity of products.

loans.name: Shokirjon

texts.ru: Шокиржон-молодой человек,неженат.Занимается продажей мужской одежды и обуви на вещевом рынке Спитаменского района уже более 5-ти лет.Его товары пользуются хорошим спросом,так как он провозит красивую модную одежду хорошего качества.Шокиржон 2 раза в месяц ездит за товаром в оптовый рынок города Истаравшан.На новый займ он расчитывает расширить свой ассортимент летних рубашек,футболок и сортивных костюмов.Шокиржон рад,что кредитуется у нас и благодарит наших кредиторов.
texts.en:
Shokirjon is a young man, not yet married. He has sold men's clothing and shoes at the Spitamen regional clothing market for more than five years. His goods are in high demand, since he carries good quality, attractive and fashionable merchandise. Twice a month, Shokirjon goes on a buying trip to the wholesale market in Istaravshan. With this new loan, he is thinking of expanding his selection of summer shirts, t-shirts and quality suits. Shokirjon is pleased to be a credit customer of MicroInvest, and thanks the lenders.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand selection of men's clothing

loans.name: Hadijatu

texts.en:
Hadijatu I. started her fish business six years ago in Mankessim in the central region of Ghana. She prepares and serves her customers very tasty and good quality fish, so many customers buy from her stand.

Hadijatu buys stocks of fish from the fishermen and smokes them. She also sells food, such as bags of maize. She treks to Atebubu in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana to buy her food. She has a large customer base that travels from the other part of the region to buy her fish.

She is now 38 years old, married, and the mother of four children. Wtih the help of the government's free compulsory education, all of her children are now in school.

She wants to use the loan to buy larger stocks of assorted fish and maize to increase her sales and income so that she can support her children's education and expand her business. She belongs to the village bank called "Noble Ladies."

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish and maize.

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroeun S., age 46, and her husband, Mr. Yorn Yin, age 45, live in a small village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 1990 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. Two of their children attend school, three children are weavers and the youngest son is still too young and stays at home.

Saroeun has been a silk weaver for almost eighteen years. She sells her finished products to a middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in the market in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a house builder and rice grower for the last ten years. He is a horse and cart driver as well. 

Saroeun has set up two more looms for her children to weave on, but they don’t have enough silk materials to continue their business. Therefore, Saroeun is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase silk material for her children’s looms.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her children’s weaving business

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty, 36 years old, is married with two children and one adopted child, who are currently in school. She is a petty trader who trades in maize, oranges and avocado. She has been retailing for the past eight years and has been very resourceful for her family. She wants to use the loan to buy bulk supplies of maize, oranges and avocado to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing food prices due to the current food crisis in the country. She believes in her ability to increase her profit margin with the loan funds.

loans.use: To purchase products in bulk

loans.name: Azimjon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Азимчон мужчина , который на дому построил пекарный цех и производит домашние лепёшки. Узнав от друзей, что можно в кредит осуществить свои планы.Поэтому Азимчон хочет в кредит купить известки и побелить пекарню.На снимке Азимчон в день выдачи.
texts.en:
Azimjon built a small bakery at his home and sells homemade bread called "lepyoshki." He heard from friends about the possibility of taking out a loan to make his plans of repairing the bakery a reality. Azimjon is applying for a loan to purchase lime to whitewash the walls of his bakery. Азимчон мужчина , который на дому построил пекарный цех и производит домашние лепёшки. Узнав от друзей, что можно в кредит осуществить свои планы.Поэтому Азимчон хочет в кредит купить известки и побелить пекарню.На снимке Азимчон в день выдачи.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his bakery

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Coconut trading is the new source of livelihood for Mrs Maria C.. She is 63 years old, married to Crispin C., and blessed with five children. She now has only one dependent, a daughter, as her other four children are already married. Her husband is a farmer who manages and cultivates his own cornland for their consumption and sometimes for sale. He is also sometimes her partner in the coconut trading business.

Maria started her coconut trading business in September 2008 with an initial capital of 1,500 PHP from her savings. Her neighbors were her first coconut suppliers. In addition to this business, Maria also has a piggery business, with one sow and twelve piglets. Now on her third loan cycle, she is applying for a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase feed for her little piggery and additional capital for her coconut trading business. Her dream for the future is to become a successful trader and hog raiser.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her piggery business and additional capital for coconut trading

loans.name: Munavar

texts.en:
B. Munavar is 44 years old. She is married and has two children. Munavar sells perfume and cosmetics. She has been in this business for 11 years. Munavar dreams of expanding her business, opening her own store, and establishing contacts with reliable suppliers of well-known products. Munavar and her husband work hard so that they have enough money to educate their children so that the children become highly-demanded experts in future. 

Today, Munavar is requesting 3500 Somoni to purchase new perfumes and cosmetics, such as hair color, nail varnish, lipstick, etc.to increase the range of goods that she sells. She would like to thank everybody supporting her and promises to repay her loan in a timely manner.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy supplies for her business

loans.name: Pedro Eduardo

texts.es: Pedro Eduardo B. V. tiene 53 años. Es un hombre casado y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales ninguno depende de él. Su actividad económica es la venta de productos lácteos. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. Surge por la necesidad de brindarle a su familia lo necesario. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cuajada, crema, leche y mantequilla. Su deseo es contar con su propio medio de transporte.
texts.en:
Pedro Eduardo B. V. is 53 years old. He is married and has 4 children, none of whom depend on him financially any longer. His economic activity is the sale of dairy products. He has dedicated himself to this business for more than 6 years. The business arose from his need to provide his family with the basic necessities. The financing he is seeking would be used as working capital to buy curd, cream, milk and butter. His dream is to have his own mode of transportation.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.en:
J. Nuriddin was born in 1965 and is married with three children. As an aspiring and hard-working man he has always dreamed of achieving success in whatever he does. Thus, when he joined IMON International last year, he was able to make much progress with his previous loan, which he invested mostly in crop farming. Then, he saw a new business opportunity: rearing of the young cattle, which is very profitable because of the constant demand for meat at the market. Given this loan, Nuriddin will purchase young cattle and feeding for them to expand his business. He plans to use the profits from his business to educate his children, improve the structure of his home, and improve the standard of living of his family.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a Nairobi based businessman who deals with beauty and cosmetics products. He has been in this business for the last two years. He is requesting a loan of Kes. 70,000 to add stock of cosmetics and beauty products. A father of two, Michael hopes to grow his business into import of assorted products and buy his family a home. He describes himself as hardworking, determined and self motivated.

About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Alberto Jesús

texts.es:
El señor Alberto Jesús C. ya ha tenido cuatro créditos los cuales han sido para la construcción de su casa.
Nueva mente esta solicitando un préstamo para  terminar la construcción de su vivienda  y así dejar de pagar renta y que su familia tenga un lugar seguro donde vivir, ya que desea que sus dos hijas tengan su propio casa. 
Planea pagar crédito con los ingresos que obtiene de su empleo como supervisor de ventas.
texts.en:
Alberto Jesús C. has already had four loans, which have been for the construction of his house. He is again asking for a loan to finish the construction on his house. That way he can stop paying rent, and his family will have a safe place to live. He wants his two daughters to have their own home. He plans to repay the loan with the income he gets from his employment as a sales supervisor.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish construction on his house (foundation and walls)

loans.name: Bc Abejitas Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal denominado  BC ABEJITAS  está conformado por DOCE personas de edades variadas que oscilan desde los 20 a los 55 años. La presidenta de la banca es una persona de carácter fuerte, alegre  y proactiva que en conjunto con sus vecinas forman parte de la banca, por otro lado tiene 1 hijo el cual se encuentra en edad escolar , La Sra. Marcela es la tesorera de la banca en una persona muy alegre, determinada y proactiva, que es madres de tres hijos pero uno de ellos ya formo su propio hogar la Sra. Santusa es la secretaria de la banca es una persona con carácter calmado pero proactivo y determinado , las otras personas que conforman la banca tienen personalidades similares. La presidenta  la Sra. Simona se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos, la Sra. Marcela se dedica a la venta de ropa de mujer (mandiles polleras) los cuales los comercializa en interior del departamento donde vive. La  Sra.
