Santusa se dedica a la venta de zapatos deportivos  por mayor lo  cual lo distribuye en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad, otras de las socias se dedican a la venta de comida tanto en su domicilio como en la feria, otro miembro  se dedica a la elaboración de colchones de lana, otra de la socias se dedica a venta de ropa deportiva.  Si bien dentro de los lugares donde se desarrollan sus actividades existen otros similares, la afluencia de  consumidores a los mercados, y el constante crecimiento urbano  hace que las actividades que se desarrollan en el lugar no se vean afectadas por lo contrario muchas de las socias están esperanzadas en hacer crecer sus negocios ampliándolos por lo cual solicitan el crédito. Las socias solicitan  el crédito para realizar la adquisición de mercadería en mayor cantidad, otras para la compra de nueva maquinas para incrementar su producción, otros para compra de materia prima en cantidad con lo cual crecer en cuanto a su capital de trabajo. Este grupo se encuentra en su primer ciclo, pero   la mayoría de ellas ya se conocen entre sí y cuentan con experiencia de trabajo en esta modalidad de crédito.
texts.en:
The BC Abejitas Communal Bank is comprised of 12 people of various ages from 20 to 55. The president of the bank is a person of strong character, happy, and proactive. Together with her neighbors she forms part of the bank. Her only child attends school. Marcela is the treasurer of the bank. She is a very happy, determined, and proactive person. She has three children; one has his own home. Santusa is the secretary of the bank. She is very calm, yet she is also proactive and determined. The other people who comprise the bank have similar personalities. The president, Simona, sells domestic appliances. Marcela sells women’s clothes (aprons and “polleras” traditional Bolivian skirts). She sells in the interior of the department where she lives. Santusa sells wholesale sporting shoes. She distributes them in the different fairs in the city. The other members sell things like food in their homes and at the fairs. Others make quilts from wool or sell sportswear. If there are others in their area doing the same work, the abundance of consumers in the market and the constant urban growth make sure that they are not affected. On the contrary, many of the members are hoping to make their businesses grow by expanding them. That is why they are asking for the loan. The members are asking for the loan to get a greater quantity of merchandise. Others will buy new machines to increase their production. Others will buy raw materials in large quantities, which will increase their working capital. This group is in their first cycle, but the majority of them already know each other and have working experience with this type of loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise and raw material

loans.name: Cesaria

texts.es:
La señora Cesaria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Susana Galdos”, Distrito Zapatero, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 31 años y 02 hijos, los 02 que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque en ella encuentran, todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos; galletas, fideos y sales en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Cesaria, se siente con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando y muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Cesaria, 31, is a member of the "Susana Galdos" communal bank which is in the Zapatero district, Lamas province, San Martín department. She lives with her life partner and they have two children, both of whom still are dependent on her. Her character and wish to continue to progress motivated her to start her own grocery store in her home the profits from which will help her meet her household expenses. She has steadily gained more customers from the time she started until today. She now can count on her regular customers who come to shop daily because they find all the products which housewives need and because they receive personalized attention from her with her characteristic charisma. With this 1000 sol loan she will buy sacks of rice and sugar, crackers, packages of pastas and salt, boxed milk and preserved fish in a variety of brands, flats of eggs and personal hygiene items to continue to give her customers the best attention. Cesaria very much wants to continue working and is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping women like her to have opportunities to develop in their areas of interest.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries to increase stock inventory.

loans.name: Etanislao

texts.es: Don Etanislao O., tiene su propio negocio de acarreo de la ruta de Managua a San Carlos, a muchos kilómetros de la capital, en su propio camión que logro comprar después que lo indemnizaron producto de un choque en su trabajo anterior, cuando viajaba en el bus y casi pierde la vida, fase muy difícil en su vida que poco a poco ha venido a asimilando, tiene 37 años de edad, vive junto a sus cuatro hijos todos al dominio de el y junto a su esposa. Por gracias a Dios ha logrado construir su casa aunque le falta mucho, el  repello de paredes, piso, divisiones pero que no le es de urgencia como la construcción del baño ya que lo tiene forrado de plástico negro y es inseguro e incomodo para todos mis hijos, pero por falta de dinero no ha podido hacer esta mejora que es cerrar el baño como comprar el inodoro ya que desea cerrar la letrina para una mejor higiene en su casa. Para esto comprara cemento, arena, piedra, hierro y hará posible hacer esta obra que es de gran necesidad para todos. Con los viajes puede dar la alimentación a su familia pero no ha logrado ahorrar lo suficiente ya que todo esta caro y cubre todos los gastos solo el. Solo a gracias al financiamiento de la institución esta logrando la construcción.  Sastifecho por el plazo ya que solo así las personas de poco recurso podemos salir adelante en cubrir las necesidades de vivienda.
texts.en:
Don Etanislao O. has his own cargo business in which he travels between Managua and San Carlos. He drives several kilometers to the capital in his own truck, which he bought using the settlement money he received as a result of an accident he suffered when he was at his previous job. Don Etanislao was traveling by bus when he almost lost his life. It was a difficult time in his life and it took awhile before everything could return back to normal. He is 37 years old and lives at home with his wife and four children.

Thanks to God, he was able to build a house but it is far from being completed. The walls have to be plastered, a floor has to be installed, and dividers need to go up, but the most urgent necessity is the construction of a bathroom. The space being used at the moment is lined with black plastic and is both unsafe and uncomfortable for the children. Don Etanislao currently lacks the money needed to enclose the bathroom and install a toilet to provide better hygiene in his home. He plans to buy cement, sand, stone, and iron so that the work can proceed for everyone’s benefit. Through his cargo business, Don Etanislao is able to feed his family. Since he is the only family member generating income, he has not been able to save enough for anything that is expensive. Funding from the Institution is the only way construction could ever be possible. Paying back in installments is the only means by which people of low income are able to successfully take care of their housing necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a bathroom

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is 45 years old. She is married and has seven children who are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing-dominated community in the central region of Ghana. Aba is a trader. She trades in cosmetics. She hawks and treks to nearby communities to sell on their market days. Aba has been in business for six years and desires to expand her business. She wants the loan to procure many kinds of cosmetics – body spray, cream, pomade, etc., in bulk.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to resell

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe T. is from the village of Bunawan Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old, is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Maria Fe owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Maria Fe has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Maria Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. Maria Fe is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Maria Fe from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer es un muchacho de 21 años, muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia hecha de abobe, junto a su esposa Micaela, de 19 años, y su querido hijo Ton de 1 año, a quienes desea dar un buen futuro.
Los días como ladrillero son muy largos y duros, se levanta a las 6 de la mañana para realizar el amasado y moldeado de los ladrillos, los cuales posteriormente meterá en su horno para coserlos y así estén listos para la venta. Los pedidos que tiene por lo general son muy grandes, por lo que pide ayuda de sus vecinos ladrilleros para cumplir con el pedido, con la promesa de ayudarlos cuando ellos necesiten de él.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es hacer los ladrillos, ya que siente que juega con el barro y no tanto que trabaja. Lleva 5 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es acomodar los ladrillos en el horno, ya que tiene que ponerlos de forma que todos cosan por igual. 
Para el futuro, espera que su negocio progrese y pueda mejorar sus ingresos económicos.

Este es el cuarto préstamo de Elmer con MFP y no quiere dejar de pagarlo por falta de dinero, así que ya está haciendo contactos para vender sus ladrillos. Él es el único varón de su banco comunal por lo que siempre trata de ser responsable y respetuoso con sus compañeras. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevos moldes para hacer ladrillos y así incrementar la cantidad que produce diariamente.
texts.en:
Elmer is a very simple and hard-working 21 year old young man. He lives in his own house made of adobe, together with his wife Micaela, who is 19 years old, and his beloved son Ton, who is 1, and to whom he wishes to give a good future.

His days as a brick-maker are very long and hard. He wakes up at 6 o'clock in the morning to mix and mold the bricks, which he will then put in his oven to bake, and then they will be ready to sell. The orders that he has are generally very large, and so therefore he requests help from his neighbors, who are also brick-makers, in order to complete the requests, with the promise to help them when they need his help. What he likes most about his work is making the bricks, since he feels like he is playing with the clay and its not like work. He has been doing this work for 5 years and he considers the most difficult part putting the bricks in the oven, since he has to put them in a way that they all cook evenly. For the future, he hopes that his business progresses and that he is able to improve his income.

This is Elmer's fourth loan with MFP and he doesn't want to miss any payments for lack of money, so he is already making contacts to sell his bricks. He is the only young man in his community bank, so therefore he always tries to be responsible and respectful of his female colleagues. With the 2,000 new soles he is requesting, he will buy new molds for making bricks, and thus increase the quantity that he produces daily.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy brick molds

loans.name: Tayagba Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the Tayagba Group. They are small scale businesspeople in the township of Magburaka, in northern Sierra Leone, applying to SMT/Kiva Lenders for the first time for a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living.

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs, Idrissa F., 27, was born in Magburaka, is married to a businesswoman and is the father of one child. Idrissa has been a motorbike driver for three years now, and with his share of this loan, along with savings, he will buy a new motorbike.

loans.use: Buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Sherlita's Group

texts.en:
Sherlita M. is from the village of Villa Marzo. Sherlita is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Sherlita is 48 years old and married, with 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Sherlita raises livestock. The main source of income for her business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Sherlita has been in business for more than 2 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP whenever she sells her raised animals.

In 2008, Sherlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sherlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from ASKI, which she used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Sherlita is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Sherlita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina is an unmarried woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She doesn’t have children so has focused her attention on her two nieces. She sends them to school and finds joy in doing it. She has been running her store for years now and she said that out of her income from it, she was able to acquire home appliances.  Josefina is requesting a loan of Php15, 000. She will use this loan to acquire additional supplies for her store.

loans.use: To acquire additional supplies.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa J. es madre de tres hijos a los cuales quiere darles una mejora calidad de vida; es por ello que todos los días por la mañana junto con su marido salen a trabajar en maquiladora. Teresa obtuvo una casa de interés social a la cual le ha ido haciendo mejoras ya que en un tiempo la dejo sola y los delincuentes se la destruyeron, con este crédito será su segundo préstamo en el que ha demostrado tener una cultura de pago muy buena y agradece el apoyo brindado para realizar su proyecto.
En este momento desea  terminar de instalar  el alambrado de su casa, ya que también los ladrones le robaron los cables y por lo que tiene que habitar en la casa de su hermana que le prestó mientras terminaba su casa.
texts.en:
Teresa J. has three children, and she wants to give them a better quality of life. That is why she and her husband go to work every morning in the factory. Teresa got a house from social services, and she has been making improvements. At one time she left it alone, and the delinquents destroyed it. This will be her second loan. She has demonstrated very good payment history, and she is grateful for the support in order to work on her project. At this time she wants to finish installing the wiring in her house. The thieves also stole the cables. Therefore, she has to live in her sister’s house, which her sister lent her while she finishes her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install wiring in her house

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El señor Juan Carlos es un cliente nuevo que se dedica al transporte publico y tambien trabaja medio tiempo con su minibus como Gondola del Colegio Monserrat de la zona de Chasquipampa, ya van tres años que el señor se dedica a este rubro ya que antes trabajaba como auditor en una  empresa de la ciudad de el alto, gracias al buen salario que recibio de esta institucion el señor pudo contruir su casa de 500 mts en la zona de pedregal y tambien alquilar su anterior casa en la ciudad de El Alto, ua vez terminado el domicilio donde vive actualmente el señor Juan Carlos se dio cuenta de que habia dejado descuidada la relacion con su unico hijo y esposa, es por eso que decidio dejar el trabajo y dedicarse al transporte publico y estar mas tiempo en casa. Actualmente don Juan Carlos es propietario de tres automoviles, dos toyotas y un Minibus, el  automovil del cual recibe renta piensa venderlo uno de sus autos al actual chofer (solo le faltan los papeles para cerrar el trato) y con ese dinero de esta venta y mas el monto de este credito piensa comprar un nuevo auto Toyota Sprinter. La idea del señor tomar de nuevo un trabajo relacionado con su carrera y hacer trabajar las tres movilidades para aumentar sus ingresos. Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y KIva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is a new client who works in public transportation. He also uses his minibus as a part time school bus for the Monserrat School in the Chasquipampa area. He has worked in this field for three years. Before that he worked as an auditor for a company in the city of El Alto. Thanks to the good salary he received from this institution, he was able to build a 50 square meter house in the Pedregal area. He also rents his previous house in the city of El Alto. Once he finished the house where he currently lives, Juan Carlos realized that he had neglected his relationship with his only child and his wife. Therefore, he decided to leave his job and work in public transportation in order to spend more time at home. Juan Carlos currently owns three automobiles, two Toyotas and a minibus. He is thinking of selling one of the cars he rents out to the current driver (they only need the papers to close the deal). With this money from selling the automobile and the money from this loan he plans on buying a new car, a Toyota Sprinter. His idea is to once again work in the area of his career and to make the three automobiles work for him to increase his income. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence given in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a vehicle

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn S. is from the village of Solinog, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old. Merlyn is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Merlyn operates a restaurant. The main source of income for the business comes from serving foods for meals to customers in the local community. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Merlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. This will be the first loan taken out by Merlyn from GDMPC, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food and drinks for the restaurant

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria es una madre de familia de 55 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus cinco hijos, dos de los cuales aún estudian, en el centro poblado Chosica del Norte, distrito de La Victoria, ubicado a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella tiene en su casa un horno artesanal en el cual elabora pan, desde hace mas de tres años su familia se sostiene económicamente con esta actividad, su esposo solía trabajar como obrero de construcción civil, pero debido a su avanzada edad tuvo que dejar su trabajo y retomar su oficio de panadero.

Gregoria trabaja junto a su esposo desde las 6 de la tarde hasta muy avanzada la noche amasando los ingredientes para la elaboración del pan, luego lo hornean en la madrugada para sacarlo a la venta. Todos los días, a partir de las 5:30 de la mañana, dos jóvenes y sus dos hijos menores salen a repartir pan en algunas bodegas y viviendas de la zona, luego sus dos hijos van a la escuela, ella también vende pan por las mañanas en la esquina de su casa.

Gregoria ya había trabajado anteriormente con el fondo Kiva, ella se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas que en aquella oportunidad le ayudaron a mantener su negocio ante el incremento del precio de los insumos que necesitaba, a raíz de ese préstamo,su negocio empezó a crecer y desde entonces pudo contratar a los dos jóvenes que le ayudan a captar mas clientes y seguir creciendo como empresaria. Actualmente ella ha solicitado nuevamente a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de insumos para seguir ampliando su panadería.

Con las ganancias percibidas Gregoria ha podido avanzar en la construcción de su casa, lo que la pone orgullosa, ella sigue trabajando para que sus dos últimos hijos puedan estudiar alguna carrera técnica, ella es una mujer honesta y muy querida por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a 55-year old mother who lives with her husband and five children, two of whom are still in school. They live in the neighbourhood of Chosica del Norte, in the district of Victoria, located about ten minutes from Chiclayo. Gregoria has a homemade oven in her home in which she has been baking bread for the past three years. She supports her family with the income from this work. Her husband used to work in construction, but as he got older he had to stop and return to his job as a baker. Gregoria and her husband work from six in the evening to late at night mixing together the ingredients for the bread which they then bake in the early hours ready to sell to their customers. Everyday from 5:30am, their two young helpers and their two youngest children go around delivering bread to neighbourhood stores and homes. Then their two children set off for school. Gregoria also sells bread in the mornings from the corner near her house. She has worked in the past with Kiva and is very grateful to the staff who assisted her with the business which finally began to do well and she was able to hire two young people to help out. She is once again asking Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 soles with which she is planning to buy ingredients and continue expanding her bakery business. With any profit she earned, Gregoria continued building her house, a feat which has made her very proud. She wants to continue working so that her last two children can study technology. She is an honest woman and much loved by her neighbours.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making bread

location.town: Chosica del Norte - La Victoria - Chiclayo

loans.name: Sakaria

texts.en:
Sakaria is a 38 year-old clothing merchant.  He sells shirts and shoes for both men and women in a local marketplace.  He has been in this business for 12 years and has one other employee.  Sakaria is married and has three children; two boys and one girl aged from 6 to 15 years old. 

The primary business challenges that he faces are low sales due to competition, intermittent bad weather, and local regulations. Before selling clothes, he was a tailor.
 
Sakaria plans to use the 60,000 KES loan to purchase more stock of shoes and shirts that are in fashion with the hope of increasing his sales.

In the future, Sakaria hopes to increase his sales enough to open a boutique shop.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of shoes and shirts to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formo mediante el deseo de las señoras de trabajar en grupo con ayuda mutua entre ellas.
Una de las integrantes es la señora  Francisca quien  es ama de casa ella trabaja en su casa y atiende a sus hijos, al mismo tiempo ella atiende el negocio que tiene en su casa.
Ella comenta que está muy contenta con el grupo, y desea seguir trabajando para fortalecer el comité.
Ella solicita el crédito para invertir en la compra de los productos que solicitan sus clientes que en general son de consumo familiar como harina, arroz, panificados, lácteos, y otros.
texts.en:
This committee was formed due to the desire of the women to work together and help each other. One of the group members is Francisca who is a housewife; she cares for her home and children but at the same time tends to her home-based business. She states that she is very happy with the group and wants to continue working to strengthen the group. She is asking for funds to buy the products that her customers most request: flour, rice, baked goods, dairy products, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, pasta, sugar, rice, baked goods, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Pan

texts.en: Mr. Pan L., born in 1940, is married and blessed with five children, three of whom are now married and living separateL., while another two are single and employed in different occupations. Pan L. is engaged in his own business, the main operation of which is to build stone and wooden houses. As well, since the beginning of 1993 he and his wife have always taken time to raise rice and pigs for extra income. A hard-working man, Pan L. recentL. received an  order to build a new house, but he lacks the essential materials to perform his service. He is therefore requesting a loan of $600 to buy those materials.

loans.use: To buy essential materials to build a house for his customer

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice P. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.

Joice is 49 years old and is widowed. She has seven children and her children do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Viet

texts.en: Viet T. N. was born in 1958. She lives in Ha Lam village, Thuy Lam commune. She has three children (two sons and a daughter). Her husband has died. Now, she raises 600 chickens. She has participated in SEDA since 2006 and repaid punctually. She would like to borrow 5,450,000 VND in order to buy food for her chickens. She is the leader of a five-member loan group from SEDA.

loans.use: To buy food for chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Storing and reselling corn

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou S. is from the village of Soyung Echague. She is 41 years old. Marilou is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Marilou sells cosmetic products. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Marilou joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Marilou from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Saiberia Group

texts.en:
Zainabu K. is in her early thirties and is married with three children. Zainabu has been running her own grocery store for the past two years where she sells food, juice, water and other goods. The shop is open daily between 7 am and 9 pm and earns Zainabu a small monthly profit. 

This will be Zainabu's first loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. With this loan, Zainabu aims to increase her stock of goods, and thus expand her business. Zainabu wishes to expand her business and gain a good credit history in order to be eligible for an individual loan.

Zainabu will share the loan with her loan group Saiberia, which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans. 

In the picture, Zainabu is wearing green, and is 1st on the left front row.

loans.use: Increase stock of goods.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna M. is from the village of Poblacion, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 42 years old. Myrna is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Myrna makes and sells snacks and other delicacies such as chicharron, macaroni crunch, and nata de coco ice candy. She sells these items in her local community. Myrna has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Myrna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Myrna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients

loans.name: Soung

texts.en:
Soung Y. is a 49-year-old widowed villager who lives in Kompong Tom province. She is the mother of only one child who is studying in high school. Her husband died of senility years ago.
Soung Y. has been in the farming business for years. She has also built a pigpen behind her house where she raises many pigs to earn more income for family expenses. Since the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for her, Soung Y. has requested a loan in order to buy additional pigs to raise for sale during the period when pork is commanding a high price.

loans.use: To buy additional pigs to raise for sale

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita C. is from the village of Bangahan, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 52 years old. Carmelita is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Carmelita owns and operates a business making and selling food. The main source of income comes primarily from making and selling Filipino snacks, delicacies like bitso-bitso and toron, in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Carmelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional raw ingredients and increase working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Carmelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw ingredients and increase working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his car and wool for weaving.

loans.name: Hector Freddy

texts.es:
Héctor de 63 años, tiene una actividad económica no muy común que es la de vende carne de chancho en un local. Antes de tener su negocio trabaja en una tercena (carnicería) rebanando carnes. 

Como independizarse le llamaba mucho la atención decidió tener su propio negocio para poder mantener a su familia en una situación económica estable. En la actualidad el tiene un negocio de venta de carne de cerdo. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 19h30pm. El vende la libra de cerdo a $ 2.00. Una de las facilidades que tiene es que su esposa le ayuda en el negocio haciendo fritadas (plato típico del ecuador con granos). 

Para seguir con el negocio él quiere comprar con el préstamo carne de chancho. En el futuro quiere surtir su negocio con diferentes carnes para tener todas las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Héctor, 63, has a not-too-common economic activity which is selling pork in a locale.  Prior to having his business he worked for a butcher shop cutting meat.

Becoming independent was very attractive to him so he decided to set up a business of his own to support his family in a stable economic way.  He currently has a pork selling business.  He works from 8am until 7:30pm.  He sells a pound of pork for $2.00.  One of the things that help his business is that his wife makes fritadas (a typical Ecuadorean dish made with grains).

To stay in business he wants to use the loan to buy pork.  In the future he’d like to stock the business with different kinds of meat in order to meet all his customers’ needs.

loans.use: For meat.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora L. is from the town of Banga. She is 42 years old. Leonora is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Leonora owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Leonora wishes to be a successful businesswoman.

Leonora joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonora has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Leonora is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other inputs

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dolores; ella tiene 55 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. comida, la socia venD. comida en forma ambulatoria, ella prepara desayunos y almuerzos en la final D. uno D. los carros que hace servicio público, la socia trabaja desD. las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia quiere tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.               
    
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Madres Trabajadoras Communal Bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Dolores is 55 years old, married, and has four children. She alternates her daily activities with her work selling food by foot. She prepares breakfasts and lunches in the back part of one of the vehicles used for public service. She works from 6am to 5pm and she wants to have a restaurant. She is requesting the loan to purchase items to cook such as chicken, meat, and vegetables.

Dolores is happy because of the loan and promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: To purchase items to cook such as chicken, meat, and vegetables

loans.name: Mrs. Chuk Srey Touch Village Bank Group

texts.en: Nine people make up a village bank loan group located in Run village in Takeo province. They will use their portion of the loan for varied ways to support their families. Chuk S. T. is the president of the group.  She was selected by the other members. She owns a general store in local village where she earns money by selling groceries to support her family. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand.  Chuk S. T. is requesting a loan to buy more groceries to sell. Her husband, Vannak Sien, is a farmer who owns a very small piece of land where he grows rice to sell to support his family. The couple supports three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, one of whom is a laborer, and one of whom attends the local public school.

loans.use: To purchase groceries

loans.name: Dareen

texts.en:
Dareen is a married woman who lives in Victorias City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: selling salted peanuts and selling frozen foods. Her husband Wilmer, who is 38 years old, works as an administrator of a fishing boat to earn his living. They have four children who are between 2 and 12 years old. Dareen joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Dareen has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her ninth loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use as additional capital to save up for the future education of her children and to build their own house. Dareen is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mrs. Mao, who was born in 1964, is a fruit seller who is able to earn a small income to help support her family.  Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it.  Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fruit to enlarge her business.  Mao’s husband owns a motorbike used to transport his wife‘s fruit to the market to sell.  He is also a taxi driver who is able to earn a small income to add to his wife's savings to improve his family's living situation.  This couple has two children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory and one is attending a local school.  She is in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to enlarge her business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband in the village of Sartichala, Kartli Region. She is 56 years old. She works in local polyclinics as a family doctor. At the same time, Ana is actively involved in agricultural activities. Ana’s husband is a pensioner. Ana has adult children, who are already of full age and live separately. Ana and her husband have a greenhouse where they grow tomatoes. At the same time they have 3 milch cows and sales of dairy products (traditional homemade Georgian cheese) are another source of income for their family. 

Ana and her husband built their greenhouse 2 years ago. It has an area of appx. 200 sq. meters. Tomatoes harvested in the greenhouse are sold locally in the village among the villagers.  The main part of the requested loan will be used for renovation of the greenhouse – old cellophane needs to be exchanged for new one. With the new cellophane, the temperature in the greenhouse will become stable and this will increase the quality and the quantity of the tomatoes grown. 

A small part of the loan will be used for start-up costs for another micro-business – trade with combined food for domestic animals. 

With the additional income received as a result of the loan, Ana plans to assist her children. Also another part of the profit will be used for extension of the newly started trading business.

loans.use: to renovate her greenhouse.

loans.name: Bienvinida

texts.en:
Bienvinida, 55 years old, is already a widow and has 7 children to support. Her oldest child is 36 years old and the youngest is 17. Bienvinida has children who still go to school.

Bienvinida is a farmer who grows rice to sell to the people in her community. She also owns and manages a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells sugar, detergent soap and other products. This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and additional merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and merchandise to sell

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a driver and he supports his family financially. They live at a house that they own. Their home has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

She has operated a video shop business for the past five years. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. Consolata faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase cassettes for her video business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase cassettes for her video business.

loans.name: Porfirio Antonio

texts.es:
Porfirio está muy feliz, pues con su credikiva aumentó la fabricación de salchipapas y hamburguesas se ha entusiasmado y como necesita un fondo de efectivo para comprar materias primas e insumos para responder oportunamente, está recurriendo a su segundo financiamiento mediante la línea credikiva. 
Porfirio F. envia el siguiente mensaje a sus fondeadores de Kiva : "Muchas gracias por el apoyo financiero" esto es porque ha logrado aumentar su capital de trabajo, su liquidez sus ventas y sus utilidades y  debido a esto y con la ayuda de sus familiares, reunió dinero y compró una vivienda para el y su familia.
Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Porfirio, ingrese al siguiente enlace:
http://www.kiva.org/lend/230318
texts.en:
Porfirio is very happy because with his Kiva loan he was able to increase production of salchipapas (a traditional fast food consisting of sausages and french fries) and hamburgers. He has been encouraged and as he needs some funds to purchase ingredients and products to respond to client demand, he has requested his second Kiva loan. 

Porfirio F. conveys the following message to his Kiva lenders: "Thank you very much for the financial support. This has increased his working capital and his sales have increased, as has his competitiveness. Thank thanks to this he is able to help his family, by saving money and to purchase a house for himself and for his family.

If you want to see Porfirio's history, please click on the following link: 

http://www.kiva.org/lend/230318

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and products for his fast food business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter, 35, does welding so as to earn a living. He has operated the business for ten years. Being a member of Faulu Kenya, he has been trained on business management. Through the training, he has developed a habit of saving and he budgets for his business. He hopes to grow his business and employ people in the future. He has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy iron sheet and to pay for labour.

loans.use: to buy iron sheet and to pay for labour

loans.name: Afua Enyonam Ehia

texts.fr: Revendeuse dans la mercerie et de mèches, Afua est âgée de 44 ans et vit en couple avec  son mari et ses 02 enfants. Elle a commencée son activité depuis 2008 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Elle est à son troisième cycle de prêt et mène son activité à bien. C’est une dame battante et  de bonne moralité.
texts.en: Afua, who is a retailer of haberdashery products and hair extensions, is 44 years old and lives with her husband and her two children. She began her business in 2008 and gets her supplies at the large market in Lomé. She is on her third loan and manages her business well. She is a fighter and a woman with high morals.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and haberdashery products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Tututepec San Pedro Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Tututepec San Pedro sus integrantes le pusieron  así por que  es el nombre de su pueblo. El grupo  Tututepec San Pedro esta conformado  por  doce personas, tienen  como representante  de grupo a la señora Alma Eva  que tiene una tienda de abarrotes. Este grupo  esta ubicado  en la localidad San Pedro estado de Oaxaca.
La señora Claudia  tiene 39 años  estudio hasta  quinto grado de la primaria , tiene  tres hijos  dos mujeres y un varón. La señora Claudia se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y a la venta de pollo. La señora Claudia necesitaba el préstamo para  para comprar mas pollos , ya que la ganancia la va utilizar para hacer una pollerilla. 
El negocio  de los pollos lo empezó desde hace tres años atrás antes de que pusiera su tienda de abarrotes.
Sus clientes  la prefieren por que les  vende muy bien , otra de las cosas es por que les da fiado y  cuando cobran le van a pagar, es una forma de ayudar a sus  clientes.
La señora Claudia   lo que desea de este préstamo  es de hacerse  de una pollería  mas grande , para tener mas ganancias y así ayudar a sus hijos ,para que puedan terminar sus estudios, también para tener una mejor calidad de vida .
Los  otros  diez integrantes se llaman:
Cristina – para la compra de hilos para hacer manteles , servilletas.
Enma  Margarita – para la venta de zapatos.
Alejandra –compra de maíz para , poder vender tortillas.
Francisca-para la compra de materiales para hacer tamales.
Eva –para  la compra de mercancía para  su tienda de abarrotes.
Ciria- para poderse trasladar y vender  carnes frías.
Rosario-para materiales para hacer tamales.
Berta- para materiales para hacer tamales.
Elia-para la compra y venta de frutas y verduras.
Donaciana- para la  venta y compra de calzado.

Le dan las gracias a fundación realidad por el apoyo que les a brindado.
texts.en:
This group is called Tututepec San Pedro.  The members named it after their village.  The 'Tututepec San Pedro' group has twelve members.  The group's representative is Alma Eva who owns a grocery store.  This group is located in the town of San Pedro, in the State of Oaxaca.

Claudia is 39 years old and studied up to the fifth grade of elementary school.  She has three children: two daughters and one son.  Her business is selling groceries and also selling chicken.  She needs this loan to buy more chickens since she will use the profits to set up a chicken store.

Claudia started her chicken business three years ago, before she set up her grocery store.  Her customers are loyal to her business because she sells very well.  In addition, she sells on credit and when her customers get paid, they pay her.  It is a way of helping her customers.

What Claudia would like to gain from this loan is a large chicken store so that she can make more profits and thereby help her children to finish their studies.  She would also like to be able to enjoy a better quality of life.

The other ten members of this group are:

Cristina – who will buy threads for making tablecloths and napkins
Enma Margarita – who will sell shoes
Alejandra – who will buy corn so that she can sell tortillas
Francisca – who will buy supplies for making tamales
Eva – who will buy merchandise for her grocery store
Ciria – who will transport and sell cold meats
Rosario – who will buy supplies for making tamales
Berta – who will buy materials for making tamales
Elia – who will buy and sell fruit and vegetables
Donaciana – who will buy and sell footwear

The women are grateful to Fundación Realidad for the support that they have given them.

loans.use: to buy and sell chicken

loans.name: Rafael Leopoldo

texts.es: Rafael Leopoldo tiene 43 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de ganado. Este negocio lo inicio con fondos propios, pues su Padre le enseño este medio de vida, pero con el paso del tiempo es que ha logrado adquirir experiencia. Trabaja todos los días para conseguir gastos para sufragar su hogar. Este crédito es para la compra vacas, toros y chivos.  Desea mejorar sus ingresos para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
43-year old Rafael Leopoldo earns his living buying and selling cattle. He started the business using his own money; his father taught him about the cattle business but as time passed he got more and more experience of his own.

Rafael works every day to earn money for household expenses. This loan is to be used to buy cows, bulls, and young goats. Rafael wishes to earn more money so he can provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy cows, bulls, and young goats

loans.name: Salatiel

texts.fr: Salatiel   est un enseignant, il est âgé de 58 ans, il est marié, et il est né au Rwanda.  Il a 4 enfants  dans son charge et ses enfants sont  entre 19 ans et 25 ans, 3 vont à l’école .Son niveau d’éducation est des études université. C’est son troisième  cycle de prêt avec ACB.  Il va payer les frais des études  pour ses enfants. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est  de facilite ses enfants à accéder aux études supérieur pour qu’ils préparent leurs futures. Dans l’avenir il voudrait avoir une famille bien éduqué, et assure le développement  de sa famille.
texts.en: Salatiel is an educator. He is 58 years old and married. He is born in Rwanda. He has four dependent children, from 19 to 25 years of age, three of whom study. He has a university degree. This is his third loan cycle with ACB. He is going to pay tuition costs for his children. His strategy is to support his children in getting a higher education in order to prepare for the future. He would like to have a well-educated family and be able to improve their life conditions.

loans.use: to pay tuition for his children

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel, aged 29, is married to Ekirah and they have two children. He operates an auto shop at Grogan trading area. Samuel has been running this business for six years now.

This is the second loan he is getting from KADET and he intends to use the loan to buy some engines, tires, glue gum and pliers. Besides this business, he also runs a press work business and other motor vehicles.

loans.use: to buy engines, tires, glue, gum, and pliers

loans.name: Kibaya Tutungukye Group B

texts.en:
Milton, a father of five, operates a cattle sales business in Kihihi, located in the western part of Uganda. Having established his enterprise with savings from his farming enterprise, which he still operates, this strongly motivated and ambitious man has seen his business make significant headway during this last decade despite financial difficulties in the procurement of additional cattle to resell. Milton's diligence, cooperation with close friends and family and a strong determination have contributed to his progress.

Milton exudes confidence and he invariably creates a relaxed and placid atmosphere around those he deals with. He reckons that he will be able to bask in the glow of increased profits when he gets this loan, which he will use to purchase more cattle for resale. By his own account, he is good credit risk, and estimates his gross monthly sales to be Uganda shillings 250,000. This will be the second group loan for Milton's group.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to resell.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during rainy season. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase threads and fabric. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase threads and fabric.

loans.name: Yonny Claudio

texts.es:
Yonny Claudio tiene 43 años de edad, es soltero tiene dos hijos vive solo,  en el Canton Chillanes Provincia de Bolivar.

La V.R.C se llama EL PLACER perteneciente al Canton Chillanes parroquia San Jose del Tambo esta ubicada a 60 minutos de la oficina, en esta ventanilla hay 24 socios que se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de Platano, arroz, yuca, cacao, soya y naranja ademas crian animales de corral.

Yonny  se dedica a la siembra de arroz, maiz, naranja, soya y platano y a la cria de chanchos. Las compras las realiza en San Jose del Tambo y las Vende en el mercado de Chillanes los domingos en la feria.

El credito lo solicita para comprar de insumos agricolas y alimentacion para los chanchos. El credito le ayudara como apoyo para mejorar la cosecha y los animales. No enfrenta desafios importantes. Su sueño es tener casa propia y vivir con los hijos.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a jugar pelota con los vecinos.
texts.en:
Yonny Claudio is 43 years old, single, and has two children. He lives by himself in the canton of Chillanes in Bolivar Province.

The Communal Bank called “El Placer” is part of the canton of Chillanes and in the parish of San Jose del Tambo, which is located 30 minutes away from the office of Cooperativa San Jose. This Communal Bank consists of 24 members who are farmers. They grow bananas, rice, cassava, cacao, soybeans, and oranges. In addition, they raise domesticated animals.

Yonny grows rice, corn, oranges, soybeans, and bananas. He also raises pigs. Yonny purchases his supplies in San Jose del Tambo and sells his products at the market in Chillanes and at the fair on Sundays.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy farming supplies and feed for his pigs. This money will help him improve his crops and his animals. Yonny does not face any major challenges. His dream is to have a house of his own where he can live with his children.

In his free time, Yonny enjoys playing ball with the neighbors.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Progress Group

texts.en:
Constance is 29 and lives in Masvingo. She is married and her husband is a delivery driver for a local bakery. They have two children: one is at school and one is still at home.
Constance makes money in a variety of ways including the purchase and sale of blankets, clothes and chickens. She is also employed as a secretary for a government department.
She wishes to expand the poultry side of her operations and will spend the money she borrows to buy chicks and also to travel to South Africa to buy more goods for sale.
Over the next five years, she wishes to increase the space in which she raises her chickens and have an outlet to sell her products.

loans.use: To buy chicks and clothes for sale.

loans.name: Machala Group

texts.fr: Habitant dans une ville qui se trouve au Sénégal, ce groupement existe depuis plus de 5 ans dans cette localité. Leur activité principale est la vente de services. Ce crédits est destiné a l'achat de matériels informatiques (ordinateurs, souris, clavier, unité central, carte mer) pour renforcer son équipement dans son Cyber café et d'acheter des produits qui sont pour la maintenance du matériel informatique. Ce prêt leur permettrai de répondre aux exigences des clients vue que l'internet est de plus en plus sollicité dans certains milieu de la région et que la demande se fait de plus en plus sentir
texts.en: This group, which lives in a town in Senegal, was formed more than five years ago in this town. Their principal activity is the sale of services. This loan will be used to buy computer equipment (computers, mouses, keyboards, central units, mother cards) in order to strengthen the borrower's equipment in his cybercafé, as well as to buy products for maintaining computer equipment. The loan will allow him to respond to customer demand, given that internet is more and more in demand in certain areas of the region.

loans.use: to buy computers

loans.name: Nomelita

texts.en:
Nomelita is 32 years old.  She is married with one child.  Nomelita has a store in which she sells her boiled duck eggs as a food supplement. These eggs are rich in protein and other minerals.  She has had this business twenty years.  She requested a loan for 15,000 Philipine pesos (PHP) to buy more stocks of duck eggs to sell.

Nomelita has been a member of Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation Inc. (HSPFI) since 2011.  In the future, Nomelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boiled duck eggs to sell.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 28 years old. She is married. 

Jenelyn is engaged in fruit and vegetable vending. She also sells onions, garlic and other spices, and packed seasonings. She has had this business for three years. 

She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more fruits, vegetables, onions, garlic, spices, and packed seasonings. 

Jenelyn joined as a member of HSPFI in the year 2011. In the future she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits and vegetables intended for sale.

loans.name: Jessi

texts.es: Jessi, de 32 años, es una mujer amable y buena. Vive con su pareja y sus tres hijos en su casa propia, inmueble que pudo obtener a base de mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio. El trabajo de Jessi consiste en la venta de ropa de segunda, en la ciudad compra por fardos (bolsas grandes) de ropa usada, de ahí selecciona de acuerdo a su funcionalidad y su uso, una vez que ella realiza la separación correspondiente, se va en busca de sus compradores que en su mayoría son pobladores de los caseríos y pueblos que están cerca de la ciudad, lleva realizando este trabajo por un año y lo hace sola. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que invierte poco y gana un buen porcentaje, además que le permite estar casi todos los días con sus hijos ya que solo viaja dos días a la semana y en esos dos días hace la venta como para toda la semana, le esta yendo bien ya que en su hogar su conviviente aporta de su trabajo. Espera la oportunidad para vender en mayor cantidad y así aumentar sus ganancias. Este será el primer crédito con la institución MFP, esta muy emocionada de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Con el monto solicitado, comprará mayor cantidad de ropa de segunda, además incursionará con la venta de prendas nuevas.
texts.en: Jessi is 32 years old and is a good, kind woman. She lives with her partner and their 3 children in their own house, a building bought with hardwork and sacrifice. Jessi sells used clothing. She buys bundles (large bags) of used clothes in the city from which she selects according to functionality and use. Once she has separated the clothes, she goes in search of buyers who are mostly the residents of the villages and towns near the city. She has been doing this work alone for a year. What she likes about the work is that she invests little and makes a good percentage in profit. In addition, it allows her to spend almost every day with her children as she only travels 2 days a week and on those days she makes enough sales for the whole week. She is doing well as her partner contributes to the household. She awaits the opportunity of selling in larger quantities and thereby increasing profits. This will be her first loan with MFP. She is very excited to know that she will have financial support as she will then feel secure enough to move forward with her business. Witrh the requested amount, she will buy a large amount of used clothes and in addition she will experiment with buying and selling new clothes.

loans.use: to buy used clothing and clothes.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a 30-year-old single lady who owns a house with neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and transport. 

Luvuno has operated a broom-selling business for the past twelve years. Her clients are the local area residents. Her major challenge is the lack of raw materials to make her products. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase more raw materials to make brooms. She decided to join Yehu because they offer quality financial services.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials to make brooms.

loans.name: Djumakan

texts.ru:
Джумакан родилась в селе Партсъезд (Панфиловский район, Чуйская обл., Кыргызская Республика). Джумакан выросла в большой семье с тремя братьями и двумя сестрами, родители были простыми рабочими.  После окончания школы Джумакан помогала семье по хозяйству и с детства получила большой опыт в работе с домашней живностью и полеводством. Основным источником дохода семьи было выращивание свеклы, и о дальнейшем получении образования  в то время не могло быть и речи. Выйдя замуж за своего односельчанина, молодая семья стала трудится на поле, также выращивая свеклу. Жить в родном селе, где не было работы, где все люди занимались только разведением живности и выращиванием свеклы становилось все трудней и трудней, земли не хватало для всех семей, а у Джумакан к тому времени подрастали дети. Вот так в один день Джумакан с мужем решились попросить у родителей супруга одну из трех дойных коров, ставшей первым вкладом в животноводческий бизнес молодой семьи. Получив корову, семья начала сдавать молоко, муж Джумакан устроился в колхоз чабаном, молодая семья с двумя маленькими детьми жила в маленькой комнатке, которую выделил колхоз. За 5 лет упорного труда, семья собрала деньги на покупку дома и приобрела маленькую времянку. Джумакан с мужем воспитали двух замечательных детей, женили их и стали бабушкой и дедушкой. В поисках средств к существованию, дети Джумакан уехали в Россюи на заработки, оставив им на воспитание трех внуков -  полутора, двух и трех лет.
Сегодня, для того, чтобы прокормить свою семью, Джумакан сдает молоко от двух дойных коров и получает около 3,000 сом (KGS) ежемесячно плюс ее пенсия в 2,500 сом позволяет покрывать ежедневные расходы на детей. Также, Джумакан откармливает двух бычков и планирует закупить дополнительно скот для откорма и перепродажи, так как это достаточно прибыльно. Именно для этой цели, Джумакан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме  130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Доходы она планирует вложить дальнейшее приумножение поголовья скота,  а в будущем – мечтает развить свою ферму.
texts.en:
Djumakan born in the village Partsyezd (in the Panfilov district, Chui region of the Kyrgyz Republic). Djumakan grew up in a big family with three brothers and two sisters. Her parents were ordinary workers. After graduating from high school, Djumakan helped the family on the farm and since childhood she has had tremendous experience working with domestic livestock and crops. The family's main source of income was growing beets, and there was no question of her having access to higher education. She married a fellow villager, and the young family began working in the fields, planting beets. 

Living in her home village became harder and harder.  There was no work--all of them men could only work farming poultry and sugar beets, and by the time Djumakan started raising children there was not enough land for all of the families in the village.  One day, she and her husband asked Djumakan's parents for one of their three milk cows. That became the beginning of the family's livestock business. 

Since they had a cow, the family began to receive milk.  Djumakan's husband got a job as a shepherd.  The young family with two young children lived in a small room, which had been allocated to them by the collective farm. For five years, they worked hard and saved money to buy a house with a small outhouse. Djumakan and her husband raised two wonderful children, married them off, and become grandparents. 

Djumakan's children left to work in Russia and left her to raise her three grandchildren, aged one and a half, two, and three years old. Today, in order to feed their family, Djumakan keeps two dairy cows and receives about 3,000 som a month from the milk, plus her monthly pension of 2,500 som. This pays for the children's expenses. Also, Djumakan is fattening two steers and plans to purchase additional cattle for fattening and resale, since it is profitable. To do this, she contacted Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 130,000 som (KGS) to buy calves. She is planning to invest her profit into more livestock and she dreams of further expanding her farm.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is 54 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Adelina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Adelina has been raising pigs for 16 years and also earns additional income from tricycle transport.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité La Esperanza es la ciudad de Lambaré, está constituido por 17 mujeres, quienes se unieron la esperanza de ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo en conjunto. Ellas están con muchas ganas de progresar y salir adelante, tiene fe de que el programa de la fundación les ayudará mucho, es por ello que se esfuerzan al máximo.
Una de las miembros es la señora Claudia, quien nos cuenta que tiene una despensa bien surtida, la cual tiene hace un buen tiempo. Gracias a su negocio y a su empeño ella puede ayudar a su familia y de esa forma darles todo lo que necesitan para poder salir adelante. Uno de sus sueños es poder seguir creciendo y ser una gran comerciante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de artículos de primera necesidad como ser, panificados, carnes, lácteos, aceites, embutidos, fideos entre otros, con las cuales podrá abastecerse y ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Esperanza” committee is from the city of Lambaré; it’s composed of 17 women who joined together to help their families through their joint work.  They very much want to get ahead and to make progress.  They have faith that the Fundación’s program will help them a lot and this is why they make the maximum effort.

One of the women is Claudia who tells us that she has a very well-stocked store that she’s had for a good length of time.  Thanks to her store and her efforts she’s able to help her family and give them everything they need to get ahead.  One of her dreams is to be able to continue to grow and be a great merchant.

She asks for the loan to buy basic staple items like baked goods, meat, dairy products, oil, canned goods and noodles, among others, to stock up and offer a wider variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Yun (pictured here) and her husband, Chhoeun, have been married since 1989 and have two sons and two daughters. The family lives across the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Yun is a rice farmer, while her husband is a fisherman. Yun sells fish caught by her husband. In addition, when is not in fishing season, Chhoeun is also a chef. He cooks for wedding, ceremonies and other occasions.

Yun is requesting a loan of $1,100 to buy a motorcycle for commuting.      

Photo: Yun is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Raykhona

texts.en:
Raykhona N. is married and has a son. She supports her elderly father who lives in Russia. Raykhona has basic high school education. She deals in selling new clothes and footwear for women. The income from her business meets her family’s needs. Raykhona has a flamboyant personality. She is very active and optimistic. Her cheerful nature and willingness to help make her clients feel special and they come back over and over again. Her big assortment of clothing and footwear is another big benefit. Raykhona has a perfect credit history. She has not had a single late payment ever since she started working with Nadiya Ukraine. Raykhona is a trustworthy woman who needs to have some financial back-up. With a loan of $700, she plans to increase her assortment of stock which will give her customers a larger variety of goods to choose from and will help her meet their needs.

Надтока Райхона Рауповна одружена, має сина. Вона фінансово підтримує свого батька похилого віку, який живе в Росії. Отримала середню освіту. Працює на ринку, продає одяг та взуття для жінок. Прибуток, який вона отримує, допомагає їй забезпечити потреби своєї родини. Райхона Рауповна – дуже жвава особистість. Вона активна й оптимістична. Її привітна посмішка та бажання дати покупниці можливість відчути себе особливою допомагають їй зберегти постійну клієнтуру та попит на свої товари. До того ж великий асортимент одягу та взуття надають їй велику перевагу. Райхона Рауповна має прекрасну кредитну історію. За час роботи з „Надією України” в неї не було жодного прострочення. Райхона Рауповна – людина, якій можна довіряти. Вона потребує фінансової підтримки. Позика в $700 допоможе їй збільшити асортимент товарів та забезпечити потреби клієнтів.

loans.use: To increase assortment of stock

loans.name: Vana

texts.en: Vana is a mother of six children, born on December 11, 1949. She is a widow and is running her business to support the family. She started her business in 1980 with US$50 by selling 5 crates of soft drinks. After she lost her husband, she decided to open a restaurant in order to support her family. Vana excels in this business and has managed to gain a large clientele. They like her dishes and the service she provides. With a loan of US$500 Vana intends to purchase a large stock of rice, corn, manioc and chickens, the basic goods used in the preparation of her dishes that are enjoyed by her clients.  Vana’s long term plan is to purchase a plot of land where she can build a new restaurant.

loans.use: To increase the stock of food products and to ensure good service in her restaurant clients

loans.name: Vergara

texts.en:
Señor D. has a workshop for painting and repairing vehicles on a hired site opposite a bus station. He began his business when he branched out independently from the person who taught him his trade: with savings of $500 dollars he acquired his own machinery.

At first, he began repairing cars and carrying out locksmith work like doors and windows. Now he only specialises in the repair and painting of vehicles. With this loan, D. hopes to buy a welding machine that he needs in order to repair cars promptly and provide a better service for his customers.

D. is convinced that the purchase of this machine will increase the numbers of customers and with this extra income he will be able to construct a better house for his family and provide the economic stability that he has been looking for for so long.

D. is 47 years old and has a son who is studying. He is sure that his business will grow and improve his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. D. tiene un taller de pintada y enderezada de vehículos en un local que alquila frente a una estación de buses .el empezó su negocio cuando se independizo de la persona que le enseño el oficio con un ahorro de $500 dólares teniendo el su propia maquinaria.

Al principio empezó reparando carros y haciendo trabajos de cerrajerías como puertas y ventanas .Ahora solo se dedica a la enderezada y pintada de vehículos. Con este crédito D. aspira comprar una maquina autógena que necesita para reparar con prontitud y darle una mejor atención a sus clientes.

D. esta convencido que la compra de esta maquina aumentara la cantidad de clientes y con ese ingreso podrá construir una casa mejor para su familia y así dar estabilidad económica que ha buscado por tanto tiempo.

D. tiene 47 años, un hijo que estudia .el esta seguro que su negocio crecerá y mejorara su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Buy machinery for his workshop

loans.name: Kubra

texts.en: Kubra E., her employee is pictured, owns a car wash in the town of Khachmaz which is located on the North Eastern coast of Azerbaijan. Kubra is looking for funding so that she can invest in a new power sprayer for her business. This is Kubra’s third loan cycle with Norwegian Microcredit which means that she has proven herself to be a trust worthy customer.

loans.use: To purchase a new power sprayer for her car wash

loans.name: Sri Rahayu

texts.id:
Sri Rahayu is a hard-working lady. As a traveling saleswoman, she starts selling from 10am until 2am the next day. Besides renting a kiosk, she also sells the merchandises using a basket in the buses that just arrive in the harbor to wait for their turn to get on the ships. With Rp. 500,000 (about $54.5) capital, Sri Rahayu can buy several merchandise items including snacks and soft drinks. She can get Rp. 30,000 (about $3) profit per night. This profit has to be spent for capital and paying the kiosk rent fee so she often runs out of fund to buy merchandise. After getting the loan from Dinari, she can add more merchandise so that she won’t run out of merchandise. By increasing the capital, she can increase the profit to Rp. 50,000 (about $5.45) per night.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Sri Rahayu, seorang wanita yang sangat ulet dalam melakukan pekerjaannya. Sebagai Dagang Asongan, Sri Rahayu sudah memulai usahanya dari pukul 10.00 sampai pukul 02.00 dini hari. Selain menyewa sebuah tempat untuk berjualan, Sri Rahayu juga menjajakan dagangannya dengan cara membawa sebuah keranjang dan masuk ke dalam bus – bus yang baru masuk ke dalam pelabuhan untuk menunggu giliran naik ke kpal laut. Dengan modal sebesar Rp. 500.000.- , Sri rahayu bisa membeli beberapa jenis dagangan berupa makanan dan minuman ringan. Dalam semalam Sri Rahayu bisa mendapat keuntungan Rp. 30.000.- Keuntungan itu harus juga dibagi untuk modal dan membayar sewa tempat, sehingga Sri Rahayu sering kekurangan modal untuk membeli dagangan lagi. Setelah mendapat pinjaman dari Dinari, Sri Rahayu mampu menambah jenis barang dagangannya sehingga tidak pernah kekurangan stok. Dengan bertambahnya modal, Sri Rahayu mampu meningkatkan keuntungannya menjadi Rp. 50.000.-

loans.use: To add merchandise such as various snacks and soft drinks

loans.name: Vina

texts.en:
Mrs. N. Vina is single and currently living with her old father in Puk Rosey village. She learned to weave silk from her elder sister in 2001 and started her silk production in the same year. Before that time, she had learned to sew and also has the ability to make clothes. Her father is a farmer, and he grows rice and other food crops.
