She has borrowed money from MAXIMA twice already. Now, she is asking for a loan of $500. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the looms for her silk production.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the looms.

loans.name: Esther Gladys

texts.es:
Esther is 49 years old and is a fish biologist, but she doesn’t work in her field because she earns more with her own business. She lives in Laredo District in Trujillo Province in La Libertad Department.

Esther began by selling beauty products and later expanded into shoes, which she sells in the city of Chimbote, where she worked for a while. Her business has grown and she now also buys raw cow hides, which she salts and later processes for making into jackets and shoes. She also sends out the remnants to be made into jackets and wallets, which she sells to acquaintances.

She is a member of the communal bank “Laredo”, from which she obtained her first loan of S/.300.00 (approximately $100.00). She used this money to buy enough beauty products that she could have a good stock available and also sell them on credit. With the recent loan of S/. 1,200.00 (approximately $402) she has received from Manuela Ramos, which will be paid in 6 months, she will buy a new line of beauty products and also buy more hides, which are scarce at the moment and therefore more expensive.

Esther dreams of building a comfortable home and of seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Esther tiene 49 años de edad, es Bióloga Pesquera pero no ejerce su profesión porque considera que con su negocio le va mejor. Tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar que dependen de ella. Vive en el Distrito de Laredo de la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad. La señora Esther se inició vendiendo productos de belleza y luego amplió su negocio a venta de calzado, el mismo que lleva a vender a la ciudad de Chimbote donde trabajó por un tiempo. Actualmente su negocio ha crecido un poco más y se dedica también a comprar “cuero en pelo” para salar y luego procesarlo para la confección de casacas y calzado; paralelamente, también envía a confeccionar casacas y monederos pequeños de los retazos, los cuales vende a personas conocidas. Es socia del Banco Comunal “Laredo” en el que obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300 (aproximadamente $100), con este dinero compró productos de belleza para tener stock y poder vender al crédito. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.1,200 (aproximadamente $402), el cual será pagado en seis meses, comprará productos de belleza de una nueva línea y además comprará cuero en pelo que actualmente está un poco escaso y por lo tanto más caro. La señora Esther sueña con construir su casa con todas las comodidades y con ver a sus hijos profesionales.

loans.use: To buy beauty products. To buy cow hides.

loans.name: Khadeeja's Group

texts.en: I am Khadeeja M.. I am married and a mother of four: two girls and two boys. We live in a small house in Chichwatni, a small town in Pakistan. All of my kids are currently completing their studies. My husband operates a grocery store to make a living. At present, we need a loan for our grocery store, to buy a stock for it. I stitch clothes at my house to supplement my husband’s income and ensure that my kids keep attending school.  There are five women in my loan group and they are also request loans: Ramzana B. requests a loan for their motorcycle rental store. Razia B. requests a loan for their medical pharmacy. Shamshad B. and Shugufta B. want to expand their businesses with the loans. Salma B. requests a loan for their oils store.

loans.use: To buy inventory for the grocery store

loans.name: Mohammad Aziz

texts.en:
Mohammad Aziz lives with his nuclear family in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has a shop where he sells bottled gas. He has been involved in this business for more than two years. During these two years, his business has been growing slowly.

Now he wants to expand his business even more by taking an individual loan to complete his stock and attract more clients so that he can make a good income. He is happy with the process of small loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying bicycles that can be salvaged

loans.name: Fusi Safotulafai Centre - Group 1

texts.en:
For these 7 women of Fusi Safotulafai mupapa on the island of Savaii, these are their first loans from SPBD. They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business, maintaining a savings account and then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and to guarantee on-time payments.

The women will use their loans for the following purposes:

See K. (49, married, 3 children) will purchase fertilizer, pesticides, a weed killer, a bush knife, and a knife filing for her taro business.

Palota F. (41, married, 3 children) will purchase a weed killer, pesticides, a bush knife, a knife filing, a spade, and an axe for her taro business.

Pelo P. (53, divorced, 3 children) will purchase flour, sugar, oil, yeast, a deep fryer, and gas to cook pancakes for sale.

Silivia K. (49, married, 4 children) will purchase a fishing net, a torch, goggles, a spear, and bait for her fishing business.

Pipiana P. (32, married, 1 child) will purchase a weed killer, pesticides, fertilizer, a filing, and a bush knife for her taro business.

Faasu F. (20, married, 1 child) will purchase a weed killer, fertilizer, pesticides, a bush knife, a filing, and an axe.

Irene I. (30, married, 2 children) will purchase a weed killer, fertilizer, pesticides, a bush knife and a filing.

loans.use: Purchase a weed killer, pesticides, fertilizer, a filing, etc

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.es:
Aquilina and her husband work together in a small locksmiths that they both look after. Aquilina is in charge of the work contacts and her husband concentrates on doing the jobs. They made a firm decision to start this business and they set out with the necessary equipment and the right knowledge, and this has been a great help when making metal files, tables, bars etc. Their desire is to keep going in this vein and to improve their production, consolidating their metalic carpentry and their production of all types of furniture. They are happy because they have been doing this noble labour for 10 years and they want to improve their business.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Aquilina y su esposo trabajan juntos en un pequeño taller de cerrajería que ellos mismos administran, Aquilina se encarga de hacer los contactos de trabajo y su esposo de concretar esos trabajos, su decisión fue firme cuando empezaron a implementar su taller con los equipos necesarios, los conocimientos adquiridos por su esposo hoy son una gran herramienta que aporta a la elaboración de estructuras de metal como carpetas, mesas, mostradores, etc. El deseo de ambos es seguir incursionando en este rubro y mejorar la producción consolidándose como carpinteros metálicos y produciendo todo tipo de muebles, se sienten satisfechos porque esta noble labor está cumpliendo 10 años y quieren mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: An injection of capital to improve their workspace/Inyección de capital para mejorar su espacio de trabajo.

loans.name: Los Angel 2022-11 Group

texts.en:
Joice J., the group leader, has a business selling tea at a restaurant and has applied for this loan in order to expand her business. Joice is 40 years old and is a widow. She has 3 children between the ages of 10 and 27; the children of school age go to school. Each week, Joice makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profits.

Joice is joined in her small group by Joise Y., Cilian P., Yunise E., and Perina Lombero. Joise Y. has a business selling rice and fried eggs at a hotel and wants to expand her business. Cilian P. is currently operating a business selling charcoal at home and has applied for this loan in order to build a house for rent. Yunise E. operates a business selling beans, onions and tomatoes at the market and wants to expand her business. Perina Lombero has a business sewing clothes and would use her loan to purchase more sewing machines.

loans.use: To expand a business

loans.name: Tam Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tam is a 40 year old woman. At the moment, she is a construction worker. In 1997, she became TYM member, borrowing money to invest in a family-based live-stock farm. After 10 year working on the project, she is now experienced; the live-stock farm has been expanding and becoming efficient. Before her participation in the TYM program, the family's financial situation was harsh because they did not have money to invest and the main income was from farming only. Now, the situation has improved; her children have grown up. They built a new house and bought more necessary facilities. They plan to expand the size of the farm; therefore, they want to borrow 6,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to buy 3 more breeding pigs and more food for the animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Tâm năm nay 40 tuổi. Chị hiện làm nghề thợ xây tại địa phương. Năm 1997 chị đã bàn với chồng tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi tại gia đình, đến nay qua 10 năm thực hiện dự án chăn nuôi chị đã có rất nhiều kinh nghiệm vì thế công việc chăn nuôi của gia đình chị ngày càng được mở rộng và có hiệu quả. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương kinh tế gia đình chị gặp nhiều khó khăn do thiếu vốn làm ăn và thu nhập chỉ dựa vào nông nghiệp. Đến nay kinh tế gia đình chị đã ngày càng ổn định hơn các con của chị đều đã trưởng thành, gia đình chị đã xây được nhà khang trang và mua sắm thêm được các đồ dùng trong gia đình. Hiện nay gia đình chị đang có kế hoạch mở rộng quy mô chăn nuôi vì thế chị mong muốn được vay thêm 6.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm 3 con lợn giốn và mua thức ăn phục vụ cho việc chăn nuôi.

loans.use: invest in live-stock farm

loans.name: Kayi Afi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Kayi Afi D. was born on November 14, 1975 in Lomé. Married and the mother of two children, she works in selling cosmetic products in Lomé. She began this activity in 1999 and is the first to open this type of store in her neighborhood. She welcomes many clients throughout the day and generates large revenues. She has previously benefited from one loan through WAGES and promptly reimbursed it. This second loan that she is requesting will allow her to go to Accra, Ghana’s capital, in order to purchase cosmetic products such as 5 boxes of lotion and 3 boxes of perfume.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer.

Dame D. Kayi Afi est née le 14 novembre 1975 à Lomé. Mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants, elle exerce le commerce de produits cosmétiques à Lomé. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 1999 et est la première à ouvrir ce genre de magasin dans son quartier. Elle accueille beaucoup de clients à longueur de journée et réalise de gros chiffre d’affaires. Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit auprès de WAGES et a fait un prompt remboursement. Ce second crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’aller à Accra la capitale de Ghana pour faire l’approvisionnement des produits cosmétiques tels que 5 cartons de lait et 3 cartons de parfum.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetic products

loans.name: Faiel

texts.en:
Faiel is married with 5 children. He is 36 years old. He is an educated man. He has a clothes shop and he has been involved in this business for more than 7 years. One of his brothers helps Faiel. His brother is also married. They work together, and he has always tried to enlarge his business because this business is supporting 2 families.

When he found AFSG in Kabul, he requested an individual loan of US$1075 to import more clothes. He wants to enlarge his shop to improve his business and make a good monthly income for these 2 families.

He is happy with this loan process. He wants to thank both Kiva and AFSG for making this process in this country. He wishes to become successful and open another shop after one year for his brother. He is happy, and he would like to thank Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To import more clothes and enlarge his shop

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Socorro

texts.es: Guadalupe V. tiene 48 años de edad, habitan en el barrio Laureles Sur de la ciudad de Managua. Es soltera y tiene 4 hijos que aún dependen de ella. Ha tenido que luchar mucho en la vida para sacar adelante a sus hijos, ya que no ha tenido el apoyo del papá de sus hijos. Guadalupe es comerciante se dedica a la venta de medicamentos y también de cosméticos. Ella compra el producto en Managua y después viaja fuera de la ciudad para distribuir los medicamentos y cosméticos. Requiere del préstamo para la compra de medicamentos ya que hará un viaje a Bluefields y pretende invertir más para así poder generar más ganancias y captar mayor número de clientes.
texts.en:
Guadalupe V. is 48 years old and lives in the southern borough of Laureles Sur in the city of Managua. She's single and has 4 children that still depend on her. She's had to fight against a lot to raise her kids, as she hasn't had any support from their father. Guadalupe is a business woman who sells pharmaceuticals and cosmetics. She buys product in Managua and travels outside the city to distribute the pharmaceuticals and cosmetics. She is applying for the loan to buy pharmaceuticals as she's planning a trip to Bluefields and will also invest the rest to be able to generate more income and attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase pharmaceutical inventory

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El señor Daniel Martínez Noguera es de Barrio San Pedro a 12 Km. de la ciudad de Guayaybi, tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero y vive con sus padres.

Tiene su propio negocio de venta de repuestos, con clientela formada, lo que le genera buenos ingresos mensuales.

También tiene un taller de moto en su casa particular, con muchos clientes satisfechos por sus buenos servicios.

Le gustaría ampliar más adelante su local para poder trabajar y atender mejor a sus clientes. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos varios para vehículos.
texts.en:
Mr. Daniel Martinez Noguera is from the San Pedro neighborhood 12km form the city of Guayaybi, is 25 years old, is single and lives with his parents.

He has his own business selling parts, with an established clientele, which brings him a good monthly income.

He also has a small motorcycle workshop in his house, with many satisfied customers from his good services.

He would like to further grown his location to be able to work and better attend to his customers. The loan is to invest in buying spare parts for vehicles.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying parts for cars and motorcycles

loans.name: Yovana

texts.en:
Yovana is a member of the Florecer (“to bloom”) Village Bank. Yovana is 30 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their daughter. Yovana has a store in her parents’ house where she and her husband sell dry goods, ice cream, and phone cards. Yovana needs a loan of 600 soles to buy fruitcake (for Christmas) and rice. Yovana dreams of having her own home, and that her daughter will go to school and graduate with a professional degree.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow

Yovana es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer. Yovana es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 1 hija, Yovana tiene una tienda en la casa de sus padres, en donde vende abarrotes, helados, tarjetas telefónicas, tarjetas telefónicas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo. Yovana necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de panetones, arroz. Yovana sueña con tener su casa propia, que su hija estudie y sea profesional.

loans.use: Buy fruitcake (for Christmas) and rice

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: La Sra. Juana tiene 51 años de edad, habita en un barrio  Los Gómez de la capital de Managua, estado civil casado, tiene un hijo de 22 años de edad lo tiene estudiando. Los planes para el futuro de su familia es asegurarle un mejor provenir. Doña Juana posee su pequeño negocio de Alquiler de sillas, mesas y arreglos de mesas. Lo creo desde hace dos años de experiencia en la atención al cliente, lo inicio con bienes propios, sus objetivos en el  ámbito económico es aumentar  su inventario y así ofrecer a otros canales del mercado de servicio. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra comprar mayores cantidades de mesas, sillas, manteles, bufetes y aros para brindarle a cliente un servicio completo en la atención de sus celebraciones.
texts.en:
Señora Juana, 51, lives in the Los Gómez neighborhood of the capital of Managua. She is in a civil marriage and has one son of 22 who is in school. The future plans of her family are to ensure a better future. Doña Juana has a small business renting chairs, tables, and table arrangements. With two years' experience in client service, she started it with her own funds. Her goal in this economic climate is to increase her inventory and thus provide additional ways of marketing her service. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic, she will be able to buy larger quantities of tables, chairs, tablecloths, trays and napkin rings, so she can provide a complete client service of party provisioning.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tables and chairs

loans.name: Mrs. Sovanna Nuon Village Bank Group

texts.en: Ten people who all live in the Chumrov Village in the Takeo Province comprise this village bank loan and Mrs. Sovanna N. is the village bank president. She is a fruit seller and silk weaver. Since these two businesses are going well, she wants to expand them; so she decided to ask for a loan to buy different kinds of fruits to resell and she would use the rest of the loan to buy silk to weave for her customers. Her husband, Mr. Soeng Vutha, is a security guard who makes an insufficient salary to support the family. Mrs. Sovanna N. is 53 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of fruits to resell and to buy silk to weave

loans.name: Bachar

texts.en:
Bachar, 33, lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Bachar has been a taxi driver for eight years. He is requesting a loan of $1000 USD from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his car. This is the first time that Bachar has requested a loan.
His clients can be anybody. He decided to become a taxi driver because he wanted to work independently.

loans.use: To do maintenance work on his car

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 29 years old and married without a child. She is a hair stylist and she also sells hair cream and hair extensions. She needs a loan of N70,000 to purchase more hair cream and hair extensions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more hair cream and hair extension to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther sells cooked foods in a high school in Lagos state, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. Esther is 43 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a teacher. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Altantuya

texts.en:
Altantuya G. is 23 and married. She lives in a "ger" (a nomadic Mongolian tent) district in Arhanghay, one of the Mongolian central provinces. 

Together with her husband, Hangarid, she has been running an office supply and service center.  Some of the services she offers are taking photos, scanning, printing and copying documents. 

Both Altantuya and Hangarid graduated from the Mongolian University of Science and Technology with degrees in computer science. Altantuya had only one desktop computer when she started her business. With the profit, she has bought more equipment, such as a printing machine, scanner, copy machine and two computers. 

She requests a loan to buy more office supplies to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: To buy more office supplies

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 42-year-old man who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Imad has owned a sweets shop since 1990. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase raw materials and merchandise for his shop. This is his fourth loan cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loan helped him improve his shop. His clients can be anybody from his region, as well as tourists. When he first started, he didn’t face any difficulty. Imad decided on doing his work because he wants to improve his family’s income. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by opening another sweets shop.

loans.use: purchase raw materials and merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Yanacocha Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios del banco comunal  “YANACOCHA”, son vecinos D. la zona D. surquillos, situado en el distrito D. Calca en la provincia del Cusco, ubicado a 1:30 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco.

Los socios se dedican a diferentes actividades, teniendo como principal actividad la agricultura y  ganadería, en las épocas D. siembra, en resto del año ellos alternan sus actividades agrícolas con los diferentes negocios, que son, la crianza D. aves D. corral,  la compra y venta D. semillas, D. verduras, D. frutas, D. tiendas D. abarrotes, negocio D. mecánica y reparación. Los socios solicitan el préstamo para poder incrementar más sus productos y así tener mayor productividad.

Ellos se encuentran sumamente agradecidos con el apoyo otorgado mediante este medio y ratifican su deseo D. trabajo duro para poder cumplir sus metas y también se comprometen al pago total D. su préstamo en el tiempo programado.
texts.en:
Our members of the “Yanacocha” communal bank are neighbors of the Surquillos zone, situated in the district of Calca, in the province of Cusco, located 1 hour and 30 minutes away from the city of Cusco. The members carry out different activities, with agriculture and cattle being their main activities during the planting seasons; during the rest of the year they alternate their agricultural activities with different businesses, which are: raising poultry, purchasing and selling seed, vegetables, and fruit, grocery stores, and mechanic and repair shops. The members are questing a loan to increase their products, which will increase their productivity. They are extremely thankful for the support that they have obtained and reaffirm their wish to work hard to be able to achieve their goals; they also commit to making their loan payments in full in the time granted.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products and expand their businesses and crops.

loans.name: Rudilyn

texts.en:
Rudilyn S. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 42 years old. Rudilyn is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Rudilyn owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. She sells grilled pork and poultry products in the local community.  Rudilyn has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Rudilyn joined PMPC. Rudilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. Rudilyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP. These funds will be used to purchase more raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Rudilyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for food business.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence T. is not married but a mother of one child, a boy who is currently in the primary school. She is 27 years old. She lives with her son in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. She is a fishmonger. She sells smoked fish. She sells the fish on a tabletop at the market square. She also supplies to retailers and food vendors in her community. Florence buys cartons of fresh fish from big cold stores in Kumasi and smokes the fish herself. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy fish in bulk. She desires to expand her business and give her child the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Mrs. Koem Phe Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank, located in Sdau Kanlaeng in Kandal, plans to use the loan they obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Koem P. is the village bank president who has been selected by the bank's 12 members. She is a housewife who is a good cook for her family. Her husband, Mr. Chey Mun, is a construction worker. Mrs. Koem P. is requesting a loan to have a ceremony when her child enters a monastery. She is 51 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while two others are construction workers. The remaining one attends the local school.

loans.use: To have a ceremony when her child enters a monastery.

loans.name: Ushirikiano Group

texts.en:
Anna is a member of the Ushirikiano borrower group in Kola, Morogoro. She is a 20-year-old woman, is single, and is the mother of one child aged 4 years.

A year ago, Anna started her own clothing business selling clothes. She works twelve hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 100,000 Tanzania Shillings.

This is Anna’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Anna hopes to save money and expand her business. 

Maria, the other member of the Ushirikiano borrower group, has requested 150,000 Tsh in order to support her own clothing business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Tô's Group

texts.en:
G. Tô Thị (20213010010) is a 29 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  G. is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is An Ninh 03 (3).


G. is married and has 1 school-aged child.  To making a living, G. works in someone else's business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general services to local community members.  G. has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, G. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  G. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2.006.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 4.256.000 VND which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business.  The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  G. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20213010007) is a 24 year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a butcher shop.


2.  Nguyễn Thị Thư (20213010009) is a 28 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


3.  Trương Thị T. (20213010006) is a 25 year-old female who is requesting a 5.600.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a butcher shop.


4.  Tô Thị X. (20213010059) is a 44 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


G. Tô Thị (20213010010) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở T. phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  G. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các T. viên.  Mặc dù mỗi T. viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các T. viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là An Ninh 03 (3).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ nói chung cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  G. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, G. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, G. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  G. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 2.006.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.256.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20213010007) là 24 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng T.t.


2.  Nguyễn Thị Thư (20213010009) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


3.  Trương Thị T. (20213010006) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.600.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng T.t.


4.  Tô Thị X. (20213010059) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase equipment to improve the business

loans.name: Armando Richard

texts.es: Armando Richard es una persona joven que  vive en la zona de Pampahasi. Se dedica a la confección de polleras (ropa típica de mujer), y comenzó con esta actividad hace quince años gracias a su madre que también hace polleras. Armando realiza contratos para comparsas y grupos de bailarines. Él es una persona muy responsable y dedicada con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Armando Richard is a young man who lives in the Pampahasi district. He manufactures traditional women’s skirts. His mother, who also produces these garments, taught him this skill when he was 15 years old. Armando receives contracts from musical groups and dance troupes. He is a very responsible person and dedicated to his work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric at wholesale

loans.name: Mallaya Group

texts.en:
Mallaya is a group of 5 borrowers led by Anthony F..  He is 30 years old and married with 2 children aged 5 and 2 years, who are in kindergarten and 1st grade. Anthony happens to be a 3rd grade dropout because he had to take care of his parents who were both old and illiterate, so he decided to stand and take care of them. He lives and sells in West Point, close to downtown Monrovia, Liberia.  It is known to be a very rough environment where every child seeks for themselves. 

Anthony’s business is selling house finishing materials like locks, nails, hinges, etc. He has been running this business for 3 years in order to take care of his children and his parents also.  Anthony started this business with LD $3,000 which he borrowed from his brother and was later paid.

He always talks to his customers in a good manner, gives them a better price in order to maintain them, and doesn't give credit to his customers because he believes giving credit drives customers away. These are his little secrets.

Anthony needs this loan to purchase more goods like locks, hinges, nails, etc. in order  to increase the business size.  In the future, Anthony wants to own a store in and around Monrovia.  Anthony dreams of establishing a business for his family that will help and take care of their needs. He also has a plan to build a house for him and his family to relocate from West Point.

loans.use: To purchase more goods like locks, hinges, nails, etc. to increase the business size.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: El señor Francisco Javier López R., tiene la edad de 36 años, habita en el barrio Juan Ramón Padilla, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su hermanas, las cuales le apoyan en el negocio cuando sale a las regiones a traer producto, don Francisco desde hace seis años se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, anteriormente trabajaba dándole mantenimientos a piscina, pero tuvo un accidente el cual  perdió la visión de un ojo izquierdo debido a un químico. Los planes hacia un futuro es poder comprar donde le alquila. Le agradece a la institución por el apoyo que le ha brindado durante nueve ciclos ya que cuando inicio solo ajusto para comprar frutas y con mucho esfuerzos pago en tiempo y formas sus prestamos y eso permitió que le  aumentaran los montos  de su financiamiento lo cual lo  convertirlo en un cliente A. con este préstamo comprara  frutas y verduras para cumplir con la demanda de su negocio.

loans.use: Comprar frutas y verduras

loans.name: Minsito

texts.fr: Minsito T., 58 ans, mariée et mère de 03 enfants est membre du Banc Villageois de "SAMBA 15ANS 2" depuis 3 ans.Elle développe une activité de vente de glace, de crème glacée et de tissu teinté. Avec les bénéfices qu'elle réalise elle participe activement à la nourriture de la famille.
texts.en:
Minsito T., aged 58, is married and the mother of three children.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de "SAMBA 15ANS 2" for three years.  She is developing a business selling ice, ice cream, and dyed cloth.  With her profits, she actively helps to feed the family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To further her business

loans.name: Juana Emilia

texts.en: Juana Emilia has a small store called a Pulpería here in Nicaragua. Six years ago, she established the store in the front room of her house because her husband was having difficulty finding a job. Through the assistance of Fundacíon León 2000, she has been able to build up her business and increase her household income. Juana Emilia has high hopes for her business. She dreams of having more products to offer to her clients as well as being able to better support her family. Juana Emilia has a strong credit history with Fundacíon León 2000 and is a very capable client and businesswoman.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jorenda

texts.en:
Jorenda C. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur. She is 39 years old. Jorenda is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Jorenda owns and operates a business serving a variety of different meals and soft drinks to customers in the local community. Jorenda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $152 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Jorenda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jorenda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase food and drinks for her restaurant. Jorenda is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Yngrid Vania

texts.es: La Sra. Yngrid Vania M. F. tiene 26 años de edad,  vive con su esposo y su menor hijo en casa propia de material noble ubicada en el Caserío de Sacta Distrito de Santiago. Perciben ingresos trabajando como obreros de campo en una empresa agroindustrial  con 3 años de experiencia. Solicita el préstamo para poder terminar de construir su vivienda que fue afectada por el terremoto del año 2007 pero gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación lograron construir parte de su vivienda y comprar sus bienes. Su sueño es lograr construir toda su vivienda con el fin de alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Ambos agradecen el apoyo que les podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yngrid Vania M. F. is 26 years old, lives with her husband and her young son in their own house made out of “material noble” (cement and brick) located in the Caserío de Sacta district of Santiago. They have been earning income working as rural laborers in an agro-industrial company for three years. She is seeking this loan to finish constructing her home which was damaged by the earthquake in 2007. Thanks to her effort and dedication, they were able to construct part of their home and buy some household goods. Her dream is to be able to construct the whole house with the goal of achieving a better quality of life. Both are thankful for the support that we have offer them through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: House improvements

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La Sra. Francisca A. esta casada con el Sr. Justo Pastor Montiel desde hace mas de cinco años, con quien tuvo dos hijos.
El Sr. Justo es empleado público mientras que la señora Francisca se dedica a la venta ambulante de ropas y joyas utilizando su vehículo como medio de transporte para realizar sus ventas. Con el crédito de la Fundación Paraguaya aumentó su inventario de mercaderías a fin de poder cubrir los pedidos de clientes que en su mayor parte son asalariados de entidades públicas como privadas.
texts.en:
Señora Francisca A. has been married to Justo Pastor Montiel for more than five months, they live with their two children. Señor Justo is a public employee and Francisca sells clothing and jewelry, using her vehicle to transport her goods and to make sales. With the loan that she receives from Fundación Paraguaya she increased her inventory of merchandise so that she can fulfill the requests of her clients, the majority of whom are employees of public and private organizations.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of jewelry, and general merchandise (shirts, skirts, lingerie)

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia F. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at her home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Lucia is 39 years old and is married to a policeman. She has eight children and they all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a big shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Lea Dagmar

texts.es: Lea Dagmar es casada, tiene 3 hijos, todos varones, los cuales estan estudiando, trabaja como sub-directora del Colegio Tierno Galván de la ciudad de Juigalpa, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo que asume los gastos del hogar.  La profesora Lea con los  créditos anteriores han podido salir adelante, mejorando poco a poco su vivienda que es una casa de proyecto y esta necesitando instalar todo el sistema electrico de la casa.  En su escuela es muy querida por sus compañeras de trabajo.
texts.en:
Lea Dagmar is married and has three children, all boys. They are students. Lea works as assistant principal at the Tierno Galván School in the town of Juigalpa. Her husband helps by paying for household expenses. Using previous loans Lea has been able to make her life better; she is gradually improving her house which is still a work in progress. She now needs to install a complete electrical system. Lea is much liked by her colleagues in the school.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to install an electrical system

loans.name: Believe In God Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the Believe In God Group. They are small-scale businesswomen in the township of Magburaka, in northern Sierra Leone. They have applied to SMT/Kiva Lenders for the first time for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each to enable them to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living.

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Memunatu I. K.. The 28-year-old Memunatu was born in Magburaka town. Memunatu is single. She has been a businesswoman for five years now. She sells clothes. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying bales of clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy bales of clothes

loans.name: Nancy Esther

texts.es:
Nancy Esther Sanjuán E. vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos   de 10 17 y 21 años de edad  en la Ciudadela Metropolitana,  barrio ubicado en Soledad –Atlántico.
Nancy quería sentirse independiente e inició su negocio aprovechando tanto el conocimiento de su esposo (a su lado) en la línea de soldadura, como su capacidad administrativa natural;  por eso respondió a su deseo de  capacitarse en emprendimiento y manejo administrativo de negocios y se preparó previamente  antes de la puesta en marcha del  “Taller de Herrería y ornamentación Stefany”   que hoy es la base del sustento familiar  y es el espacio en el que los esposos articulan sus capacidades y aptitudes en beneficio de su familia . Unidos han conseguido contratos con empresas, centros educativos y construcciones que son su principal mercado, sin dejar a un lado los negocios individuales que realizan con sus familiares vecinos y personas que conocen la calidad con que trabajan en su taller.
Aun recuerdan cuando iniciaron con una máquina de soldar haciendo cajas pequeñas y metálicas, para proteger los medidores de gas natural; durante un tiempo fue lo único que hacían en su taller, pero  gradualmente adicionaron otros productos como rejas, sillas, mesas, ventanas, puertas y antenas; este es su segundo crédito  con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, necesitan  $ 2.000.000 para comprar materiales como tubos, hierros, pintura, soldadura  y elaborar esqueletos de sillas giratorias y puertas solicitadas por una entidad educativa con la que regularmente negocian.  Su taller de herrería y ornamentación, les ha dado para comprar su casa y en un amplio cuarto adecuar  su taller, el cual quieren a corto plazo  mejor su infraestructura. La competencia es su gran desafío por eso constantemente escuchan la voz de su cliente y tratan de participar en actividades formativas de mejoramiento de la calidad a nivel administrativo y técnico.
texts.en:
Nancy Esther Sanjuán E. lives with her husband and three children who are 10, 17 and 21. They live in Ciudadela Metropolitana, a neighborhood located in Soledad –Atlántico. Nancy wanted to feel independent and she started her own business. She took advantage of her husband's knowledge (at her side) in welding and her natural managing ability. She responded to her wish to be trained in launching and managing businesses and she prepared beforehand before starting the “Taller de Herrería y Ornamentación Stefany”. Today it is the basis of the family income and the place where the couple express their skills and aptitudes to benefit their family. Together they have obtained contracts with businesses, educational centers, and contruction which is their main market. They haven't left the individual jobs behind that they do with family, neighbors, and people who know the quality of their work in their workshop. They still remember when they started with one welding machine making small metalic boxes to protect natural gas meters. For a time it was the only thing they made in their workshop. Gradually, they added other products such as bars, chairs, windows, doors and antennas. This is the second loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. They need $ 2.000.000 to purchase materials such as tubes, irons, paint, soldering, and to make skeletons of spinning chairs and doors ordered by an educational organization with which they regularly do business. Their blacksmith and ornamentation workshop has allowed them to purcahse their house and outfit their workshop in a spacious room which improved their infrastructure in a short time. Competence is a challenge and that is why they always listen to the client and they try to participate in training activities to improve the quality at a management and technical level.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials such as tubes, irons, paint, soldering, and to make skeletons of spinning chairs and metallic doors

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is 34 years old, married, and the father of two school-aged children. He has been running a restaurant for four years and he has six employees to assist him in the business. He also runs a construction company, a taxi business, and a cereals shop in rural areas. Before he ventured into these businesses, he was employed in a stationery supermarket.
Since Anthony joined Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, he has benefited by saving his money and taking out loans to grow his business. He hopes to open further branches and increase his investments in the future. He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to renovate his premises, add stock to his business, and buy a cooker to cook chips and mandazi (Kenyan doughnuts). He describes himself as ambitious, hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To renovate his restaurant, add stock and buy a cooker

loans.name: Reynaldo Del Carmen

texts.es:
El  Sr. A. trabaja en la Alcaldía de Puerto Morazán-Tonalá,  que está ubicada en el municipio del Viejo, departamento de Chinandega.

El va a utilizar el crédito para reparar el techo de su vivienda  ya que se aproxima el invierno y no quiere estar desprotegido contra el agua.

Este es el quinto  crédito que tiene con la Institución los cuales  siempre los han pagado bien  y dice estar muy agradecido  por ayudarla y brindarle apoyo cuando el lo  necesita.
texts.en:
Señor A. works in the municipality of Puerto Morazan-Tonala, which is located in the town of Viejo, Chinandega. He will use this loan to repair the roof of his home, since winter is coming and he does not want to be unprotected from the water. This is the 5th loan that he has taken from the institution. He has always made his payments well, and he says that he is very grateful for the help and support that has been provided when he needed it.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: home improvement

loans.name: Progressive Tb Group

texts.en:
Gifty A. is a women’s leader and a role model to most young women in her community. She is thirty-nine years old, married and the mother of six children from age 3-20 years who are pursuing their education at primary and high school levels. She lives together with her husband who is a food crop farmer and their children in a town close to Mampong.

Gifty is a petty trader who sells rice, tomatoes, vegetable oil, sugar, etc. to customers in her community. Operating her business for the past one and half years, Gifty has amassed good marketing experience and drawn many customers to her business.  

Gifty is currently the leader of a trust bank group called 'Progressive', made up of thirteen members. The other members are also engaged in businesses such as food selling, hair dressing, grocery sales, used clothes sales etc. They are the major breadwinners of their respective families and are requesting a loan to support their businesses with the hope of raising more income to support their families. Their common dream is to be financially self-sustaining and to be able to support their children through quality education.

loans.use: To purchase groceries like tomatoes, oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Sarann

texts.en: Mrs. Sarann K. is 40 years old and is a villager who lives in Preaek Samraong village in Kandal province. She is a grocery seller who earns a small income to support her family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. She decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to enlarge her business. Mrs. Sarann K. is a widow with three children: one is a car mechanic, one is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the last one is attending a local school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: Lachidatou

texts.fr:
En 2008 cette femme s’est lancée dans le commerce de céréales, elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays pour pouvoir réaliser de plus grand bénéfice sur ses ventes. Son stock de marchandises a connu une baisse, elle voudrait se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES son tout premier crédit pour l’achat de 14 sacs de maïs.
Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants.
texts.en:
In 2008, this woman began trading in grains. She gets her supplies in the interior of the country in order to make much more profits on her sales. Her stock of products is low. She would like to restock and is requesting from WAGES her first loan to buy 14 bags of corn. She is married and the mother of 4 children.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of  bags of corn

loans.name: Damaris Del Socorro

texts.es: Damaris Del Socorro tiene 44 años, tiene 3 hijos, como Madre responsable cuida de ellos. Su actividad es la venta refrescos y golosinas, además de tener este negocio se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para comprar materia prima necesaria para su actividad. Su deseo es mejorar su negocio así podrá obtener más ganancias para realizar mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Damaris Del Socorro, 44, has 3 children, and as a responsible mother she cares for them. She sells soft drinks and sweets, and also has a business selling cosmetics. She does all this because she is always seeking out ways to improve her family's living conditions. The loan that she is requesting will be used to buy raw materials for her business. She hopes to improve her business so that she can obtain higher earnings and make improvements to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Tripple Stars Development Group Of Ntungamo

texts.en:
M. Stephen, aged 38 years with a family of six children, has been operating a retail shop in Ntungamo town selling general merchandise for over three years. There, he trades in a variety of products common for domestic use like sugar, soap, salt, cooking oil and much more, earning him a profit of 600,000 Ugandan shillings.

Stephen’s main drawback is that he has a limited stock of products in his shop that cannot satisfy his customers’ demand. Therefore, he is looking forward to increasing the stock in his business when he gets this loan and also expanding into a wholesale shop. This will help him earn more revenue and sustain his daily life needs as he envisions improving his family’s standard of living and, further, buying a motorcycle to hire out.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for his store

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en:
Bayarmaa Z. is 40 years old and lives with her husband and six children in Tosontsengel,  one of the biggest towns of Zavhan province, western Mongolia. She and her family live together in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Since 2000, Bayarmaa has run a special order home furnishings carpentry business with her husband.  Their workplace is located within their fence, where they live and operate their business. 

During the daytime, her husband, Bayaraa, makes wooden products such as upper frames, wooden walls, doors, and chests of drawers which are the parts and furniture of a 'ger'- a traditional housing tent, and they sell them to herdsmen. The couple has gained much experience in how to make wooden items well, according to their customers' demand and choice. The business income covers their family's needs and consumption. 

Bayarmaa says, “My dream is to purchase a plot of land for my family from my business profits. I wish my children would acquire a profession and I would see their future brighter than today.” Bayarmaa is a hard-working, modest woman who is struggling in life and anxious about her future. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT in order to purchase raw materials and wood and timbers for her business.

loans.use: To purchase wood etc.

loans.name: Expédit Athanase

texts.fr: Né en 1977 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, D. Expédit Athanase est marié à SEWA Hermione, une ménagère. Le couple a quatre enfants à charge, dont trois représentent leurs enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Il y a environs sept ans que Expédit s'est installé à PK10 dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, où il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants. Expédit s'implique beaucoup plus dans les diverses charges de la famille, grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Expédit n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire, mais a appris la coiffure. Depuis cinq ans, Expédit mène cette activité qui lui permet de nourrir sa famille et d'assurer ses propres besoins. De façon secondaire, Expédit vend des cartes de recharges téléphoniques dans son atelier situé à PK10. C'est la première fois que Expédit sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit, en vue d'équiper son salon de coiffure de matériels de coiffure plus adaptés à son activité.
texts.en:
Born in 1977 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Mr. D. Expédit Athanase is married to Ms. SEWA Hermione, a housewife. The couple have four children, of whom three are their own. All of the children are in school. About seven years ago, Expédit settled in PK10, in the Commune of Sèmè-Podji, where she lives with his wife and children. He is involved a lot more in the various family expenses. Expédit attended primary school only, but he has learned how to cut hair. For five years, he has been running this business, which enables him to feed his family and to support himself. Secondarily, he sells phone recharge cards in his shop located in PK10. This is the first time that Expédit has requested a loan from ALIDé with the goal of supplying his shop with equipment better suited to his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying hair clippers and wheel chairs

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn C. is from the village of Dabong-dabong, Valencia City. She is 49 years-old and separated from her spouse.  She has seven adult children. To make a living, Marlyn owns and operates a business in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Marlyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Marlyn joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marlyn is requesting a first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Naziran Begum

texts.en:
Naziran begum is a wife of A. H. and resides in a city called Gujranwala, in Pakistan. Gujranwala city is near to Sialkot which is famous for their sweetmeats.  Naziran belongs to a family of talented people. They all are involved in the shoe making business. Her husband is a cobbler by profession and Naziran started helping him just after her marriage. 

She has three children: two sons and one daughter. Her sons couldn’t get an education because they wanted to support their parents in their business while Naziran and her husband wanted to give a good education to their daughter. By the grace of God, she is enrolled in a school and studying in 10th standard.  

Naziran and her family have been making shoes for many years. They obtain good orders from shoe factories as well as from shoe shops. They enjoy working & helping each other in their work. 

Naziran has applied for a loan from Asasah for her family business. With the loan amount they will buy raw materials such as leather, glue, nails, and shoe polishes in large quantity so they make the shoes in bulk and increase their sales volume. Naziran is hopeful that this investment will help them in increasing their profits and will improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: purchasing raw material for making shoes

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en: Jenifer A. is from the village of Soyung Echague. She is 33 years old and is single. Jenifer owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Jenifer joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is married with two daughters. She is an entrepreneur from the small town of Korolyovo, Western Ukraine. Nataliya sells bakery goods, pastries and candy in the central marketplace of her home town. Her vending kiosk is located right in the center of the market that is always busy with shoppers. Nataliya has been in this trade for 10 years. Currently, she has 50,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her gross income is about 18,000 Grivnyas. Profit amounts to 5,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Nataliya is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to diversify her merchandise. Nataliya’s business has been growing consistently due to her hard work and to having few competitors.  However, she doesn’t plan to stop developing her enterprise. Nataliya is hoping to continue investing her energy and finances in further expansion of her vending venture.

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette E. N. was born in1984, and is married to Muyamabat Adolf and they are blessed with three children and living in Nitop III, a quarter in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.

Odette has faced some challenges in life. The most difficult have been the problem of paying for her house rent and building a house of her own.  She plans to invest this loan in an off-license business where she will buy foodstuff which include cocoa yams, palm oil and other ingredients, in order to prepare Ekwang (it is an African dish prepared with cocoa yams). She believes the business will succeed because she has been in the business for a long time. She also thinks her approach to her customers will be captivating and hence lead to the success of her business The loan will help her community because they will be able to afford at least three meals per day at affordable prices.

Odette will plough back her profit into her business and use part to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to pay her house rent and save for rainy days. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs, flour, sugar, groundnut oil, beans and wood.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel T. is from the village of Paglaum Village, Lumbo, Valencia City. She is 31 years old. Maribel is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Maribel sells clothing and shoe products in the local community. Maribel has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Maribel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maribel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Maribel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma B. is from the village of Tambagan, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 48 years old. Elma is married and has four children. To make a living, Elma owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing pedicure & manicure services to local community members. Elma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. Elma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed for the services. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Elma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to continue services

loans.name: Jamebie

texts.en:
Jamebie A. is from the village of Poblacion, Dangcagan, Bukidnon. She is 28 years old. Jamebie is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jamebie owns and operates a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from serving and selling breads with coffee, chocolate drinks and teas in the local community. Jamebie has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jamebie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jamebie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jamebie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “EL AMANECER”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Jose Alberto; el tiene 56 años de edad y es casado y tiene 4 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de pensión familiar, el socio da a algunos estudiantes la pensión familiar como dándoles desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, el socio quiere mejorar el negocio. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar y también para pagar algunas deudas.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Jose Alberto belongs to the “El Amanecer” (The Dawn) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Jose Alberto is 56 years old.  He is married and has 4 children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his business which is a family guest house.  He provides some students with accommodation, breakfasts, lunches and dinners.  He would like to improve his business.  He is requesting this loan to buy products such as cooking supplies and also to pay off some debts.

He is grateful to those who will take part in his dream by funding his loan and pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy cooking supplies and also pay off some debts

loans.name: Neza

texts.en:
Neza P. is from the village of Bato. She is 56 years old. Neza is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $71 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Neza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Neza is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie V. is from the town of Talibon. She is 25 years old. Vergie is married and has two children, age 5 and 3. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She started her store three years ago.

Vergie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a  loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Los Repollitos Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Repollitos está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas Juana Gonzáles de 47 años se dedica a la venta de hot-dog, pasteles, repollitos desde hace 15 años ya que es un producto que se vende a diario. Ella vende de manera ambulante, cuenta con dos vendedores, además entrega estos productos en dos colegios el colegio Bello Horizonte y Colegio Japón, y en el Mercado Oriental. 

G. tiene siete hijos de los cuales tres son menores de edad ellos tienes 15, 12 y 7 años respectivamente. Ella invertirá el crédito en hot-dog, pasteles, repollitos y nacatamales cuales realiza los fines de semana desde diciembre.

Los otros integrantes del grupo son Rober José A. quien vende tajadas con queso desde hace 4 años y Jesenia del Carmen E. se dedica al comercio de queso.
texts.en:
The group, Los Repollitos, is made up of three working members.  One of them is Juana G. of 47 years old.  15 years ago, she began selling on a daily basis hot dogs, pastries, and puffs.  She owns a stall and has two vendors that work for her.  In addition, she sells her products to two schools, Bello Horizonte and Japan School, and also at the Oriental Market.

G. has seven children, three of whom are minors, a 15, 12, and 7 year-old.  She will invest this credit in hot dogs, pastries, puffs, and Nicaraguan-style tamales, which she has been making on the weekends since December.

The other members of the group are Roberto Jose A., who has been selling fried plantain slices with cheese for over four years, and Jesenia del Carmen E., who sells cheese.

loans.use: Make hot dogs, pastries, puffs, and Nicaraguan-style tamales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new machine to help her make boots

loans.name: Gemalyn

texts.en:
Gemalyn V. is from the village of Dalirig, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 44 years old. Gemalyn is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Gemalyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop.  She sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods,  snack foods and  toothpaste to the local community. Gemalyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Gemalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemalyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, such as beverages and rice. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Gemalyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her  business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman who lives in the municipality of Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a fish vending business. Her husband Roger, who is 42 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have five children who are 4 to 20 years old. Josephine joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Josephine has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 17,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,900, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000 to buy more fish to sell in the market so that she can continue to save up for her children's education & household improvements. Josephine is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Anastase

texts.en:
Anastase is 30 years old and is married, with one child who is 3 years old. For 3 years he has owned a small store which sells various goods, such as cosmetics, sugar, rice, etc. His business is open from 7am until 7pm every day except on Saturday, and he currently employs one person to help him.

Anastase has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase additional cosmetics, sugar and rice.  With profits, he expects to buy new goods like clothes and shoes for men. He hopes to be able to buy a plot to build a house.

loans.use: to buy various goods to sell, such as cosmetics, sugar, rice, etc.

loans.name: Bendiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Bendiya est composé de six femmes mariées majoritairement  dans des ménages polygames avec en moyenne 45 ans et 4 enfants par femme.
