Elles habitent le village Dougounikoro dans la commune rurale de Sanando, préfecture de Barouéli dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. Les membres du groupe font l’achat et la vente de céréales (mil), gousses d’arachide grillées, grillades de farine de blé, d’ustensiles de cuisine (tasses inox et seaux) et du bois de chauffe. 
Dans le besoin d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce afin de faire leurs achats au comptant, les membres du groupe ont rejoint  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 5ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Magnini  C. a une grande réputation auprès des filles fiancées dans, la vente des meilleures qualités de tasses inox dans le village. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter deux douzaines de tasses inox en gros au grand marché de Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et à crédit au village et en ambulant dans les villages voisins à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes. Madame Magnini  C. espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000FCFA qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Bendiya group is composed of six married women, living mainly in polygamous families. They are on the average 45 years old, with four children each. They live in the Dogounikoro village in the rural community of Sanando, Barouéli prefecture in the Ségou region (the fourth administrative region of Mali) and they know each other as neighbors and relatives by blood or marriage. The group members buy and resell millet, raw grilled peanuts, cakes from wheat flour, kitchen utensils (drinking cups of the Inox brand and buckets) and heating wood.

Needing to increase their working capital in order to be able to buy their stock for cash, the group members joined Soro Yiriwaso, and are now on their 5th solidarity loan cycle. 

Mrs. Magnini C. is well-known among the local women about to get married as the vendor of Inox cups of the highest quality in her village. She plans to use  her  loan to purchase two dozens of Inox cups wholesale at the big market of Ségou. She sells for cash and on crdit in the village and as a an ambulant vendor in the nearby villages, to a customer base usually composed of women. Mrs. Magning C. hopes to achieve a montly income of 25,000 West African francs, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase Inox drinking cups

loans.name: Reinerio

texts.es:
El Sr. Reinerio D. es cliente recurrente de Fundación Paraguaya, el mismo es soltero y vive en la ciudad de Luque.
El titular anteriormente era chofer de una parada de taxi ubicada en el centro de Luque, actualmente ha adquirido un nuevo auto para realizar trabajos en forma independiente y desea el préstamo de Kiva para el mantenimiento y reparación de su vehículo.
Reinero es una persona muy humilde y trabajadora, sabe y reconoce que el sacrificio dignifica al hombre, por eso no se lamenta por la pobreza y la dureza laboral de algunos días, sino que mira hacia el futuro con optimismo y perseverancia.
Si realiza dicha inversión el titular considera que le dará un mejor ingreso para su vida en particular y para la buena atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sr. Reinerio D. is a longstanding member of Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya. He is single and lives in the town of Luque. In the past he was a driver at a taxi stand located in the centre of Luque, but now he has his own car and works independently. Reinerio would like a loan from Kiva to maintain and repair his vehicle.

He is a simple, hardworking man who knows and understands that sacrifice gives a man self-respect. For this reason he doesn’t complain about his poverty and the daily grind; instead he looks to the future with optimism and perseverance.

If Reinerio obtains a loan, he will consider it an important addition to his life and to the good service he provides to his customers.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy bales of towels, children's clothing, jeans and used shirts.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 54 years old and married with 5 children.

Elizabeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

Elizabeth has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 15 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Elizabeth aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Zoya

texts.en: Zoya is from the village of Isahakyan in the Shirak region of Armenia. She really enjoys the nature of Isahakyan and the people in her village. Zoya has three children – a twenty-seven-year-old daughter and two sons (twenty-one and thirty). Her oldest son lives in Russia and she misses him dearly. Zoya and her husband have been working on the family farm for the past twenty years. They would like to expand their business. With a microfinance loan, she will purchase seeds, fertilizer, and fuel. This investment should increase the family income by twenty percent. The proceeds will be used to support their extended family and to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and fuel

loans.name: Faiane

texts.en:
Faiane is 58 years old and married with 10 children. Faiane owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has one year of experience in this business. 

Faiane needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets and knives.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand her business.

In 2011, Faiane joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Faiane's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets and knives

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: La Sra. Claudia  es  una persona  trabajadora y  muy responsable  la cual  se  dedica  a  la   venta  de  pasteles  y  repostería ,  de esta  manera  obtiene   sus  ingresos  para   sacar  adelante  a  su  familia, en esta  ocasión requiere de  nuestra  ayuda  para  realizar  la   compra de mercancía para su negocio  ya  que  diariamente  esta  elaborando  sus  productos para   tener  a la venta y  así  tener  la posibilidad  de  brindarles  a sus  clientes los  pasteles  y galletas que en el  momento   le solicitan.
texts.en:
Claudia is a hard-working and very responsible person who sells cakes and confectionery.  This is how she makes income in order to get her family ahead in life.

On this occasion, Claudia needs our help to buy merchandise for her business since she is currently making her products every day in order to have them available to sell.  In this way, she will be able to provide her customers with cakes and cookies when they ask for them.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Sarum

texts.en: Sarum, 38 years old, is a grocery seller. Her husband is a worker and their income is $6 per day. She has three children: one is studying and the other two are working in a factory. Every month, she has to spend $100 on food, $10 on school fees and $13 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy groceries to sell from home. Previously, she sold fruit in Phnom Penh City, but she wants to have a career at home to take care of her children. Therefore, she decided to take a loan to start this career and she expects to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has three children.
 
Eden has a shop that sells used clothing or "ukay-ukay." He has had this business for three years. 

He requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy used clothing.

Eden has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to resell.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito da Matola provincia de Maputo e  tem como nivel academico  Basico. Divorciada e mae de  uma filha ainda menor de idade, reside na Ponta dou ouro e trabalha numa instancia turistica onde recebe um salario no valor de 4.000,00mt que aplica nas  despesas da casa e poupa um pouco num Banco comercial.
Vem a conhecer a Hluvuku-Adsema apartir de conversas com seu ex-marido,  cunhados e colegas de trabalho, e decide aproximar para ter mais esclarecimentos sobre os procedimentos para ser cliente e beneficiar-se do financiamento para realizar seus projectos.
Vem a tornar-se cliente da Hluvuku ha mais de 6 meses. O seu primeiro emprestimo foi no valor de 8.000,00Mts para compra de chapas de zinco e pagamento de mao-de-obra.
 Com o  presente emprestimo de 15.000, pretende comprar material de construcao ( cimento, areia e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para construcao da sua casa propria e de materiasl convencional.
Tenciona ver sua casa concluida e sua pequena mercearia feita e para tal conta com a Hluvuku-Adsema para mais financiamento.
texts.en:
Cristina was born in the District of Matola in the province of Maputo and she has the basic level of education. Divorced and the mother of a daughter who is still underage, she lives in Ponta de Ouro and works in a tourist resort where she receives a salary of 4,000 meticals (MZN) which she uses on household expenses and to save some money in a commercial bank.
She came to know of Hluvuku-Adsema through conversations with her ex-husband, sisters-in-law and work colleagues. She decided to get closer in order to request clarification on the process for becoming a Hluvuku client and to benefit from financing to carry out her projects.
She became a Hluvuku client over 6 months ago. Her first loan was for the value of 8,000 MZN to purchase sheets of zinc and to pay for labour.
With the current loan of 15,000 MZN she intends to purchase construction materials (cement, sand and payment of workmanship) to build her own house from conventional materials.
She intends to see the build of her house and small grocery store completed and for this she will count on Hluvuku-Adsema for further loans.

loans.use: purchase construction materials (cement, sand and payment of workmanship)

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is 40 years old and lives in Sinkor. She is single and has four children between the ages of 12 and 22. All of them live at home with her and are currently in school. For the past one year and six months, she has been selling charcoal in the local market. The price of charcoal and the availability of it are very high during the rainy season. She is requesting a loan to purchase 150 bags of charcoal for her business. She plans to send her children to a quality school in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase 150 bags of charcoal for her business

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is 40 years old and lives in the town of Pachwach in the Luweero region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children. Two of his children are currently in school. Gilbert has a business of a small retail shop, which he has had for 7 years.         

To help expand his business, Gilbert has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like soap, salt for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Gilbert hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  

In the future, Gilbert hopes to expand his business. Gilbert is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like soap, salt for resale.

loans.name: Nji

texts.en:
She was born in December 1962. She is married and a mother of six, two of whom are below fifteen years old. She and her family live at mile 90 Nsongwa, a quarter in Bamenda, in the Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. Sickness and poverty are the major challenges she has faced in her life.

She joint GHAPE in 2006 and has received, and repaid, Empowerment Credit three times. She intends to invest this loan in her farm and retail business. She will use the loan to buy groundnut, maize seedlings, Rice Beans, firewood and farming tools as well as oil to sell to the final consumers. She believes this business will succeed because she is very hardworking and determined. This business will be of help to the community because it will increase the availability of foodstuffs in her area.

With the proceeds from this loan, she will educate her children, and increase the size of her farm and business. She prefers a GHAPE loan because the interest rates are very low. And the training GHAPE renders to their her clients as well as the social education.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies, pay labour and buy parts for her business.

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de San Jeronimo en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Zulma, la socia tiene 40 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; la socia se dedica  a la compra de productos de belleza por catalogo y a la venta de los mismos, la socia hace pedidos a sus representantes según el orden de pedidos de sus catálogos que le hacen sus amistades y clientes, la socia reparte sus catálogos a las diferentes instituciones y recoge en un par de días los clientes anotan con sus nombres lo que desean y ella les trae al cabo de 15 días, luego de esto, los clientes le pagan la mitad y la siguiente parte le dan a fines del mes, la socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de productos de belleza, ella en esta ocasión comprara productos de belleza en oferta y los pondrá  a la venta. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de belleza en oferta al por mayor para la venta.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “MUJERES UNIDAS”. This bank is located in the district of San Jeronimo in the province of Cusco in the department of Cusco.

The member is Senora Zulma. She is 40 years old. She has partner and 4 children. The member buys and sells beauty products by catalogue. The member places orders that she receives from her friends and clients on a first-order basis with her sales representatives. The member distributes her catalogues to various institutions and collects them after a couple of days with the names of the customers and their orders. She delivers the orders within 15 days of the orders being placed at which time the customers pay half the amount owed and the balance at month end. The member wants the loan to invest in the purchase of beauty products. On this occasion she will buy beauty products that are on offer and offer them for sale. The member is asking for the loan to invest in the purchase of beauty products on offer wholesale for resale. 

The member is grateful for the support given her and as such agrees to make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy beauty products on offer wholesale for later resale.

loans.name: Tuyana

texts.en:
Tuyana is single.  She runs a small enterprise selling women’s clothing, jewelry, scarves, socks, leggings, and similar products in the central market.  She has been in this trade for 17 years and has gained much experience that helps her to be successful in her business.

Tuyana is seeking a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to purchase fall and winter inventory.  She is hoping to use additional funding to grow and expand her trade and, as a result, her income.  Tuyana is an entrepreneur of integrity.  Her professional management skills and friendly customer service have ensured her business a stable standing in this niche market.

loans.use: to purchase fall and winter inventory for her clothing store.

loans.name: Nellie Group

texts.en:
Nellie is 43 years old and lives in Tugas, Baliangao. She is married and has two children. 

Nellie has a hog raising business and earns approximately 5600 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase feed for her hogs. 

Nellie has been a member of PMPC for two years. Nellie is the leader of a two person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase 8 sacks of feed for her hogs

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
This is Sarah, 27, resident of Dasmarinas Cavite, Philippines. Single, she manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Sarah operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, from these round palm sized ones, to the much larger doormats and other crafts. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Sarah's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 250 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Sarah is requesting Php12, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Sarah hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Carolina Yamileth

texts.es:
Carolina, tiene 26 años de edad, casada desde hace 6 años, tienen 2 hijos de 2 y 5 años de edad, su esposo es electricista y aporta con sus ingresos al hogar, vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula.
Ella tiene cinco años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa nueva y usada como camisas, pantalones, camisetas, sandalias, bolsos y otras cosas  y zapatos.  Anteriormente Carolina trabajaba en una bodega como dependienta pero ganaba muy poco, eso le motivo establecer su propio negocio, ya que tiene su fortaleza de tener muchas amistades, y conoce bastante gente quienes  le compran productos. Con este negocio se siente muy feliz, porque le gusta mucho estar ocupada y administrar lo propio. Es muy responsable y emprendedora en el negocio. Vende al contado y al crédito, sus ganancias son buenas, así a logrado cubrir los gastos del hogar.
Su sueño es tener mas surtido el negocio, por eso solicito este préstamo para incrementar su inventario, y obtener mas ganancias para poderles dar la educación debida a sus hijos y para comprar y vender articulos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Carolina is 26 years old, and she has been married for six years.  They have two children; ages two and five.  Her husband is an electrician, and he contributes to the household income.  She lives in a suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula.

For five years she has been selling new and used clothes like shirts, pants, t-shirts, sandals, purses, shoes, and other items.  Carolina previously worked as an employee in a general store.  However, she earned very little.  This motivated her to establish her own business.  She has the strength of many friends, and she knows plenty of people who buy products from her.

She is very happy with this business because she really likes to be busy and to manage it on her own. 

She is very responsible and enterprising in the business.  She sells for cash and on credit.  Her earnings are good, and she has managed to cover the household expenses.

Her dream is to have her business stocked more.  That is why she is requesting this loan to increase her inventory.  By doing so she will get more income, and she will be able to give her children a proper education.  She will also buy and sell items for the home.

loans.use: to buy new and used clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a married man with two children. One attends school while the other is still too young for school. He owns a house with neither electricity nor running water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family. 

Said has operated a retail shop for the past seven years. He also owns a grocery. His potential clients are his neighbors. His major challenge is customers not paying their debts on time. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase more sugar, rice, maize flour and vegetables for resale. He decided to join Yehu because of their fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar, rice, maize flour and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en: Tereza is from the village of Zuygaghbyur in the Shirak region of Armenia.  Zuygaghbyur is a beautiful place with alpine meadows and pastures ideal for livestock farming.  Tereza is a teacher by training but due to difficult economic times, she has been working as a farmer for the past ten years.  She considers herself a hardworking and honest person.  Tereza is looking for a loan to purchase livestock and feed.  She expects this investment to increase her income by 15%.  She dreams of buying additional land and expanding her business.  Tereza likes living in Zuygaghbyur and is surrounded by her close relatives.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and feed

loans.name: Johaira

texts.en:
Johaira is 23 years of age and single business woman. She needs to work hard to provide for her family.

Johaira sells shoes, slippers and sandals to the public market of Santiago City.  She has been in this business for almost 6 years.  Though she is single, she proves that she could improve her vending activity.  She would like to increase her profit by increasing the quantities of slippers,shoes and sandals she sells within the market. She hopes that she could obtain her goal in life, which is to become a successful businesswoman someday.

Johaira is now asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy additional quantities of slippers, shoes and sandals to sell. She hopes that this loan will be granted to her as it is the only opportunity to progress her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy slippers,shoes and sandals for her retail business

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI est un regroupe 6 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, sont mariées et mères au moins deux enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente  d’habits, des fruits et légumes et  de condiments alimentaires à l’image de ATA, en écharpe noire. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à Ouelessebougou dans la préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a 2 ans. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. 
ATA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à Ouelessebougou, excelle dans l’achat vente de condiments alimentaires. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, plusieurs paniers de différentes sortes de condiments alimentaires : Sounbala, poivre, tomate, oignon,  choux, concentrée de tomate.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako auprès des grossistes  et vend ses articles à Ouelessebougou et dans les différentes foires hebdomadaires, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
BENKADI is a group of 6 women who met through family and neighborhood relationships. Their average age is 35, they are all married and mother to at least two children. They manage different businesses such as buying and selling clothing, fruits and vegetables and condiments. On the picture Ata is wearing the black scarf. The women live in large traditional families in Ouelessebougou in the Kati prefecture (Koulikoro region, republic of Mali).

They have been shopkeeping for several years and their businesses are very much in demand.

Worried about satisfying the growing needs of their clientèle, the members of the group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program two years ago. They are on their third loan in solidarity.

Ata, who is the president of the group and very well known in Ouelessebougou, excels in buying and selling condiments.

She plans to use her loan to buy several baskets of different types of condiments: Soumbala [a West African spice with a strong odor], pepper, tomato, onion, cabbage, tomato concentrate. She gets her supplies in Bamako at the wholesalers and sells her products in Ouelessebougou and at the different weekly fairs, retail, for cash and credit, to a clientèle which consists mostly of women.

She hopes to make a monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA, a sum which would allow her to reimburse the loan and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Yu

texts.en:
Mrs.Yu is a 54-year-old married woman who lives with her three lovely kids in the Prey Chor district of Kampong Charm province, Cambodia. One of her kids is married and lives in a separate house. She is a loving mother who has been running a rice business since 1972. She is responsible and always takes care to provide a livelihood and a good education for her children. 

She can earn enough profit per day to cover her family expenses. To improve their quality of life, she would like to purchase more rice to sell when she can get a high price. She does not have enough capital for this so she has decided to apply for a loan through HKL partner with Kiva. She says that having this support for her business will make her family live in comfort, happiness and prosperity. Moreover, she is commited to paying back the kind lenders punctually. She is very thankful to all the donors who will help her family avoid poverty. This is the first cycle of her loan with HKL. She does not use any other state bank outside of HKL because it is the one micro-finance organisation that provides lower interest, good services and long term periods.

loans.use: to purchase rice.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 53 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, with one of them currently in school. For the past five years, Esther has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which sells cloth and decorations. 

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothing materials, and will help Esther to generate greater profits and purchase more products. Esther hopes that, in the future she will be able to have a big business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing materials

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 39 years old and lives in Altamira Tamaulipas. She is a very helpful, friendly and hard-working person. She sells Mexican food such as soups, enchiladas and tacos. She has 3 daughters and a son. The youngest girl is still in elementary school and helps her mom with the business. Veronica began her business to help her husband with the household expenses and their children’s education. She leaned to produce food for sale several years ago when working in a restaurant. When she lost her job, she began to operate her own business.

** Lina wants to acquire raw material at a lower cost, but can do so only by purchasing wholesale with cash. This would allow her to offer better prices and increase her income. She needs of $475 USD, which she plans to repay within 4-8 months.

** Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch:

Lina tiene 39 años de edad vive en Altamira Tamaulipas y es una persona muy servicial, amistosa y trabajadora. Trabaja en la venta de comida mexicana como sopes, enchiladas y taquitos. Tiene 3 hijas y un varón, la niña mas pequeña se encuentra estudiando la primaria y es la que le apoya más en su trabajo. Inicio su negocio ante la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y con los estudios de sus hijos; aprendió este oficio hace algunos años porque trabajo en un restaurant, tiempo después perdió el trabajo y comenzó su propio negocio.

Lina quiere adquirir materia prima a un menor costo, y la única manera de hacerlo es comprarla al contado y en mayoreo, de esta manera ella puede ofrecer mejores precios y aumentar sus ingresos. Necesita de $475 USD y en un término de 4-8 meses planea regresar el préstamo.

loans.use: Acquire Raw Material

loans.name: Oralia

texts.en:
I am a single mom and my son helps me sell our products. I run the business out of my house. My clients are neighbors and people who pay me to sell products in their areas. I need to buy more ingredients because my clientele is growing due to the high-quality products I sell.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer.

Soy madre soltera, tengo un hijo el que me ayuda a vender nuestros productos, este negocio lo tengo en mi casa, mis clientes son vecinos de mi comunidad y otra personas que me compran para vender en los lugares donde viven. Neceisto comprar mas producto ya que mi clientela ha aumentado por el buen producto que les ofrezco.

loans.use: Buy products like milk, cheese, custard and butter.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.en:
"I would like to be able to finish construction on two rooms that I built. I still need to install a roof, windows, and a door so that people can start living there because right now my house is very small and I have teenage children." I am asking for a $1,200.00 loan so that I can finish the construction work, buy the windows and door.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

“Me gustaría terminar los 2 cuartos que construí pero no he podido, me hace falta ponerles el techo, las ventanas y una puerta para poder habitarlos ya que mi casa es muy pequeña y tengo hijos adolescentes”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para terminar de construir, comprar las ventanas y una puerta.

loans.use: Install a roof, buy windows and a door

loans.name: Aydin

texts.en: Aydin lives in the village of Yenikand in the Salyan region. He is 27 years old and is single. He  has run an auto-repair business since 2003. With this business he has been able to provide for himself and prepare for the  future.  Now he would like a loan of $1200 to buy spare parts. He wants to offer better service to his customers and increase the number of customers.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his auto repair shop

loans.name: Ni Nengah Sarwi

texts.id:
A pig farmer since 1990. With a capital of Rp1,900,000 (about US$210) Ni Nengah Sarwi bought a mother pig and 3 piglets. Today Sarwi has 1 mother pig and 3 piglets. In a month Sarwi needs Rp90,000 (about $10) for pig feed. After about 6 months Sarwi would profit Rp250,000 (abot $28)/each from the pigs she raised. That profit was used to pay for her daily expenses, and schooling expenses for her 3 children. The first fisinish school but still live with her and not yet married. Her second child is in 8th grade (2nd grade moddle school). Her third is still 4 years old. Sarwi lives in a simple rental house. Loan from DINARI will be used to add capital with the hope her business would grow and income increased.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Menjadi seorang peternak babi telah dijalaninya sejak tahun 1990. Dengan modal Rp. 1.900.000,- Ni Nengah Sarwi membeli bibit induk babi dan bibit penggemukan. Saat ini Sarwi mempunyai 1 ekor induk babi dan 3 ekor babi penggemukan. Dalam sebulan Sarwi memerlukan Rp. 90.000,- untuk membeli pakan untuk babi peliharaannya. Setelah ± 6 bulan Sarwi baru mendapatkan keuntungan dari penjualan babi peliharaannya sebesar Rp. Rp. 250.000,- per ekornya. Keuntungan tersebut digunakan untuk membiayai kehidupannya sehari-hari dan biaya sekolah anaknya. Sarwi mempunyai 3 orang anak. Anaknya yang pertama sudah tamat sekolah namun masih tinggal bersamanya dan belum menikah. Anaknya yang kedua masih bersekolah kelas 2 SMP dan anaknya yang ketiga baru berumur 4 tahun. Sarwi tinggal bersama keluarganya di sebuah rumah sederhana, namun bukan miliknya sendiri ( numpang ). Pinjaman dari DINARI digunakan untuk menambah modal usahanya dengan harapan usahanya dapat berkembang dan meningkatkan penghasilannya.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock

Membeli bibit babi

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mr. Sophal L. is single. He is currently living with his sister, Miss. Maly L. in Prek Samrong village of Ta Khmao district. Both are orphan children. Since 2005 Sophal L. has run his motor taxi business in Phnom Penh. He works L. days and returns home very late at night. His sister is working in a garment factory in Ta Khmao district. 

This is the first time Sophal L. has requested a loan from MAXIMA. He is asking for $500 to purchase a new motorbike so that he can save money in the L. run by not having to repair his existing bike quite so often.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Selamet

texts.id:
With his motorcycle Selamet travels around to sell his items. He sells in Renon area. He bought his items in Badung market. Each week he bought with a capital of Rp 200,000.00 (Translator's note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp9,000-9,500.00). Every day he could profit between Rp30,000.00-40,000.000. With his wife Selamet is runiing this business. He lives with his wife and one child in a rented house. They have no schooling expense, since their child is not going to school any more. However Selamet has to think about his family and child's future. He hopes the capital to be obtained could support them in running the business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Dengan sepeda motor yang dimilikinya Selamet berkeliling menjajakan barang dagangannya. Dia menjajakannya di daerah Renon. Barang – barang dagangannya dibeli di Pasar Badung. Dia melakukannya seminggu sekali dengan modal Rp 200.000,00. Per harinya dia memperoleh keuntungan antara Rp 30.000,00 – Rp 40.000,00. Bersama isteri Selamet menekuni usaha ini. Dia tinggal bersama isteri dan seorang anaknya di rumah kontrakkan. Biaya pendidikan anak sudah tidak ada karena anaknya sudah tidak sekolah. Namun Selamet tetap harus memikirkan masa depan anak dan keluarganya. Modal usaha yang dia dapatkan diharapkan dapat mendukung kelangsungan usahanya ini.

loans.use:
To add items for sale

Menambah jumlah barang dagangan yang dijual

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 45 year-old Tabitha M.. She is married with no children, but has one other dependent, who is her niece. In 1994 Tabitha established a clothing business, and now requires a loan of $175 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: Tabitha would like to purchase additional stocks of clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in more ingredients for his food production and also buy more merchandise for his general store

loans.name: Macom 1 Group

texts.es:
Andrea is 22 years old and has two children. She dedicates her time to the creation of shirts, cushions, table cloths and napkins typical to her region. She tries to create various things to be able to leave her community one time a month to sell them in the city of San Cristobal or to people who come to Zinacantan to buy handiwork for resale. With her loan, she would like to buy basic materials (cloth, thread and dyes). The other members of her group, Juana Victoria L. L., Juana G. L., PascuaL. L. L. and Catalina V. are artisans.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

ANDREA TIENE 22 AÑOS Y TIENE 2 HIJOS SE DEDICA A ELABORAR BLUSAS, COJINES, MANTELES Y SERVILLETAS TIPICAS D. SU REGION TRATA D. ELABORAR VARIAS COSAS PARA PODER SALIR D. SU COMUNIDAD UNA VEZ AL MES A VENDERLAS A L. CIUDAD D. SAN CRISTOBAL O A PERSONAS QUE LLEGAN A ZINACANTAN A COMPRAR ARTESANIAS PARA L. REVENTA, CON SU CREDITO LE GUSTARIA COMPRAR MATERIA PRIMA(TEL., HILOS Y TINTAS), LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO JUANA VICTORIA L. L., JUANA G. L., PASCUAL. L. LOPEZY CATALINA V. L. SON ARTESANAS.

loans.use: To buy basic materials (cloth, thread and dyes). - COMPRAR MATERIA PRIMA(TELAS, hILOS Y TINTAS).

loans.name: Eith

texts.en: Mrs. Eith M., age 39, lives with her younger sister and works raising pigs at her house. She earns $3.5 a day. Her younger sister, Eith Me, age 30, owns a plot of farmland growing rice, making about $1 a day. These two sisters are requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase more pigs, food for the pigs, and fertilizers to put on the farmland. Moreover, any extra from the loan will be used to build a stable house.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs, food for the pigs, and fertilizers to put on the farmland

loans.name: Sokha Khim Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha K., the group leader, lives in Cham Bak Phém Village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a tailor and earns a small income that must support her family. Because Mrs. Sokha K. only has one business activity, she has decided to start another business to earn a second income breeding pigs. In order to do this, she will need a loan to buy some pigs; any remaining money will contribute towards building a piggery.

Mrs. Sokha K. is a widow with three children. One of her children is also a tailor; the others are enrolled in school.

Mrs. Sokha K. previously obtained a loan from AMK to start cultivating rice.

loans.use: To start a new business breeding pigs

loans.name: Vuny

texts.en: Mrs. Vuny M. lives in Pon Ley Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a car repairer in the local village. Previously, Mrs. Vuny M. obtained a loan from AMK to start a small garage in the village. Her business now is improved, so she wants to expand it but does not have enough money to buy more car equipment for her customers. Thus, Mrs. Vuny M. asked for a loan again to deal with this purpose. Mrs. Vuny M. is a widow with three children, one of whom is a driver while one other is enrolling in school. The youngest child is too young to work or attend school.

loans.use: To buy more car equipment for her customers.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva is a responsible and dedicated mother to her children. She is 47 years old, years that are a testament to her long trajectory in the domain of agricultural work. Today she live with three of her four children, who are the source of her strength and constant motivation to get up each morning and go to her fields to cultivate. She brings alfalfa for the cows, promptly directs them back to their stable to milk them, then sell the milk in order to bring home her daily income. This is Eva's daily work routine so that she can sustain the education of her children.

She desires to improve the state of her stable, making it more spacious in order to produce a higher quantity of milk and gain higher income. Eva is asking for a loan so that she can buy planks of calamine for the roof of her stable, so that her cows will be more comfortable and more productive.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer.

Eva es una madre responsable y dedicada a sus hijos, ella actualmente tiene 47 años, que son testigos de una larga trayectoria en el ámbito de las actividades agrícolas. Hoy vive con tres de sus cuatro hijos que son su fuerza y motivación constante para levantarse cada mañana, ir a sus campos de cultivo, recoger la alfalfa para sus vacas y luego prontamente dirigirse hacia su establo para ordeñar la leche y luego venderla, para así obtener una ganancia diaria para su hogar. Esa es la rutina de trabajo de Eva, así puede sostener la educación de sus hijos. Su deseo es mejorar el estado de su establo, hacerlo más espacioso para poder producir mayor cantidad de leche y obtener mayores ganancias por la misma. Eva solicita el préstamo para poder comprar planchas de calamina para el techo de su establo. Así sus vacas estarán más confortadas y serán más productivas.

loans.use: To acquire calamine planks for the roof of her stable.

loans.name: Radojka

texts.en: Radojka is a married woman living in the town of Doboj.  She has 2 children.  Her husband works for a construction firm, while Radojka helps support the family by working at a restaurant in town.  She is requesting her first loan from Žene za Žene in the amount of 1000 KM. She will use this money to buy materials and food ingredients to support her baking business. Radojka bakes cookies at home and sells these to her neighbors as well as the regular customers at the restaurant. She also may use part of the loan to help with repairs to her home.  Radojka hopes that she will earn enough from the cookie sales so she can help with her family’s expenses and pay off this loan on time.

loans.use: To buy materials and food ingredients to bake cookies

loans.name: Elvin

texts.es:
Elvin tiene 43 años, vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos.  Es un humilde agricultor dedicado a la producción de cítricos dentro de su comunidad y cuyos terrenos de cultivo se encuentran en zonas distantes de su hogar, por ello tiene que salir a tempranas horas de la mañana, y de la misma forma le toma tiempo el retornar a su casa. Pero el ver los frutos en sus terrenos lo reconfortan, y el cosechar aun más, aunque para ello tenga que invertir  grandes cantidades de dinero, ya que en la cosecha sabe que tendrá una  retribución al negociar sus productos, los que tienen que ser de alta calidad para tener mayores ingresos en su venta.
Elvin basa su esfuerzo en el bienestar de su familia, sobre todo en sus hijos.
Tiene proyectado aumentar su producción, para solventar los gastos de trasporte, ya que quiere llevar sus productos a la capital, Lima.
texts.en:
Elvin is 43 years old and lives with her wife and 4 kids. He is a humble farmer dedicated to produce citric fruits inside his community, the lands of cultivation are far away from his home, this is why he has to leave early in the morning and it takes time to go back home too. But when he sees the harvest of his land it comforts him and wants to harvest even more although in order to do that he needs to invest large amounts of money, because he knows that on a larger harvest, he will have better results, and the fruit has to be of better quality in order to get more income from the sales.
Elvin bases his effort on the well being of his family, mostly his children.
He wants to increase production, to pay for transportation expenses because he wants to take his products to the capital, Lima.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for transportation of his fruit to the capital city to increase his profit

loans.name: Molimaufou

texts.en:
Molimaufou F. is 42 years old and is married with five children.  She has many year of experience working in the handicraft business. She sells to the Flea market at Savalalo about five days per week.  She has had three previous loans with SPBD.  

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (approximately 125 USD). SPBD loans are Molimaufou's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Her business provides financial support for her kids to attend school. In addition, they also are devoted members to the church, Her whole family is so committed to this business. Molimau wants to export some of her handicrafts overseas if her business is successful.

loans.use: To purchase a carving board, materials, new rip saw, chain saw, samoan bags, kava bowls, fine mats, samoa earrings and elei materials etc.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: La señora Paula S.  tiene la edad de 65 años habita en el sector de los cocos ubicado en la concepción, tiene una hija que habita con ella, su hija casada y le ayuda con los gastos de la casa; Paula hace tortillas y comida todos los días, ya que por el sector que ella habita hay una empresa y todos los trabajadores  le llegan a comprar el almuerzo.  Ella solicita el crédito para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de comidas y así no desmejorar el servicio que ofrece
texts.en:
Paula Sanchez, 65, lives in Los Cocos, Concepcion. A married daughter lives with her, and helps with the household expenses. Paula makes tortillas and cooks dishes everyday, for workers of a close-by factory who come to her house to buy the food. Paula is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients for more dishes, and improve the service she offers to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing ingredients to prepare dishes

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene 34 años, es casado y tiene dos hijos con quienes vive. El es agricultor, actividad que lo acompaña por 25 años. Para Juan esto solo es el comienzo de una vida próspera  como agricultor, ya que con el tiempo pretende  comercializar sus productos en  las ciudades cercanas, que es lo que más le agrada, vender los productos que produce a los  grandes mercados de las ciudades, ya que en las ciudades de la sierra del Perú las frutas tiene gran demanda y su producción es mensual, lo que ayuda en su economía, aunque lo difícil para él, es la cosecha. Se encuentra en su cuarto préstamo con MFP, no tuvo observaciones en sus pagos. Juan invertirá 1000 soles en nuevas plantas de plátanos y cítricos para sus hectáreas de terreno.
texts.en:
Juan is 34 years old, married and has two children. He is a farmer, an activity he has done for 25 years. For Juan this is only the beginning of a prosperous life as a farmer, as with time he intends to sell his products in the nearby cities, which is what he enjoys the most, selling the products that he products in the large city markets. In the mountain cities of Peru fruit is in high demand and his fruits ripen monthly, so what helps him the most, although it is hard work, is his harvest. This is his fourth loan with MFP, he hasn’t had any problems with his payments. Juan will invest 1000 soles in new banana and citrus plans on his hectares of land.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new banana and citrus fruit plants

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en:
Godwin M.. N. is forty years old. He is married with one child who is currently in the basic school. Godwin resides at Ejura with his immediate family. Ejura is a busy market town in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. The residents of Ejura are actively involved in trading activities.

Godwin runs a number of businesses in his locality and elsewhere. His ventures include motorbike spare parts, cell phone credits and accessories, CDs, and photography. He has run these multiple businesses for more than sixteen years and is very grateful to God for how far He has brought him. Godwin says he does not only stay in his studio to take photographs; he also travels with clients to other places to take photos and videotape events for a fee.

Godwin is requesting a loan to support his photography business. He says that for some time now, business has been steady due to technological advancements. He hopes to revive this business to avoid being kicked out of the market.

Godwin is in a member of a group called ‘Rely on God’. The group members guarantee for one another to access the loan.

loans.use: To revive and expand his photography business

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Mr Mawulom Kokou N. est né en 1954 à Kovié où il pratique la culture de mais et de manioc. Marié avec quatre (04) enfants à charge, il demande un financement pour agrandir sa surface cultivable, acheter intrants et fertilisants pour avoir un rendement meilleur. Les revenus tirés lui permettront de mieux scolariser ses enfants et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Mawulom Kokou N. was born in 1954 in Kovié where he grows corn and manioc. Married, with four children to take care of, he is asking for a loan to increase the area he cultivates, and buy seeds, plant food and fertilizers for a better crop yield. The income generated will allow him pay his children’s school fees and improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the area he culivates and buy seeds, plant food and fertilizers

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! Pictured here is 26 year-old Rose L. from Mwanza. She is married with one four year-old child.
 
Rose has been running a small shop since 2005. She sells a number of common household and grocery items such as soda, water, sugar, soaps, tealeaves, eggs, maize flours, wheat flours and fitness books. She works at the business for 13 hours per day, seven days per week and is assisted by her husband. 

Rose currently earns about 200 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to buy additional stocks of soda, sugar, wheat flours and fitness books. In the future, she plans to increase the stocks of her business. Rose thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of soda, sugar, wheat flours and fitness books

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa K. is 46 years old. She is divorced and has four children who are dependent on her. Two of her children are male and two female. She says one of her children is in junior high school and two are in senior high school. The first born is currently learning a trade – hair dressing. According to Adwoa, infidelity on the part of her husband caused the break up. She says, however, that he helps to care for the children. Adwoa lives with the children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Dormaa is an agriculture-dominated town. It is about 45 minute drive from Sunyani, the regional capital.

Adwoa trades in fresh yams to make some income to provide for the children. She buys tubers of yams from Kintampo which she sells in the market square to retailers and other customers. She has been in business for 20 years. Adwoa wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can buy tubers of yams in bulk. She hopes to help her children have access to a good education.

loans.use: To buy tubers of yams in bulk

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
My name is Khalida and my age is 44 years. I have been a citizen of Lahore, Pakistan for the past 3 years. I am a widow and I bear the hardships to support my family. I started sewing clothes but I did this work for only three years because it is a time-intensive profession and I hadn’t a sewing machine in good condition.

Now I have started to manufacture thread-chains and sell them to the goldsmiths. This work gives me good earnings and I can easily manage my household expenses and pay off the school fees of my five children. I have successfully repaid my two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I am applying again for a loan to buy more thread for expanding my thread-chain making business.

loans.use: To buy thread for her thread-chain making business

loans.name: Faaliliu

texts.en:
Faaliliu V., 41, is married with 6 children. She has many years of experience in the shop business. She sells to the general public 5 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD, Kiva's partner. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).

SPBD loans are Faaliliu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use the loan to buy more goods for the shop.

loans.use: Purchase frozen foods, snacks, beverages, tin foods, sugar, flour, salt, rice, onions, diapers, toilet paper, soap

loans.name: Gnamba

texts.fr: Cette  est une résidente du quartier de KEGUE. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbons de bois, elle a commencé cette activité en 2006. Ce commerce marche bien pour elle car elle est la seule revendeuse de charbons de bois de son quartier. Le stock dont elle dispose actuellement ne lui permet pas de satisfaire ses clients, elle sollicite alors de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 20 sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
This is a woman who lives in the KEGUE neighborhood. She's married and the mother of two children. To make money, she sells charcoal, a business she's been running since 2006. She's doing well, because she's the only charcoal reseller in her neighborhood. The stock she currently has does not enable her to meet customer demand, she's therefore seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 20 sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 20 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Dotse

texts.fr: Dotse T. est âgé de 29 ans, marié et père d’un petit garçon. Il gère une boutique d’alimentation générale à Wome depuis 3 ans. Son commerce est très prospère et il espère avec ce crédit, réapprovisionner on magasin afin de répondre aux attentes de la clientèle. Il espère améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Dotse T., age 29, is married and the father of a young boy. He has been managing a grocery store in Wome for three years. His commerce is very prosperous, and he hopes to use this loan to resupply his store in order to respond to customer expectations. He hopes to improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply his shop

loans.name: Adebisi

texts.en: Adebisi is 34 years old and married with two children.  She sells jewelry.   Adebisi is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more jewelry to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Tacheyomigbachi Group

texts.en:
This is Isatu K., Isatu K. and Kadiatu S.. They named their group Tache Yo M’Gbachi, a Temne phrase meaning "Let us be firm". They are local entrepreneurs based in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these women are receiving from SMT/Kiva. They want a loan to help them develop their businesses, because they have seen how microloans have been helping others’ businesses grow.

Isatu K. (pictured in the middle) is the leader of the group. Isatu is thirty-two years old. She was born in Makeni, is married to a motor driver and they have four children. Two of their children are in primary school and two are in secondary school. Isatu sells dishes, bowls and other plastic items. She has been a businesswoman for five years now. With this loan, she will travel to neighboring Guinea to buy more goods to sell. Goods are usually cheaper in neighboring Guinea.

loans.use: To purchase more plastics to sell

loans.name: Sanavar

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Санавар Кипчакова родилась в   1961 году, замужем, любящая мать  2 детей. Санавар торгует на рынке «Бадахшан» Зафарабадского района. Её товар – это различного вида ткани. Это не плохой бизнес в нашей стране, так как спрос на ткани у нашего народа есть. Купив ткань, они заказывают пошив национальных платьев.Каждая девушка выходя замуж имеет минимум 15 видов национальных платьев в своем приданном, которые сшиты на заказ из разных тканей. Муж Санавар  Исломиддин, помогает своей жене в бизнесе.
   Санавар планирует получить кредит, и поэтому обращается с заявкой в Кива. Кредит хочет потратить на расширение своего товара.
texts.en:
Born 1961, Sanavar K. is married and is a loving mother of 2 children. Sanavar sells at the Badahshan market in the Zafarabad district. Her merchandise is various types of fabrics. This is not a bad business in our country because fabrics are in demand among our people. Having purchased fabrics, they have traditional dresses made to-order. Every young woman has a minimum of 15 types of traditional dresses in her dowry when she gets married. Theses dresses are custom-made from various fabrics. Sanavar’s husband, Islomiddin, helps his wife with the business. Sanavar is planning to obtain a loan and went to Kiva with her request. She wants to use the loan to expand her merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Hawa

texts.fr: hawa D. confectionne et vend des thioubs.elle habite ouakam depuis dix ans,elle a une tres grande experience en teinture mais elle confectionne aussi des robes en batik.elle est divorcee et mere de deux enfants.elle sollicite un credit de cent cinquante mille(150 000)frs en vue d'augmenter son fond de roulement et augmenter ses benefices en vue de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa petite famille.
texts.en:
Hawa D. makes and sells "thioubs" (dyed fabrics). She's been living in Ouakam for ten years, and is very experienced in dying. She also makes batik dresses. She's divorced and the mother of two children. She's seeking a loan of XOF 150'000, in view of bolstering her working capital, in order to increase her revenue to better provide for her small family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her working capital

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane N. is from the village of Landing, Camella Talakag Bukidnon. She is 37 years old. Mary Jane is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Jane owns and operates a business providing transport to people in her community using her motorcycle. Her husband also works as a motor vehicle driver. Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In August 2009, Mary Jane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials she needs to expand the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mary Jane from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her transport service.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn N. is from the village of Tagoloan in Misamis Oriental. She is 37 years old. Evelyn is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Evelyn just started this business.

In 2009, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be Evelyn's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products to sell

loans.name: Caroline Njeri

texts.en:
Caroline is a 30 year old single lady who is very focused, determined and hardworking.

Caroline has been operating a grocery store for six years. Her business is in a densely populated area near a bus stop and a residential estate. He clients include the tenants in the residentaial area and passerby's from the bus stop.

The client was introduced to KADET by other members of the group whom she meets to fellowship. She has applied for a loan to upgrade her business and with the extra profits she intends to start another similar business in another identified location.

Her future hopes and dreams are to be a wholesale supplier of vegetables to other retailers.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Restocking her grocery store

loans.name: Komlan Ayédon

texts.fr: Komla  Ayédon A.  est un jeune homme âgé de 28 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Elle habite à Badou, une ville située à 110 kilomètres de Kpalimé. C’est un revendeur des produits de l’alimentation générale. Il s’approvisionne chez les commerçants grossiste de la ville de badou. Avec ce prêt, il compte acheter en gros et stocker certains produits qui coulent vite sur le marché à savoir : le riz, les savons, l’huile, les piles torche, les tomates en boîte, du sucre, le lait etc.  Avec les bénéfices réalisés, il compte mieux répondre aux charges de sa famille. Dans l’avenir, Komlan rêve de construire une grande boutique chez lui où les autres revendeurs de la localité pourraient venir se ravitailler chez lui.

loans.use: achat des produits de consommation

loans.name: Maria Lucrecia

texts.es: La señora Maria Lucrecia Narváez es una mujer casada y tiene 6 hijos todos son mayores de edad. La señora Maria tiene un negocio de compra-venta de joyas y ropa nueva los cuales distribuye por encargos principalmente. Hace más de 15 años de haber iniciado este negocio, el cual empezó debido a que su esposo es albañil y no ganaba lo suficiente para la manutención del hogar, por lo que ella tuvo que buscar fuentes alternativas para mejorar los ingresos del hogar y le ha ido bien desde entonces. El crédito será invertido en la compra de joyas y de ropa nueva, ya que se acercan las fechas de ventas buenas y ella desea aprovechar comprar en este momento en que los precios están bajos. Su sueño es llegar a tener una tienda en la cual pueda vender sus joyas y ropa nueva variada, de tal forma que se la pueda heredar a sus hijos para que ellos mejoren su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Lucrecia N. is a married woman and has 6 sons, all who are adults. Mrs Maria has a business of buying and selling jewelry and new clothes, which mainly she distributes through orders. More than 15 years after starting this business, which she started because her husband is a mason and did not earn enough to support the household, she had to seek alternative sources to improve household income and it has gone well since then. The loan will be invested in the purchase of jewelry and new clothes. Since the sales season is approaching, she would like to make good purchases at this time when prices are low. Her dream is to have a store in which to sell her jewelry and various new clothes, so that it can be passed onto her children so that they improve their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of jewelry and new clothes for sale

loans.name: Cielito Lindo Group

texts.es: El grupo “Cielito Lindo” esta representado por la señora Rita uy conformado por 12 miembros que van cumpliendo ya su tercer ciclo demostrando puntualidad, honestidad y ganas D. trabajar para seguir creciendo. Entre las actividades que desempeñan las socias esta la venta D. cosméticos por catalogo, venta y producción D. artesanías en arcilla lana y vidrio, jugo D. naranja al paso, servicio D. peluquería, empanadas y al servicio domestico, lavandería y limpieza. En cuanto a la competencia el grupo esta conciente D. el alto nivel D. competencia en el mercado es por esta razón que requieren del financiamiento para poder capitalizarse y mover sus puestos D. trabajo a lugares mas comerciales, también para la adquisición D. materia prima y herramientas D. trabajo que ayuden a generar una mayor ganancia para el sustento D. sus familias.
texts.en:
Rita is the representative of the "Cielito Lindo" group, which is maD. up of 12 members, who are in their third lending cycle, having demonstrated punctuality, honesty and the will to work to continue growing. Among the activities the members are engaged in is the sale of cosmetics by catalogue, production and sales of handicrafts in clay, wool and glass, orange juice sales street stands, barber shop services, turnovers, and domestic help, laundry and cleaning. With regard to competition in these areas, the group is aware of the high level of market competition and this is the reason they require financing to be able to increase their capitalization and move their sales stalls to better locations and to acquire raw materials and work tools that will help them generate larger profits to support their families.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ayush

texts.en:
Ayush B. is 46 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a small house in Khovd Province, Mongolia. Her son and daughter are both university students and her husband works as a security guard at a local school. B. operates a flour, rice and sugar trading business at a local market in her town. She started her business in 2002, with the capital of 300,000 tugrug (~210 USD) and has managed it by herself for the last seven years. She has worked hard and today enjoys a stable business operation. Her earnings have enabled her to remodel her house and pay all of her children's school tuition, and today her working capital exceeds 2,000,000 tugrugs (~1400 USD). 

B. is a very open-minded and hardworking businesswoman and she has many plans for the future. She hopes to continue to increase her earnings and improve her family's quality of life. She says, "In Mongolia the swine flu is spreading very quickly and the Mongolian government is going to limit domestic transportation throughout the country. For this reason, I hope to purchase a large amount of products from Bayan-Ulgii, the closest province, before the government's decision."  B. is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~1400 USD) loan to purchase three tons of flour from Ulaanbaatar.

About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here

loans.use: To purchase three tons of flour from the closest province in anticipation of government restrictions on travel

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Cette femme est célibataire mais a un enfant à sa charge. C’est une artiste de la chanson ; parallèlement à ce métier, elle est gérante d’un débit de boisson dans le quartier de Protestant à Lomé. Ce bar est visité par de nombreux clients à cause du bon accueil qu’elle leur réserve en tout temps. Elle a un besoin urgent de commander des casiers de boissons manquants dans son stock ; c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES. Elle n’a aucune inquiétude pour respecter son échéancier de remboursement.
texts.en:
This woman is single but has one child to support. She is a singer; at the same time she is the manager of a bar in the protestant area of Lomé. This bar is used by a large number of customers as a result of the warm welcome she gives them at all times. She urgently needs to order crates of drinks that are missing from her stock; it is for this reason that she is asking for a loan from WAGES. She is not worried about being able to adhere to the terms of her repayment schedule.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of crates of drinks

loans.name: María Gloria

texts.es: María Gloria M. D. V. D. 42 años D. edad, resiD. en San Juan Opico en el departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos.  Ella posee una venta D. pupusas y tortillas, así mismo venD. chocobananos, los cuales son guineos bañados D. chocolate y colocados en un palito. María solicita un préstamo ya que desea poder comprar materia prima para la elaboración D. las pupusas y tortillas, así mismo desea poder terminar D. pagar una refrigeradora. María desea aumentar sus ventas y ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
María Gloria M. D. V. is 42. She lives in San Juan Opico in the La Libertad department. She lives with her husband and two children. She has a business selling “pupusas” (flatbread stuffed with meat, cheese, or vegetables) and tortillas. She also sells “chocobananos”, which are green bananas covered in chocolate and placed on a stick. María is asking for a loan because she wants to be able to buy raw material to make the pupusas and tortillas. She also wants to be able to finish paying for a refrigerator. María wants to increase her sales and help her husband with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, rice, beans, and cheese

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: N. Justine is a 48-year-old businesswoman and mother of two children. She has a clothes shop in Abaita Ababiri trading centre, which she started three years ago. Justine is using her loan to purchase stock for her shop in order to meet customer demand. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to purchase a plot of land and educate her children to university level.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her clothes shop

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es: La Sra. Natia tiene 60 años de edad ella es madre soltera tiene hijos ya mayores de edad el cual ya no viven con ella. Ella vive en prolongacion 3 de octubre en el Distrito de la Tinguiña en casa de material noble. Ella se dedica a  la venta de pescado en el mercado La Palma en puesto propio, ella se dedica a este negocio hace 12 años. La Sra. Natia a pesar de su edad es una persona trabajadora, con sueños y objetivos, uno de ellos es poder adquirir otro puesto, con el dinero que solicita invertira en mojoras de su local.
texts.en:
Natalia is 60 years of age. She is a single mother. She has adult children who do not live with her. She lives in the district of Tinguiña in a brick house. She is dedicated to selling fish in the La Palma market from her own stall. She has been dedicated to this business for twelve years. Despite her age, Natalia is a hard-working person, with dreams and goals. One of them is to be able to acquire another stall. With the money she is requesting, she will invest in improvements in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Housing improvements

loans.name: Fuerza Divina 5 Group

texts.en:
Virginia is the coordinator of her group Fuerza Divina (Divine Force), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Hato Mayor, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her two children.

Virginia is excited to be taking out her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her ambulatory business selling underwear, which she does by travelling to the main market in Santo Domingo where she buys her goods in bulk and then returns to her community to sell them at a profit. She will use the profits to invest in the education of her children by purchasing school supplies as well as paying for their transportation costs. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Emily's Group

texts.en:
Emily D. is from the town of Cebu San Isidro. She is 39 years old. Emily is the group leader of a 13-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Emily D. group.

Emily is married and has 1 adult-aged children. To make a living, Emily owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising ducks to produce and sell eggs. Emily has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emily joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emily has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock to raise & sell in future. Emily is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock to raise & sell in future. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Emily from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a business-man; he sells electronics in one of the popular markets in Benin City. He sells all kinds of electronics in his shop, e.g. automatic voltage regulator, DVD player, TV cable and more. He has been in the business for over 30 years. From this business he makes his living and takes good care of his family.
 
John wants to stock up his shop with more electronics. He is requesting for loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more electronics to sell and to increase his income. 

He is 60 years old, married, and has 3 children who are doing well. He says thank you to all kiva lenders for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics to sell.

loans.name: Farah

texts.en:
Farah C. is from the village of Sugarland, Lumbo, Valencia City. She is 37 years old. Farah is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Farah owns & operates a business selling snacks, pastries and other beverages in the local community. Farah has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Farah joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Farah has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Farah is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Farah from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.
