About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Born in 1958, Dorothy M. is married to Mr Leo Munangl and they are blessed with nine children. She has faced so many challenges as a woman, like when the cold hands of death took her mother away when Dorothy was still very young, and when she finds it difficult to assist her husband to pay for their children’s education and to provide for the basic needs of their children.

Dorothy has twice successfully obtained and repaid loans from GHAPE. The inability to get enough investment capital which could give her a higher income to meet her children’s an family’s needs, motivated her to obtain a loan from GHAPE. She thinks her business will succeed because she has been doing this business for a very long time.
Dorothy’s loan would be provided through the Grounded and Holistic Approach for People's Empowerment (GHAPE), a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy more corn, palm oil, kerosene and salt

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a married man with a son who attends school. He has had an electronics business for two years and was previously a teacher. For extra income, he still teaches and also operates a grocery store. He sells his electronics products from a shop.
George wants to purchase mobile phones, batteries and phone covers with his 20,000 KES loan. He aspires to be the leading shop for electronics and to sell wholesale one day. He wanted to join Kiva partner, Yehu, because he liked their transparency. George's greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phones, batteries and phone covers

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad es productora lechera, es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de su familia. La señora es separada. Su domicilio está ubicado en la comunidad de Arasaya – Achacachi Prov. Omasuyos a 2 horas y media de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de vaca lechera para incrementar su producción de leche.
 
Es segundo crédito con IMPRO. El buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Natividad sells dairy products. This is her principle source of income with which she provides for her family. She is separated. Her home is located in the Arasaya community in Achacachi province, two and a half hours from the city of El Alto. She will use the loan to buy a dairy cow to increase her milk production. This will be her second loan with IMPRO. Her good repayment record allows her to request another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Nonime

texts.en: Nonime M. is from the village of Casinglot, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 53 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Nonime owns and operates a specialized retail business selling flowers in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 9,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Nonime joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Nonime is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge, de 42 años, es un padre de familia muy responsable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Rosa de 29 años y sus 2 menores hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. En los años que tiene de vida, Jorge nunca le huyo al trabajo y es que desde muy joven trabajó en cualquier oficio. Ahora posee chacras, las cuales le dan los ingresos que necesita para mantener a su familia. Paralelamente a esta actividad, trabaja también en la municipalidad de la comunidad de San Juan, y con este nuevo ingreso económico ha logrado poner una pequeña tiendita, que ahora ha procurado mantenerla surtida y por eso es muy concurrida por todos sus vecinos. De todas las actividades que realiza, le gusta más trabajar en su tienda, puesto que disfruta mucho el brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes, pese a que son largas horas que tiene que estar en su negocio, pero no le importa, con tal de progresar en la vida. Con el tiempo, espera ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor comodidad. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, en sus primeros pagos fue muy puntual y espera poder serlo ahora también, es de los pocos hombres de su grupo comunal, por lo cual es muy querido por el resto de las socias. Con los setecientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Jorge, 42, is a very responsible and hard-working father. He lives in his own home with his wife Rosa, 29, and their 2 young children, who are the motivation behind all of his work. In all his life, Jorge has never avoided work; since a very young age he worked in various jobs. He now owns fields, which provide him the income he needs to maintain his family. He also works in the municipality of the San Juan community. With this new income he has been able to open a small store, which he has kept stocked; so it is very popular with the neighbours. Of all of his jobs, he most likes working in his store, since he benefits greatly from offering good service to his customers, despite the long hours he has to spend in the store. But this does not bother him; it's all about progressing in life. With time, he hopes to expand the facilities of his store to offer his customers greater convenience. This is his fifth loan with MFP. He was very punctual with his first payments and he hopes to continue being so. He is one of the few men in his community group, so he is very dear to the rest of the members. With the 700 soles he is requesting, he will purchase more products to improve his store.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of more products to improve his store

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 32-year-old married man who has three children in school. He runs a van transport business to earn a living.

David has managed to grow his business which has been running for four years and has two employees. He was previously selling shoes. He is married to a farmer and he works hard to provide for his family and also gives his wife support with the farming.

David joined a group in Faulu Kenya called “Prosper” whose members guarantee each other’s loans. He has requested a loan of Kes 80,000 to buy a vehicle engine. He hopes to own more vans for his transport business in the future.

loans.use: To buy a new engine for his vehicle

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is a member and the secretary of Kapsinendet Chorwa Dairy Group, which is being funded by Juhudi Kilimo. Reuben is 36 years old and married. He has 2 children, ages 3 and 6. His eldest child is currently attending school.

Reuben has been operating his mixed farm for 10 years and has employed four people from his community. His main product is tea, which he sells to Finlay and Kenya Tea Development Authority, and milk, which he sells locally. Apart from farming, he also operates a retail shop in the same area. His biggest challenges in farming have been lack of food and water for his animals.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo, of KES 50,000, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that with this dairy cow, his income will increase and he will be able to cater for the family's needs and to improve the nutrition of his family.

Reuben would like to improve his dairy farming by acquiring quality dairy cows in the future. He believes that this loan will greatly improve his life.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygames, les dix membres du groupe Benkadi 1 de Bènèbougou ont en moyenne 41 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Bènèbougou dans la commune rurale de Pelengana dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage, de voisinage et de parenté. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs superficies de culture, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt de campagne. 
Des spéculations comme le mil, le fonio et le niébé seront cultivées par les membres du groupe.
Madame Sitan Dembélé compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 sacs de complexe céréale, 4 dabas et recruter la main d’œuvre pour les activités de labour et de sarclage  dans ses champs. Elle se ravitaille en intrants agricoles au grand marché de Ségou, en main d’œuvre avec l’association des jeunes et des femmes du village. 
Elle compte produire 10 sacs de mil, 6 sacs de fonio, 2 sacs de niébé et faire des bottes avec des fanes de niébé sur sa surface de culture de 3 hectares. Une partie de la production est auto consommée tandis que le reste est vendu avec les bottes pour prendre en charge les soins de santé et les frais de scolarisation des enfants. 
Madame Sitan   Dembélé à l’image des autres femmes du groupe a pour objectif d’assurer l’auto suffisance alimentaire dans le village.
texts.en:
Predominantly married into polygamous families, the ten members of the group Benkadi 1 of Bènèbougou are 41 years old and have 3 children, on average. They all live in the village of Bènèbougou in the rural commune of Pelengana in the Ségou region (4th administrative region of Mali). They know one another through their marital, parentage and neighborhood ties. With the goal of increasing their cultivable land, they appealed to Soro Yiriwaso and are on their 2nd farm loan. Crops like millet, fonio (a species of millet from Mali), and black-eyed peas will be cultivated by the members of the group. Mrs. Sitan Dembélé expects to use her loan to buy 3 bags of complex fertilizer and 4 axes, and to recruit the manual labor needed for the labor and hoeing activities in the fields. She gets fresh agricultural supplies at the big market in Ségou, and the manual labor from the association of young people and women in the village. She expects to produce 10 bags of millet, 6 bags of fonio, 2 bags of black-eyed peas and to make boots with the tops of the black-eyed pea plants from her 3 hectare cultivable area. She will use a part of what is produced herself, while the rest will be sold with the boots to care for the health needs and schooling costs of her children. Mrs. Sitan Dembélé, like the other women of the group, also wants to assure the village's self-sufficiency in providing food.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers (complex fertilizers), small tools (axes), and to hire manual labor

loans.name: Kan

texts.en: Kan S., 28, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean temples. She runs a hair-dressing shop for an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband is a security guard for a private company, earning an income of USD 2 per day.  S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a truck to transport dirt to fill in people’s land in her province. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support the children’s studies.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a truck to transport dirt

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie B. is from the village of Pwerta, Lurugan, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 32 years old. Rosie is single and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Rosie runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. Her main source of income comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Rosie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Rosie's 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve/expand the store. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Koki

texts.en:
Koki is a single mother with one child who attends school. She has been operating her charcoal sales business for the last three years, selling to restaurant operators and neighbours. Previously she was a farmer.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase stock and also pay for her business permit. She sells wholesale, retail, at the market and from door to door.

She faces the challenges of high transport cost and seasonality in her business. Her major goal is to become a big supplier of charcoal in future. She decided to work with Yehu so as to get a loan and expand her business.

Koki lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and the rent bill.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal and pay for business permit.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora U., from the village of Bolinao, is 47 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Aurora has been planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale for over five years, earning approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Aurora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 3000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase fertilizers, she is now requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP to purchase more fertilizers such as manure. This will be Aurora's fifth loan from ASKI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes C. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 44 years old, married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Lourdes owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, buying and selling snacks like junk foods, soft-drinks, and other food and toy products in the school canteen and the local community. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Lourdes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell and for working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lourdes from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell and for working capital

loans.name: Muhae's Group

texts.en:
Muhae T. is the leader of the group. She is 36 and married.  Her husband works in construction. Together they are bringing up a daughter and a son. Both of them are at school. Three years ago with the initial investment of 18,000 soms, Muhae started to breed farm animals. She hopes to obtain the loan in order to purchase livestock animals for breeding.  In the future she wants to save money to start repairing their house. 

Diloram E., 48, is the treasurer of the group. She is married and has two children. Diloram is engaged in wholesale trade of fruits and vegetables. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase more fruits and vegetables for sale. 

Nozgul A. is 20 years old. She is engaged in farming. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase furniture. 

Ikromjon M., 36, is married. She has a daughter and a son.  Ten years ago with the initial investment of 20,000 soms Ikromjon, together with her husband, started to breed cattle.  With money received from the loan she wants to purchase a calf for breeding.
 
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock animals

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena G. is from the village of Tupsan, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 56 years old. Elena is widowed and has four adult children. To make a living, Elena owns and operates a business making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling ice cream bars in the local community. Elena has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Elena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be Elena's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Melania De Jesus

texts.es: La señora Melania se desempeña como es en la venta de ropa tiene 37 años de edad, Ante la necesidad de obtener ingresos para solventar en parte los gastos de su familia se dedica a la venta de ropa trabaja todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche algunas veces deja al crédito y cobra todos los fines de semana. Este crédito es para comprar más de sus productos ya que tiene pedidos, va a comprar productos de oferta. Sus sueños son de ampliar su actividad ya que su negocio ha dado resultado.
texts.en:
Melania is 37 years old and sells clothes in order to make money to help cover her family's expenses.  She works every day from 8 in the morning until 9 at night.  Sometimes she leaves her items on credit and collects payment on the weekends.

This loan will be used to buy more items since she has orders pending.  She will buy items which are on offer.  Her dream is to expand her business since it has worked out.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Masrur

texts.en:
Masrur owns a small kiosk and sells household supplies at the central city market. He started this business three years ago. The goods he sells are in high demand and his business is going well. Masrur is a hard-working person and he would like to develop his business even more. Masrur would like to get a loan of $1500 USD to increase the inventory. He hopes that this loan will be another small step in his business growth. Masrur's goal is to have a stable source of income for his family.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history. It was a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing goods to increasing product range

loans.name: York

texts.en: York S. sells a few wares in front of her home. She sells the items like soft drink, sweets for kids, and some cooking supplies. Besides this selling business, York S. is also a local farmer. York S. owns a big farm that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows various crops on it. She currently plants a peanut crop and she estimates that she will harvest it within the next two months when the plants mature. York S. will use the income from selling her mature produce to better meet her family’s needs. Her husband helps her to grow crops. York S. has another farm that she owns, but she is still not planting crops on it. She hopes to use his Kiva loan to hire a machine to plow farmland and to buy more peanut seeds for planting.

loans.use: To hire a machine to plow farmland and to buy more peanut seeds for planting.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Agustin; el tiene 56 años de edad y es casado y tiene 6 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como constructor, el es maestro de construcción que hace diferentes obras como casas y edificios, el socio por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere construir su casa. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción para construir su casa.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "Hardworking Mothers". The communal bank is located in the district of Cusco. It is located in the province and department of Cusco. 

His name is Augustin. He is 56 years old, he is married and he has 6 children. He alternates his daily activities with his work as a construction worker. He is a master construction worker and he takes on various projects, including building houses and buildings. Through his business she is able to provide for his children. He wants to build a house. He requests a loan to purchase construction materials to build a house. 

He is very happy to have a loan and he is committed to making his loan payments.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 46-year-old divorced woman from Lebanon. She lives on her own. In 2005, she started to work as a clothing seller from her house and from time to time, she passes by her client’s houses to offer them her products. In parallel, she has worked in a vegetable shop for one year. It’s very common in Lebanon to have multiple jobs to cover expenses. 

Today she is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional products to increase her sales, allowing her to have better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase additional products

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma S. is from the village of Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya.  She is 43 years old and married. To make a living, Thelma owns & operates a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Thelma has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Thelma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Thelma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 24,000 PHP from ASKI. That loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Thelma is requesting a new loan of 26000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Thelma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Topurchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Margaret Wangui

texts.en: Margaret K. is 48 years old, married, and has three children. She is a farmer and has been in the business for 10 years with an income of about 27,000 KES per month. This is Margaret's third loan from KADET LTD; she has successfully repaid her previous loans. She intends to use this loan to buy more pigs to rear and sell later at a profit. Margaret plans to use the anticipated profit to build a greenhouse. She hopes to be a leading greenhouse farmer and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To purchase pigs

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
El Señor Samuel V. tiene una carnicería en el mercado municipal Nro. 1, posee un local muy bien surtido desde hace un cierto tiempo y solicitó el préstamo para comprar más variedades de carnes, pollos y embutidos en su negocio ya que posee mucha demanda de mercaderías.
El es muy sacrificado y comenzó con muy pocos productos hace 11 años en el rubro, sin embargo, hoy día posee un puesto de venta de carne muy bien surtido, pero necesita del préstamo para adquirir mayor variedad y calidad de las carnes que ofrece.
El Sr. Samuel no sólo desea ampliar su negocio en cuanto a ganancias sino que busca el progreso económico de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Samuel V. has a butcher shop in Municipal Market #1.  He has had a very well stocked locale for some time now and asked for the loan to buy a greater assortment of meats, chicken and cured meats for the business since demand for such merchandise is high.

He is very dedicated and started out with just a few items 11 years ago.  However, today he has a meat stand that is very well stocked but he needs the loan to acquire meats in greater variety and of better quality to sell.  

Samuel doesn’t only want to expand the business with respect to profits but also seeks his family’s economic progress.

loans.use: to buy meats.

loans.name: Danaya. Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe DANAYA sont des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 36  ans, et ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à Mancourani I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
ASSETOU T. fait le commerce de fruits dans ce groupe de femmes DANAYA. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  4 paniers d ‘oranges, 20 régimes de bananes, 5 cartons de pommes, une trentaine de papayes. Elle s’approvisionne à Sikasso ville et environnants. Elle les revend au marché de Mancourani I dans la ville de Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 65.250FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en: The four members of the Danaya group are all married women who are 36 years old with 2 children each. They live in polygamous families in Mancourani, one of the most popular quarters of Sikasso town (the third largest administrative region of Mali). They are on their ninth loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance organisation in order to better meet their customers' demands. Assetou T. is a member of the Danaya group and sells fruit for a living. She intends to use her loan to purchase four baskets of oranges, 20 bunches of bananas, 5 crates of apples and around thirty papayas. She sources her goods from Sikasso town and from the neighbouring areas, and re-sells them at the Mancourani market in Sikasso, as well as selling to her family. She takes cash sales from a customer base is made up of men and women. She aims to generate average monthly profits of 65,250 FCFA; some of this will be used to pay back her loan and its interest, and the rest will be put aside as savings.

loans.use: To purchase fruit

loans.name: Rossi

texts.es: La señora Rossi es comerciante de condimentos y especies al por mayor repartiendo por distintos mercados, con los ingresos que obtienen se mantienen. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de mas especies como, orégano, aji, comino, pimienta, etc. Vive en anticretico ubicada en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz, es divorciada y tiene cuatro hijos. La cliente se encuentra muy contenta con los créditos que obtuvo ya que le ayudo a mejorar la calidad e vida de su familia, pues esta es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito de IMPRO y la segunda que se canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rossi is a condiment and spice wholesaler who sells throughout different markets.  She supports her family with her income.  She plans to use the loan to buy more spices such as oregano, red pepper, cumin, pepper, etc.  

She lives in rental property in the Alto San Pedro area in the city of La Paz.  She is divorced and has four children.  This is her fifth loan through IMPRO and second through KIVA.  She is very satisfied with how the loans have helped her and her family improve their lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy oregano, red pepper, cumin, pepper and other spices to sell in the city markets

loans.name: Misael

texts.es: Misael tiene 32 años, natural del distrito de Quimbiri; es un hombre campechano y trabajador vive en su propia casa y se esfuerza al máximo por sobresalir y dar lo mejor a su futura familia. Misael desde muy niño sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar en la chacra, es por ello que es conocedor del arduo trabajo en el campo, Misael es campesino cuenta 08 hectáreas de terreno cultivados con plantas de cacao y café. Viene trabajando 10 años en sus propias tierras, En tiempos de cosecha cuenta  con el apoyo de los jornaleros quienes se encargan de cosechar y trasladar los frutos extraídos a los centro de acopio de su ciudad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos de las plantas; ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Sin embargo en temporada de invierno, debe procurar cuidar sus plantas de la plaga de insectos, así con de las lluvias constantes. Para el futuro anhela ampliar sus plantaciones de cacao de manera tecnificada. Este es su 12avo crédito con MFP, es conciente que el préstamo le será de mucha utilidad. En su banco comunal es un socio muy solidario. Con el crédito solicitado comprará abono y fertilizantes para mejorar sus campos de cultivo.
texts.en:
Misael, 32, is from Quimbiri district.  He’s a good natured, hard working man living in his own house.  He puts in the maximum effort to stand out and provide the best for his family.

From a very early age his parents taught Misael to work the fields so he's cognizant of hard work in the fields.  Misael is a farmer and has 8 hectares of land planted with cocoa beans and coffee.  He’s been working his own lands for 10 years.  During harvest time he hires day workers that help him harvest and transport the picked fruit to the city’s gathering center.  What he enjoys the most about his work is harvesting the fruit because he feels the long months of hard work are rewarded.  However, in winter he has to guard his plants against insect infestations and the constant rain.  In the future he’d like to technologically expand his cocoa bean crops.

This is his 12th loan with MFP; he’s conscious that the loan will be of great use.  He is a very supportive member of his communal bank.  He will use the requested loan to buy manure and fertilizer to improve his farmland.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Wycliffe Keya

texts.en:
28-year-old Wycliffe Keya A. is from Mahanga.  He is married to Caroline, and they have two children who are both in school.

Wycliffe has a livestock business that he has been running for the past 10 years.  He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to it by a friend. He intends to use the money to buy more livestock worth KES 20,000. The profits will be used to provide for the family's needs and invested back into the business.  His dream is to see his business grow and diversify into farming in the future.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to add to his stock.

loans.name: Mwito Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kakuru est entrepreneur, leader du groupe d’affaire « Mwito »,  âgée de 39 ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants. Son mari est un chômeur, sans emploi. La cliente est vendeuse petits poids, haricots et autres denrées alimentaires au marché central de Virunga.  Il ya 10 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle vient de réaliser 5 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Elle démarra son business avec  50$ reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec  d’autres denrées alimentaires (50 kg petits poids, 50 kg de haricots, etc.) à marchander.  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, scolariser ses enfants et construire une maison.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire «  Mwito» est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en: The client, Kakuru, is an entrepreneur, leader of the Mwito business group, 39 years old, married, and a mother of 7. Her husband is unemployed. The client sells peas, beans and other basic foods at the central market of Virunga. She’s been doing this for 10 years. She just fulfilled 5 loans with Hekima. She started her business with $50 from her husband. This new loan will help her stock up with other basic foods (50 kg of peas, 50 kg of beans, etc.) to sell. In addition, she envisions growing her business, sending her kids to school, and building a house. The client thanks Hekima for their actions to help the poor which are excluded from classic banks. It is worth noting that the Mwito business group is mostly female.

loans.use: to buy 50 kg of peas, 50 kg of beans, etc.

loans.name: Orlandina

texts.es:
La señora Orlandina, habita en Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Estelí, tiene 45 años de edad, esta casada, tiene un hijo, ella es comerciante vende ropa y zapato lleva 10 años en este negocio. Ella se fue a los Estados Unidos en el año 1988 trabajo y ahorro, de regreso su pueblo compro su casa  y una finca además puso una tienda de ropa y zapatos la cual ella misma administra y atiende con ayuda de su esposo. 
Solicito el crédito para comprar zapatos, con el objetivo de mantener surtida su tienda de nuevos productos para ofrecer, atraer más clientes, mejorar sus ventas y tener un buen record crediticio. En sus planes futuros ella desea poner un salón de belleza, dedicarse a vender zapatos pues dice que tiene más ganancia la venta de este producto. Su meta próxima es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio.
texts.en: Orlandina lives in Pueblo Nuevo, municipality of Estelí, Nicaragua. She is 45 years old, married and has a son. She has sold clothing and shoes for the past 10 years. She want to the United State in 1988 to work and save, and upon returning to her town she bought her home and some land and set up her store, which she herself administers and tends to with the help of her husband. She is requesting the loan to purchase shoes, with the objective to keep her store stocked with new products to offer, to attract more customers, to increase her sale and to have a good credit history. In the future, she hopes to set up a beauty salon and dedicate herself to selling shoes, since she says she makes more profits selling that product. Her next goal is to improve her business' infrastructure.

loans.use: to purchase shoes

loans.name: Mendbayar

texts.en:
Mendbayar is a widow who lives with her son in a house in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She manages a food market at a rented stall at a local market. With 3 years of business operations, she has been able to stabilize her business and is planning to expand it in the future. In addition, she operates a travel business at Terelj, one of the beautiful sites of Mongolia. 
Now her business is quite profitable, which allows her to contribute her earnings for the improvement of her living conditions. She is a hardworking lady who says, "Even though I have reached sixty, I am doing my best to help my son to lead a better life." She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Tserenhuu

texts.en: Tserenhuu is 51 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Narantuul area of Ulaanbaatar city. Her two children, aged 10 and 13, go to a secondary school. She manages a men's clothing business with the help of her husband. She started her business in 1999. They purchase stock 1-2 times a month. Now their working capital exceeds 1,300,000 MNT and she earns 65,000 MNT monthly. She is a hardworking woman who says, "I want to have my land certificate soon." She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothing for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing

loans.name: 68 Thieu Do Group

texts.en:
Van is 41 years old and married. She has two children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

Van is the group leader of the 68 Thieu Do solidarity group, which consists of seven members.
 
Van has a retail business selling dry food. Van has been involved in this business for seven years. The main hardship that Van faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase household commodities to resell.

This is Van's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Van hopes to make enough money to provide for her children and for her family to be healthy and happy and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase household commodities to resell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter, 26, is a hardworking and honest businessman. He is married and blessed with two children who go to school. For the last year, he has been operating a cafeteria to make a living. Previously, he was employed. His dream and aspiration is to be an owner of a restaurant. He is requesting a loan of 15,000 Kenya shillings to buy two tanks of water, two tables and two cooking pots. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has learned the art of saving.

loans.use: To buy two tanks of water, two tables and two cooking pots

loans.name: Marina Antonia

texts.es: La señora Marina es cliente de nuestra institución, uno de sus mayores desafíos recientemente es el precio de sus productos, ya que están cada día más caros. Tiene tres hijos, pero ellos trabajan de manera independiente, ella siempre ha trabajado para proporcionarle los ingresos necesarios. Su actividad es la venta de nacatamales y cosa de horno, gracias a su actividad ella con su familia están saliendo adelante el préstamo que están solicitando es para la compra de hojas, masa, cerdo bolsas entre otros productos.
texts.en: Sra. Marina is one of our customers.  A recent challenge is the cost of the supplies she needs for her business, supplies that are becoming more expensive by the day.  She has three children, all grown and independent.  She has always worked to earn what she needs to live.  Sra. Marina operates a prepared foods business, making and selling nacatamales and other oven-prepared foods.  Thanks to the business, she and her family can support themselves.  She will use this loan to buy dough, pork, bags and other supplies she needs for the business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her prepared foods business.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 35 years old and lives in the town of Arua in the Luweero region of Uganda.  He is married and has 4 children.  Three of his children are currently in school.  David has a business selling timber, which he has had for 7 years.         

To help expand his business, David has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase timber for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, David hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, David hopes to expand his business.     

David is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase timber for resale
